Firefighters gain ground on Lassen County blazes	美国加州拉森县山火得到控制
Firefighters are gaining ground against two wildfires that have burned more than 30,000 acres in Lassen County, northeast of Sacramento.	位于美国加州萨克拉门托县东北部的拉森县日前爆发了两场山火，过火面积已超 12,141 公顷，目前消防员仍在奋力扑救。
The Gold fire, which started south of Adin, is 40% contained as it continues to threaten homes and ranches as well as agriculture, livestock and timber operations, Cal Fire officials said in an update Saturday morning.	加州消防部门表示，截至周六早上，阿丁地区南部爆发的 “Gold” 山火仅有 40% 得到控制，仍有大量房屋和牧场面临大火威胁，可能对当地农业、畜牧业及木业造成极大影响。
After burning for four days, the fire has chewed through 21,000 acres, destroyed seven homes and sent two firefighters to the hospital.	火势已持续四天，烧毁约 8,498 公顷土地和七所房屋，并造成两名消防员受伤送医。
Overnight, firefighters took advantage of milder conditions to build and reinforce control lines.	消防员连夜利用有限条件打通防火线并进行加固。
But gusty winds and low humidity are expected through Saturday.	但据天气预报显示，当日为大风、低湿度天气。
West of Susanville, a smaller fire known as the Hog fire has destroyed two structures and consumed about 10,000 acres.	苏珊维尔西部爆发的 “Hog” 山火已烧毁两栋建筑和约 4,047 公顷土地。
The fire settled down overnight as firefighters worked to mop up and strengthen control lines, according to the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection.	加州森林及防火局表示，经消防员彻夜打通和加固防火线，火势已得到控制。
By Saturday morning, it was 45% contained and had been burning for six days.	截至周六早上，山火已持续六天，45% 的火势得以控制。
In the daytime heat, with temperatures above 90 degrees in the Susanville area, smoldering patches were at risk of flaring up.	由于苏珊维尔地区日间气温超 32.2 摄氏度，部分地块存在阴燃风险。
While some residents are being allowed to return to their homes, some areas in both fire zones remain under mandatory evacuation orders.	虽然部分居民可陆续返家，但两个火场仍有部分区域受强制疏散令管控。
The two firefighters injured in the Gold fire have been released from the hospital.	在 “Gold” 山火救援行动中受伤的两名消防员已平安出院。
Scotland-England Union Chain Bridge is 200 years old	苏格兰-英格兰联合链桥历经 200 年岁月
A bridge linking Scotland and England has turned 200 years old ahead of a £10m renovation.	连接苏格兰和英格兰的一座大桥如今已有 200 年历史，并且，将有 1,000 万英镑的资金投入到其整修工作中。
The Union Chain Bridge crosses the River Tweed from Fishwick in the Scottish Borders to Horncliffe in Northumberland.	这座联合链桥横跨特威德河，连接苏格兰边境的菲什威克和诺森伯兰郡的霍恩克利夫。
When it opened in 1820, it was the longest wrought iron suspension bridge in the world with a span of 449ft (137m).	这座桥于 1820 年投入使用，跨距长达 449 英尺（137 米），是当时世界上最长的锻铁吊桥，
It was also the first vehicular bridge of its type in the UK.	同时也是英国第一座该类型的行车桥。
The bridge was designed by English Royal Navy officer Capt Samuel Brown.	这座桥由英国皇家海军军官 Samuel Brown 上校设计。
He patented and produced wrought iron chains after being affected by the loss of Royal Naval ships which had broken free from ropes.	由于曾因船体挣脱绳索损失过多艘军舰，因此，他制造出锻铁链并申请了专利。
Friends of the Union Chain Bridge and the Institution of Civil Engineers (Ice) Scotland have been marking the crossing's bicentennial.	联合链桥之友组织 (Friends of the Union Chain Bridge) 和苏格兰土木工程师协会 (ICE) 正在庆祝它的两百周年纪念日。
Robert Hunter, of the friends group, said: "This is truly one of the most historic bridges in the world and a fascinating piece of engineering.	联合链桥之友组织的 Robert Hunter 表示：“这座桥是名副其实的世界上历史最悠久的大桥之一，同时也是一项了不起的工程。
"We had planned a number of celebrations to mark the occasion, but unfortunately they have had to be postponed.	我们原本计划了多项庆祝活动来纪念这一时刻，但目前不得不推迟。
"However, the fact that work is shortly going to begin on the £10m renovation is the best birthday present possible and will ensure generations to come will be able to enjoy the bridge in all its splendour."	但不管怎么说，即将展开的 1,000 万英镑的整修工程或许才是最好的‘生日礼物’，而且这让之后的几代人都能经历它的辉煌。”
Ice Scotland director Hannah Smith described the bridge as an "often-overlooked" part of Scotland's engineering heritage.	土木工程师协会主席 Hannah Smith 认为这座桥是苏格兰工程遗产中常常被忽略的部分。
She said: "We know it is renowned the world over and it is fantastic that work will shortly commence on its renovation."	她说：“我们都知道它享誉世界，而且最棒的是，相关的整修工作很快就会展开”。
North Korea declares state of emergency as Covid-19 case reported	朝鲜开成发现新冠疑似病例并实施紧急状态
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un convened an emergency politburo meeting after a person suspected of having Covid-19 returned from South Korea after illegally crossing the border this month, state media said on Sunday.	据朝中社周日报道，朝鲜领导人 Kim Jong-un 出席并主持政治局紧急扩大会议，宣布在开成实施紧急状态，此前一名疑似感染新冠肺炎的人员从韩国偷越国境进入朝鲜。
If confirmed, it would be the first case officially acknowledged by North Korean authorities, who have so far said the country has no confirmed cases of coronavirus.	若被确诊，这将是自新冠疫情暴发后朝鲜官方确认的首例病例，此前，据朝鲜官方说法，未在该国境内发现感染病例。
Kim declared a state of emergency and imposed a lockdown on the border city of Kaesong, calling it a "critical situation in which the vicious virus could be said to have entered the country," state news agency KCNA reported.	据国家通讯社朝中社报道，Kim 获悉情况后下令封锁了开城市，宣布在该地区实施紧急状态，并称之为“可以猜测该传染性极高的病毒已进入朝鲜境内的危急情况”。
According to KCNA, a person who defected to South Korea three years ago returned across the fortified border that divides the two Koreas with symptoms that suggested Covid-19.	报道指出，一名三年前逃往韩国的“脱北者”非法越过朝韩边境返回朝鲜，经检查发现该非法越境者疑似感染新冠病毒。
"An emergency event happened in Kaesong city where a runaway who went to the south three years ago, a person who is suspected to have been infected with the vicious virus returned on 19 July after illegally crossing the demarcation line," KCNA said.	朝中社报道称：“开成市发生紧急情况，一名三年前逃往韩国的“脱北者”于 7月 19 日非法越过朝韩边境返回该市，此人疑似已感染新冠病毒。”
KCNA did not specifically mention whether the individual had been tested, but said an "uncertain result was made from several medical check-ups of the secretion of that person's upper respiratory organ and blood," prompting officials to quarantine the person and investigate anyone he may have been in contact with.	朝中社的报道并未提到是否对此人进行了检测，只是说“经多次检查此人的上呼吸道分泌物和血液，结果判断其为新冠肺炎疑似病例”，相关报道还呼吁防疫机关对该越境者采取隔离措施，并追踪与其接触过的所有人员。
North Korea has received thousands of coronavirus testing kits from Russia and other countries, and imposed strict border closures.	自疫情以来，朝鲜已收到俄罗斯等国家提供的数以千计的新冠病毒检测试剂，并实施了严格的边境关闭措施。
Thousands of people in the secretive nation were quarantined, but restrictions had recently eased.	目前数千人已被隔离，但最近限制有所放宽。
In recent weeks, North Korea has also stepped up a campaign criticising defectors to South Korea as "human scum" and calling for South Korea to crack down on groups that send propaganda messages and food aid into the North.	最近几周，朝鲜还组织了一场运动，批判那些逃往韩国的“脱北者”为“人渣”，并要求韩国停止向朝鲜发放宣传材料和粮食援助以鼓动民众脱北。
Kim ordered an investigation into the military units along the border where the person was suspected of crossing to "administer a severe punishment and take necessary measures."	Kim 下令对越境事件案发地区的部队进行深入调查，“严惩相关涉事人员，并采取相应措施”。
Threats to Australian democracy are closer to home than China	想比中国，澳大利亚民主制度面临的威胁更加迫在眉睫
But a series of recently passed or pending measures in the Commonwealth Parliament give rise to concerns about our own, home-grown authoritarianism.	联邦议会近期通过或审议中的一系列措施引起了人们对本土集权主义的担忧。
They include a roll out of facial recognition technology, forcing technology companies to decrypt information held on their customers" computer systems, forcing technology companies to provide access to their customers" cloud-based information without notification to the owner of the information and extending ASIO's compulsory questioning powers.	这些措施包括推广面部识别技术、强制要求技术公司解密客户的计算机系统中保存的信息、强制要求技术公司在不通知信息所有者的情况下提供访问客户云端信息的权限，以及扩大澳大利亚安全情报局 (ASIO) 的强制询问权。
These measures raise serious questions about the border between citizens and government, but the ASIO Bill is particularly worrying.	这些措施导致人们对公民与政府之间的边界问题产生强烈质疑，《ASIO 法案》则尤其令人感到不安。
Unlike any of the other Five Eyes countries - United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and New Zealand - in the wake of September 11, ASIO was given power to compulsorily question people for up to seven days in relation to terrorism offences.	与其他五眼联盟国家（美国、加拿大、英国和新西兰）不同的是，在 911 事件之后，澳安全情报局有权对牵涉恐怖主义行为的人员进行为期最高 7 天的强制性询问。
While it might be accepted that the extreme violence associated with terrorism offences justifies extraordinary powers - extreme violence at least offers a bright line border around these extraordinary powers.	虽然人们可以接受采取非常手段来应对与恐怖主义相关的极端暴力行为，但极端暴力行为至少为这些非常手段划出了一条明确的界线。
That certainly cannot be said about the "sweeping and vague" definitions used in this bill to trigger the compulsory questioning power: dealing with information which prejudices Australia's "political, military or economic relations with another country"; or activities in collaboration with a foreign power which are clandestine or deceptive and are "detrimental to Australia's interests."	这显然指的不是用法案中如下“笼统和模糊”的定义来启动强制询问权：处理有损澳大利亚“与其他国家之间的政治、军事或经济关系”的信息；与国外势力联手进行的秘密或欺骗行为以及“有损澳大利亚利益”的行为。
It is hard to imagine more "sweeping and vague "national security" legislation" than this.	很难想象还有哪些国家安全“立法”比这一条法案更为“笼统和模糊”。
ASIO would be allowed to compulsorily question anyone about these things - not just suspected offenders.	不仅仅是嫌疑人，澳安全情报局将有权针对这些情况强制询问任何人。
This includes journalists, business people, university academics and staff, lawyers, citizens, residents and visitors.	询问对象包括记者、商人、高校学者和工作人员、律师、公民、居民以及游客。
ASIO would simply have to show the questioning would "substantially contribute to the collection of intelligence" about foreign interference, which seems to be the main target of the bill.	澳安全情报局只需要证明询问“极其有助于”有关海外干预的“情报收集”——这一点似乎是该法案的主要目的——
The person could then be questioned for up to 40 hours (not including breaks).	即可对某人进行最高 40 个小时的询问（不包含休息时间）。
If the person refused to attend, they would be arrested.	拒不接受询问的人将会被拘捕。
Refusal to answer or giving false or misleading answers would carry a maximum five year sentence.	拒绝回答或是提供错误或误导性信息，将面临最高五年的监禁。
Rules that are fundamental in our legal systems - indeed protected by the constitution in the United States - are overturned by this bill.	这条法案推翻了我国法律体系中的受到美国宪法保护的基本规则。
People - including people already facing charges - will be compelled to provide evidence that may then be used to prosecute them.	人们（包括已经面临指控的人）将被迫提供证据，而这些证据可以用来对他们进行起诉。
They could have a lawyer present, but the lawyer would be confined to clarifying questions that were ambiguous or unclear.	他们可以有一名律师在场，但律师只限于对模棱两可或不清楚的问题进行澄清。
The new bill transfers the decision to issue a questioning warrant from a judge to the Attorney-General.	新法案将签发询问令的决定权由法官移交给司法部长。
As pointed out by the Inspector-General of Intelligence and Security, this "departs from the trend for increased requirements for external authorisation in other Five Eyes jurisdictions."	正如情报和安全监察长指出，这一法案“与五眼联盟其他国家对外部授权提高要求的趋势背道而驰”。
It also breaches the separation of powers principle that courts scrutinise the actions of executive government.	它也违背了三权分立原则，该原则要求法院审查政府行政部门的行为。
The new bill also proposes to expand the questioning power to children who are at least 14 years old, but only to those engaged or likely to engage in activities prejudicial to the protection of Australia and people from politically motivated violence.	新法案还提出，将询问权扩大到覆盖 14 周岁以上的青少年，前提是这些人已经从事或可能从事不利于保护澳大利亚和人民免受出于政治动机的相关暴力活动。
Even if our intelligence agencies were the best in the world, conferring a power to compulsorily question anyone about information which "prejudices Australia's economic relations with another country," or activities which are "detrimental to Australia's interests" is beyond the pale.	即使我们的情报机构在全世界首屈一指，赋予他们权力来强制性询问关于“有损澳大利亚与其他国家之间的经济关系”的信息或“有损澳大利亚利益”的行为都让人无法接受。
We stand alone.	我们孤立无援。
No other Five Eyes country goes so far, not even for terrorism offences.	即使是在发生恐怖主义行为的情况下，其他五眼联盟国家也没有如此过界。
Genuinely liberal democracies guard against authoritarian measures.	真正自由的民主国家不会采用专制措施。
The conduct of our security agencies in relation to the bugging of the East Timor parliament, the trials of Witness K and Bernard Collaery, the secret trial and imprisonment of a former intelligence officer, the recent search warrants executed on two journalists, and the prospect of charges against one of them in relation to stories on suspected murders by Australian soldiers in Afghanistan show why we should not be lowering our guard.	我国安全机构的种种行为——例如窃听东帝汶议会、审讯证人 K 和 Bernard Collaery、秘密审讯和羁押前情报人员，近期对两名记者实施搜查，并且其中一名记者还因报道了澳大利亚士兵在阿富汗涉嫌谋杀而面临指控——都在提醒我们不能放松警惕。
Bodies of mother, 2 infants found in car submerged in pond	浸泡在池塘中的车里发现一位母亲和两名婴儿的尸体
AUGUSTA, Ga. -- Authorities pulled a submerged vehicle from a Georgia pond and found the bodies of a woman and her twin 10-month-old children inside.	奥古斯塔（乔治亚州）——治安官在乔治亚州的一个池塘里打捞起一辆淹没在水中的汽车，并在车内发现一名女子和两名十个月大双胞胎的尸体。
The Richmond County Sheriff's Office said crews found the vehicle in Mayor's Pond in Augusta on Friday afternoon, The Augusta Chronicle reported.	根据《奥古斯塔纪事报》报道，里士满县治安官办公室称，相关同事于周五下午在奥古斯塔的市长池塘 (Mayor's Pond) 里发现了这辆汽车。
Richmond County Coroner Mark Bowen said all three victims were pronounced dead at the scene.	里士满县法医 Mark Bowen 表示，现场三名受害者均已死亡。
Authorities identified the bodies as 25-year-old Shaquia Philpot and her infant children Caysen and Cassius Williams.	相关当局称，死者为 25 岁的 Shaquia Philpot 以及她的两个孩子 Caysen Williams 和 Cassius Williams。
Officials did not release details about how the family ended up in the pond.	治安官并未透露三名死者死亡的具体原因。
A witness, who was fishing in the area, found the car, Bowen said.	法医 Bowen 说，当时一位正在钓鱼的目击者发现了这辆车。
The bodies were going to be sent to the Georgia Bureau of Investigation for an autopsy.	三具遗体将送往乔治亚州调查局进行尸检。
The case remains under investigation.	案件仍在调查中。
"The Persians" Review: Aeschylus's Ancient Portrait of Defeat	《波斯人》剧评：埃斯库罗斯笔下的失利
There is not much action, barely even a plot, in "The Persians." People just mill about, talking (admittedly rather intensely) about events (admittedly of the tragic kind) that happened far away.	《波斯人》中没有太多动作戏，甚至不到一场。 人物只是绕来绕去，（相当激烈地）谈论在远方发生的（无疑是悲剧性）事件。
Yet this National Theater of Greece production unleashes gale-force sound and fury. At its peak, the show hits like a blow to the solar plexus, taking your breath away - the impact is only slightly dulled by watching online.	然而，希腊国家大剧院却奉献了一出振聋发聩的表演。演出到达高潮时，你会感觉像是胸口挨了一拳一样无法呼吸，这种感觉就算是在线观看也没有多大分别。
First produced in 472 B.C., Aeschylus's "The Persians" is considered the oldest surviving Greek play. This Dimitris Lignadis staging was broadcast live on Saturday from the ancient amphitheater of Epidaurus; in the spirit of the theater, no recording exists online. The venue was originally conceived as part of the city's asclepeion (a healing center) because the Greeks considered the balance between body and soul essential to good health. Let's all wistfully ponder that philosophy.	埃斯库罗斯的《波斯人》是希腊现存最古老的戏剧，最早于公元前 472 年登上舞台。Dimitris Lignadis 的演出于周六从古老的 Epidaurus 圆形剧场进行现场直播，应剧院要求，不提供在线视音频。演出场地曾经是该城 asclepeion（康复中心）的一部分，因为希腊人认为在身体与心灵之间找到平衡对健康至关重要。我们都来认真思考一下这一哲理。
The show deals with the aftermath of Salamis, a naval battle in which the outnumbered Greeks routed the mighty Persian army 2,500 years ago. At a time when our horizons are closing in, it is downright vertigo-inducing to virtually join a live audience in watching (subtitled) live actors all the way in Greece as they perform a millenniums-old play.	该剧讲述了 Salamis 大战之后的故事，这场海战发生在 2,500 年前，希腊人一举击溃了人多势众的波斯军队。当镜头拉近的时候，观众会产生明显的眩晕感，仿佛置身于现场的观众席，观看（有字幕）希腊剧场的演员演出这一流传了上千年的故事。
Aeschylus himself had fought at Salamis, but his play has a twist: This veteran of the winning side set his story among the defeated, casting a fairly sympathetic eye on his recent enemies" distress.	埃斯库罗斯自己参与了 Salamis 之战，但与他的剧本有所出入：这位获胜方的老兵将自己的故事融入战败者之中，对敌人的痛苦投以相当同情的目光。
A chorus of Persian men, wearing long, tan-colored skirts and white button-down shirts, opens the proceedings. They are in their capital city anxiously waiting for news of their king, Xerxes, who is off duking it out with Athens.	最先出场的是身穿褐色长裙和白色纽扣衬衫的波斯男子歌队。他们在都城焦急地等待国王 Xerxes 与希腊人一决胜负的结果。
Enter Xerxes's widowed mother, Queen Atossa (Lydia Koniordou), in a rather large black gown that appears to wear her, rather than the reverse; she is a human in an exoskeleton of fabric, both vulnerable and formidable. Koniordou, who is among Greece's greatest stage actresses, knows the role inside out - she directed and starred in an earlier National Theater of Greece production of "The Persians" that played New York City Center in 2006 - and she anchors the proceedings without seemingly doing much at all. For the most part, she stands in the middle of the circular stage, effortlessly projecting smoldering fury and agonizing sorrow as the scope of the disaster that befell the home troops is revealed.	Xerxes 的寡母 Atossa 太后（Lydia Koniordou 饰演）身着空荡荡的黑袍上场，仿佛是穿着衣服做成的外骨骼，脆弱不堪又令人望而生畏。作为希腊最伟大的舞台剧女演员之一，Koniordou 对这一角色了如指掌，她曾执导希腊国家大剧院早前制作的《波斯人》一剧并担纲主演，该剧于 2006 年在纽约城市中心上演，她推动了故事的发展，但看起来似乎根本没做什么。大多数时候她只是站在圆形舞台中央，在知悉本国军队遭受了没顶之灾后，她不费吹灰之力就表现出了积郁的愤懑和悲痛。
The apprehension everybody was feeling is confirmed, in harrowing details, by a messenger (Argyris Pandazaras) returning from the front. In an absolutely incredible scene, he recounts the battle, whipping himself into a frenzy as the chorus members dance around him and Giorgos Poulios's drone-like score swells to what must have been a deafening level.	从前线返回的信使（Argyris Pandazaras 饰演）通过令人肝肠寸断的细节让观众切实感受到忧惧。他在一个令人难以置信的场景中讲述了这场战斗，歌队成员围着他起舞，在 Giorgos Poulios 震耳欲聋的配乐声中，他陷入癫狂。
Later they are joined by Atossa's dead husband (Nikos Karathanos), summoned from the underworld, and Xerxes (Argyris Xafis), who has somehow escaped alive from the wreckage. Pieces of string on his tunic mark blood (Eva Nathena's exquisite costumes always contribute to the storytelling). The characters lament the lost lives and devastation together, in an act of communal mourning.	后来，从冥府召唤出来的 Atossa 死去的丈夫（Nikos Karathanos 饰演）和幸免于难的 Xerxes（Argyris Xafis 饰演）加入了他们。他长袍上的带子血迹斑驳（Eva Nathena 设计的精美服装总是能为剧情的推动助力）。在集体哀悼的一幕中，这几个角色聚在一起，哀叹逝去的生命和战争的创伤。
Quite a bit of the classical theater we see in the United States attempts to make it more accessible in one way or another. Often this is done with relatively naturalistic line readings, in an effort to make the text less foreign, easier to digest. But Lignadis and his troupe fully embrace declamation, which may sound a little forced to modern ears but highlights the text's rhythmic power. While technically they do not sing, for example, the four lead actors essentially deliver arias, achieving an incantatory power that feels otherworldly.	美国的古典剧院多半会采取一种更通俗易懂的表现手法。他们通常会采用相对自然的念白，让歌词不那么陌生，也更容易理解。但是，Lignadis 和他的剧团使用了慷慨激昂的唱腔，这对于现代观众而言可能有点生硬，却凸显了歌词的节奏力度。从技术层面上来说他们不是在歌唱，譬如四位主演本质上都是在咏叹，发挥出魔咒般的力量，让人有超凡脱俗之感。
We never forget, though, that the play is rooted in emotions that are all too human.	可是我们永远不会忘记，这出戏的根本是极其人性化的情感。
Egypt begins registering data of voters abroad for senate elections	埃及启动参议院选举海外选民登记
The National Election Authority (NEA) on Saturday began registering the data of voters aboard to begin casting their votes in the senate elections to be held on August 9 and 10, according to the NEA's official website.	据国家选举机构（NEA）官网称，该机构于本周六启动了海外选民登记，以便他们能为 8 月 9 日至 10 日举行的参议院选举投票。
Voters must register their data and the diplomatic mission affiliated to their residence abroad on the NEA's website from July 25 until July 31.	选民必须在 7 月 25 日至 7 月 31 日之间登录 NEA 网站，登记自己的数据及其海外住所所属的使领馆。
The NEA also published a video explaining the steps voters can take to cast their vote remotely via email, as part of precautions against the coronavirus pandemic.	为预防新冠病毒传播，NEA 还发布了一段视频，向选民说明如何通过电子邮件远程投票。
The legal period of senate candidate electoral propaganda runs from July 26 until August 8, the NEA said.	NEA 表示，参议院候选人选举宣传的法定时间为 7 月 26 日至 8 月 8 日。
Minister of Emigration and Egyptian Expatriates Affairs Nabila Makram called on Egyptian voters abroad to participate in the election as their constitutional right.	埃及移民和侨民事务部长 Nabila Makram 呼吁海外埃及选民参加选举，履行宪法赋予他们的权利。
Egypt's House of Representatives on June 17 approved a law establishing a senate, which will function as an upper house of parliament.	埃及议会下院于 6 月 17 日通过了一项设立参议院的法律，参议院将行使议会上院功能。
The law passed with a two-thirds majority, with the objection of four MPs.	该法律以三分之二多数票通过，有四名议员投了反对票。
The Senate will consist of 300 members, 100 of whom are elected by a closed list system, 100 elected by an individual system, and 100 members appointed by the President of the Republic.	参议院将由 300 名议员组成，其中 100 人通过不公开名单选举产生，100 人通过个人选举产生，还有 100 人由总统任命。
The term of membership in the Senate will be five years, starting from the date of its first meeting. The new assembly is to be elected during the sixty days preceding the end of its term.	参议院议员任期为首次会议之日起五年。下一届议会成员将在本届任期届满前六十天内选出。
200-Plus Firefighters Respond To Karen Fire Burning In Jurupa Valley - CBS Los Angeles	200 余名消防员加入朱鲁帕谷 “Karen” 山火救援
JURUPA VALLEY (CBSLA) - A wildland fire broke out on Saturday afternoon in Jurupa Valley, leading to a response of more than 200 firefighters.	朱鲁帕谷 (CBS Los Angeles)——周六下午，朱鲁帕谷爆发了一场山火，超 200 名消防员加入到救援行动中。
The Karen Fire was reported just after 3 p.m. on Sierra Avenue and Karen Lane.	下午 3 点，火势仅涉及 Sierra 大道和 Karen 巷。
The fire grew from approximately 5-10 acres to roughly 250 acres as of 8 p.m.	截至晚 8 点，过火面积已从约 2-4 公顷扩大至约 100 公顷。
Containment at last check was at 50% and 225 firefighters from Cal Fire, Riverside County Fire Department, City of Corona Fire Department, and San Bernardino County Fire were on scene battling the fire.	截止最后一次确认，50% 的火势已得到控制，来自加州消防局、河滨县消防局、科罗纳市消防局和圣贝纳迪诺县消防局的 225 名消防员正在现场奋力扑救。
Forward progress on the fire has been stopped but resources are expected to remain overnight to monitor conditions.	目前火势已得以控制，但仍需彻夜监控。
No injuries or structural damages have been reported, and no evacuations have been ordered.	尚无人员伤亡和建筑受损的报道，当局也尚未下达强制疏散令。
Sierra Avenue between Armstrong and the San Bernardino County Line has been closed.	阿姆斯特朗和圣贝纳迪诺线之间的 Sierra 大道已暂时关闭。
Israel coronavirus cases top 60,000 as infections jump	以色列新冠病毒感染人数超 6 万
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - The number of people to test positive for coronavirus in Israel topped 60,000 on Saturday as the government struggles to contain a resurgence in infection rates.	耶路撒冷（路透社）——尽管政府努力控制感染率回弹，以色列新冠病毒检测为阳性的病例仍然超过了 6 万。
The latest daily tally showed 1,770 new infections, bringing the total number of cases to 60,496, the country's health ministry reported.	据该国卫生部报告，最新的每日统计发现了 1,770 例新增感染，病例总数达到 60,496 例。
With a population of nine million, Israel has reported a total of 455 fatalities from the pandemic.	以色列人口总数为 900 万，因为新冠病毒死亡的人数共计 455 人。
Israel was one of the first countries to impose a nationwide lockdown and initially was successful in clamping down on the outbreak.	作为最先实施全国性封锁的国家之一，以色列早期成功遏制了疫情的蔓延。
Daily cases that numbered in the hundreds dropped to low double digits.	日报告病例数从几百下降到了几十。
Concerned about the economic toll, the government eased those restrictions - too quickly, some officials have since acknowledged - and infection rates resurged.	出于恢复经济的考虑，政府放松了管制，感染率回弹，已有部分官员表示此举为时过早。
Renewed sporadic closures of various sectors of the economy have deepened public vexation, sparking daily demonstrations.	经济部门再次零星关闭，导致公众不满情绪加深，引发日常示威活动。
Be wary of gardening gimmicks that look too good	当心那些看似美好的园艺花招
It might be an embarrassing thing for a plant scientist to admit, but I am a total sucker for a garden gimmick.	对植物学家而言，这可能是件难以启齿的事，但我确实十分沉迷于园艺花招。
I like to think it's because I am open-minded or maybe just irrationally optimistic, particularly as many things in the plant world are often extremely counterintuitive.	往好的方面想，我认为自己是一个思想开放，或者说有点非理性乐观的人，而且植物界许多事物通常无法靠直觉判断。
But I am not ashamed to say I have fallen for dozens of them over a lifetime in horticulture.	但我并不耻于承认，我已在这种园艺花招上踩坑无数。
While I firmly believe in the value of trying things out for yourself, if you don't fancy learning the hard way, here are some of the most common garden gimmicks I have come across.	虽然我坚信自己尝试新事物的价值，但如若并不热衷于开启“地狱模式”，可以避开下面我遇到过的一些最常见的“坑人”园艺花招。
First up, and probably the worst offender, grafted tomato-potato plants.	首先，可能是最大的雷区——把番茄嫁接到土豆上。
Hailed as a revolutionary breakthrough, grafting tomato plants on to potato roots is, in fact, an old-school botanical curiosity, dating back to at least the 1920s.	将番茄嫁接到土豆被誉为革命性的突破，事实上，这是一种上世纪 20 年代就有人尝试过的“老一套的玩意儿”。
As they are both from the same family and have broadly similar internal "plumbing," you can indeed create such surgically enhanced marvels.	番茄和土豆同属一科，内部“管道”大致相似，确实可以通过嫁接创造加强版奇迹。
But here's the problem: creating resource-intensive structures like fruits and roots takes up a lot of metabolic energy, and if plants are attempting to do both their limited energies inevitably become split.	但问题是，如果创造资源密集型结构，例如水果和根茎作物，则需要消耗大量能量来代谢，嫁接的植物需要同时满足两种作物的能量需求，就只能将有限的能量分流。
That means the yields of these grafted plants are terrible and nothing like what you see in the marketing pictures.	这就意味着，这些嫁接植物的产量非常低，跟你在宣传图片中看见的全然不同。
Then there is the fact that the crops mature at different rates, so to harvest the spuds you have to kill the plants before the tomatoes have ripened.	另外，作物成熟的时间也不同，要收割土豆就必须扼杀还没有成熟的番茄。
On the subject of marketing imagery, there's a lot of dodgy dealing here, too.	同时，宣传图片也隐含了很多极具迷惑性的花招。
I've seen roses Photoshopped sky blue and fruit trees with a physiologically impossible amount of fruit on their branches in some major catalogues.	我在一些目录中见过用 PS 处理成天蓝色的玫瑰花，还有一些果树结出的果实数量简直不可思议。
I've even seen photos "borrowed" from my Instagram account and used by shopping networks as images of their trial grounds.	有的商家甚至从我 Instagram 上“借”走照片，在网购网站上谎称是他们的试验基地。
Sadly the work of a small minority of cavalier companies mean you have to view advertising images, particularly online, with a very sceptical eye.	这些少部分无良商家的操作，让你不得不以一种怀疑的眼光来审视这些宣传图片，尤其是来自网络的图片。
If it looks too good to be true, it probably is.	如果它看起来好得不像真的，那估计确实如此。
Speaking of which, the colour blue is relatively rare in the botanical world, so if you see a dazzling new heather, orchid or cactus, shining out in the most intense "disinfectant" shade of blue, it's almost certainly been sprayed or dyed.	说到蓝色玫瑰花，蓝色在植物界相对稀少，所以如果你看到新品种的绚丽帚石楠、兰花或仙人掌，在高浓度“消毒剂”下闪着蓝色光芒，那基本肯定是洒药或者染色了。
Which would be fine, so long as vendors made this clear, but they rarely ever do.	如果供应商明确说明了情况，其实也没什么，但他们很少会这么做。
Blue moth orchids will revert back to their original white, but sprayed cacti and heathers, coated in a light-suppressing layer of dye, are unlikely to survive for long.	蓝色蝴蝶兰会变回原来的白色，然而仙人掌和帚石楠涂上一层抑光染料后很快就会枯萎。
Finally, I have to flag up bonsai kits or, even worse, bonsai seeds, that promise miniature trees will sprout from their packets.	最后，我必须曝光承诺能种出微型树的盆景套装，还有比盆景套装更糟的盆景种子。
Bonsai is not a species of plant.	盆景并非一种植物。
It's a training technique used to give the illusion of ancient trees on distant mountaintops.	这是一种修剪技术，让人联想到远山上的古树。
They are almost always started from mature shrubs that are hacked back and new growth wired in place.	盆景一般是经过修剪成熟的灌木，然后再用线引导新的生长方向而形成。
I know I'll keep falling for gimmicks, it's part of the fun of experimentation.	我清楚知道自己会继续迷恋这些园艺花招，这是实验的乐趣之一。
But side-step these ones and you may find one that actually has a chance of living up to its promise.	但避开这些问题，你可能有机会买到和卖家展示一致的实物。
Spain quarantine: Do you need to quarantine in Spain?	西班牙隔离措施：在西班牙需要隔离吗？

"It is still active and it is still deadly. Suppressing the virus, preventing it from being transmitted and protecting public health is our priority."	“病毒依然猖獗而致命。我们的首要任务是抑制病毒、防止病毒传播，并保护公众健康。”
No rules around UK travellers arriving in Spain have been announced, however if you are travelling to Spain you should check for local regulations in your area.	政府目前还未公布关于英国人前往西班牙的规定，但如果你准备前往西班牙，你最好查阅一下自己所在区域的规定。
Spain's deputy emergency health director Maria Jose Sierra said:	西班牙应急卫生副主任 Maria Jose Sierra 表示：
"We have important outbreaks. It could be a second wave. We'll have to see what happens in the next few weeks."	“我们这里爆发了重大疫情。这可能是第二波疫情。我们得关注未来几周的情况。”
Pakistan's Imam-Ul-Haq Declared Fit To Bat After Warm-Up Injury	巴基斯坦队 Imam-Ul-Haq 热身赛受伤后仍可继续参赛

India's PM to attend temple groundbreaking at disputed site	印度总理将出席建于争议地点的寺庙奠基仪式
NEW DELHI (AP) - Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend a groundbreaking ceremony next month for a Hindu temple on a disputed site in northern India where a 16th century mosque was torn down by Hindu hard-liners in 1992, according to the trust overseeing the temple construction.	新德里（美联社）——据监督寺庙建设的信托机构透露，印度总理 Narendra Modi 计划于下月出席建在印度北部争议地点的印度教寺庙奠基仪式，该寺庙原址为一座建于 16 世纪的清真寺，于 1992 年被印度教狂热分子夷为平地。
The ceremony is set for Aug. 5, a date organizers said was astrologically auspicious for Hindus but that also marks a year since the Indian Parliament revoked the semi-autonomous status of its only Muslim-majority state, Jammu and Kashmir.	仪式定于 8 月 5 日举行，组织者称这一天对印度教徒而言是大吉之日，但这一天也是印度议会撤销其唯一的穆斯林占多数的查谟和克什米尔邦半自治权一周年。
The symbolism was impossible to miss for both supporters and opponents of Modi's Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party, or BJP, whose manifesto had for decades included pledges to strip restive Kashmir's autonomy and to build a temple to the Hindu god Ram where the Mughal-era mosque once stood, a site in the city of Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh state that devotees believe to be Ram's birthplace.	Modi 所在的印度教民族主义印度人民党（BJP）的支持者和反对者都不可能错过这个具有象征意义的日子，该党在其宣言中数十年如一日地承诺夺取克什米尔的自治权，并在莫卧儿时代清真寺的原址上建造一座庙宇供奉印度教神祇拉姆，庙宇选址地位于北方邦阿约提亚市，信徒们认为这里是拉姆的出生地。
Because the coronavirus is still rampaging across India, which has reported the world's third-highest caseload, the ceremony will be broadcast live on state television and the number of participants and spectators will be limited, according to Vishwa Hindu Parishad, or the World Hindu Organization, a Hindu nationalist group allied with the BJP.	新冠病毒仍在印度全境蔓延，据报道该国已成为全球感染病例数量第三的国家，有鉴于此，与印度人民党有盟友关系的印度教民族主义团体世界印度教会议（Vishwa Hindu Parishad）称，仪式将在国家电视台现场直播，会限制出席仪式的人员和观众的数量。
The temple will serve as "an enduring and immortal beaming center of social harmony, national unity and integration and awakening of the feeling of Hindutva," or Hindu way of life, the organization's spokesperson Vinod Bansal said in a news release Saturday.	该组织发言人 Vinod Bansal 在周六的新闻发布会上表示，这座寺庙将成为“亘古永恒的社会和谐、民族团结与融合中心，唤醒印度教特性”。
A century-long dispute over the site was resolved last year following the BJP's landslide election victory.	继印度人民党在选举中获得压倒性胜利后，涉及该地点长达一个世纪的争端于去年得到解决。
In November, the Supreme Court ruled in favor of the temple trust, saying that Muslim petitions would be given five acres at an alternative site.	十一月，最高法院做出了有利于寺庙信托的裁定，称将另择他处向穆斯林请愿者划拨五英亩地。
Hindus hard-liners have long contended that Mughal Muslim invaders built a mosque on top of a preexisting temple in the ancient city of Ayodya.	印度教狂热分子长期以来一直声称莫卧儿穆斯林侵略者在阿约提亚古城既有庙宇之上建造了一座清真寺。
A December 1992 riot following the destruction of the mosque sparked communal violence in which about 2,000 people were killed, mostly Muslims.	1992 年 12 月清真寺被拆除之后发生的骚乱引发社区暴力事件，约有 2,000 人丧生，其中大多数为穆斯林。
Meanwhile, the trial in the demolition court case continues to be heard in a special court.	与此同时，特别法庭仍在审理清真寺拆除案件。

Adityanath said the occasion marked the end of a "500-year struggle," PTI reported.	印度新闻信托社报道称，Adityanath 表示这一仪式标志着一场“长达 500 年的纷争”宣告结束。
28-Year-Old Chef Found Dead at San Francisco Mall	28岁厨师被发现死于旧金山一家商场
A 28-year-old chef who had recently moved to San Francisco was found dead in the stairwell of a local mall this week.	近日刚搬至旧金山的一位28岁厨师本周被发现死于当地一家商场的楼梯间。
But the victim's brother says he can't think of anyone who would want to hurt him, saying, "Things were finally going well for him."	但受害人的哥哥表示想不出有谁会想要加害于他，并称“一切终于好起来了。”
The body found at the Westfield Mall Wednesday morning was identified as 28-year-old San Francisco resident Frank Galicia, the San Francisco Medical Examiner's Office said.	旧金山验尸官办公室表示，周三早上于西田购物中心发现的尸体确认为28岁旧金山居民 Frank Galicia。
The San Francisco Police Department said the death was ruled a homicide and an investigation is ongoing.	旧金山警察局称该起死亡案件被裁定为他杀，并正在进行调查。
The victim's brother, Louis Galicia, told ABC station KGO in San Francisco that Frank, previously a line cook in Boston, had landed his dream job as line chef at San Francisco's Sons & Daughters restaurant six months ago.	受害人的哥哥 Louis Galicia 对美国广播公司位于旧金山的电台 KGO 表示，之前在波士顿做流水线厨师的Frank 于六个月前在旧金山的 Sons & Daughters 餐馆找到一份流水线厨师的理想工作。
A spokesperson for Sons & Daughters said they were "shocked and devastated" by his death.	Sons & Daughters 餐馆的一位发言人表示，他们对于 Frank 的死感到“非常震惊”。
"We are a small team that operates like a close knit family and he will be dearly missed," the spokesperson said.	该发言人称，“我们是相处得像亲密无间的一家人的一个小团队，我们将深深怀念他。”
Our thoughts and condolences are with Frank's family and friends at this difficult time.	在这个悲痛的时刻，我们向 Frank 的家人及朋友表达我们深切的同情与哀悼。
Louis Galicia said Frank initially stayed in hostels, but recently, "Things were finally going well for him."	Louis Galicia 称 Frank 起初住在招待所里，但是最近“一切终于好起来了。”
"He found an apartment, he was dating a girl," Louis Galicia told KGO.	Louis Galicia 告诉 KGO：“Frank找到一间公寓，同时在跟一个女孩交往。”
Louis Galicia said he could not think of anyone who would want to hurt his younger brother.	Louis Galicia 表示，他想不出有谁会想要加害他的弟弟。
He was a kind spirit with a big heart.	Frank 拥有善良的心地及宽阔的胸怀。
His way of connecting with the family was always making us a dish, making us dinner," Louis Galicia said.	Louis Galicia 称：“Frank 经常为家人烹饪晚餐。”
He never wanted to be in any kind of altercation.	他从不愿意与家人争吵。
He was the brother that went with the flow.	他是一个随从大家意见的人。
"With everything else that's going wrong with the world, he was that diamond in the rough that was shining bright every day," he said.	Louis Galicia 说：“世上的所有事物都有可能出错，但Frank 称得上是一个每天都发光的外粗内秀之人。”
Anyone with information is asked to call the SFPD Tip Line at 415-575-4444.	有线索人士请拨打旧金山警察局举报电话415-575-4444。
Junior doctors strike: Calls for fresh industrial action	初级医生罢工：呼吁新的劳工行动
Representatives of junior doctors have called on their union to authorise fresh industrial action in their dispute about a new contract.	初级医生代表号召联盟批准其针对新合同纠纷采取新的劳工行动。
The Junior Doctors Committee (JDC) of the British Medical Association (BMA) is to ask its full council to back more industrial action from early September.	英国医学协会初级医生委员会将要求其全体成员自九月初开始支持更多的劳工行动。
The JDC says ministers have failed to address concerns about the contract.	初级医生委员会表示，部长们未解决对于合同的忧虑。
Junior doctors and medical students voted in July to reject a contract deal agreed with the BMA.	初级医生与医科学生于7月份投票抵制与英国医学协会达成的合同交易。
It was rejected by 58% of its members who voted in the ballot.	参与投票的成员中，58%反对该合同交易。
In a letter to members released on Twitter on Thursday night, the JDC's chair Ellen McCourt said the government had remained "persistently silent" on issues which, she said, had resulted in the contract being rejected.	初级医生委员会主席 Ellen McCourt 在周四晚间于推特上发表的一封致成员信中表示，对于导致合同遭到抵制的问题，政府“一贯保持沉默”。
She said: "In light of this, the JDC Executive has voted to reject the proposed new contract in full and to call for formal re-negotiations on all of your concerns."	她表示：“鉴于此，初级医生委员会执行委员会已投票全盘驳回提议的新合同并呼吁就所有担忧重新进行正式协商。”
In response to the government's silence, JDC exec has today made a formal request for a special meeting of BMA Council to authorise a rolling programme of escalated industrial action beginning in early September.	针对政府的沉默态度，初级医生委员会执行委员会已于今日正式要求英国医学协会理事会召开特别会议批准旨在从九月初开始升级劳工行动的一项长期计划。
The dispute has led to junior doctors taking part in six strikes this year, including the first all-out stoppages in the history of the NHS.	该纠纷已导致初级医生今年共参与六次罢工，包括英国国家医疗服务体系历史上的首次全面罢工。
The BMA's junior doctor leader, Dr Johann Malawana, resigned following the vote to reject the negotiated terms of the contract, which the BMA had recommended.	英国医学协会初级医生领导者 Johann Malawana 博士在英国医学协会所推荐的合同议定条款遭到投票抵制之后辞职。
He had told BMA members the deal was a good one that should be accepted, during meetings ahead of the poll of 54,000 junior doctors and medical students.	在54,000名初级医生与医科学生投票之前的会议中，他曾对英国医学协会成员表示，该交易不错，因此应该予以接受。
Following the vote, Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt said the contract would be imposed on medics in England.	投票后，卫生部长 Jeremy Hunt 表示，该合同将在英格兰医护人员中强制实施。
Russia and Turkey: An 'alliance of misfits'?	俄罗斯与土耳其：“格格不入联盟”？
It was a gesture that ended a crisis.	一个手势结束一场危机。
The leaders of Russia and Turkey met on Tuesday to shake hands and declare a formal end to an eight-month long war of words and economic sanctions.	俄罗斯与土耳其领导人周二进行会见，双方握手并宣布正式结束长达八个月的口水战与经济制裁。
But, as Vladimir Putin greeted his Turkish counterpart in the gilded hall of a St. Petersburg palace, I got the distinct impression that Ankara wants this reconciliation the most.	然而，当弗拉基米尔·普京在一座圣彼德斯堡宫殿金碧辉煌的大厅中迎接土耳其总统时，我有种强烈的感觉：此次和解是安卡拉最希望看到的。
There was the handshake, yes.	是的，双方确实握手了。
But Mr Putin's smile looked thin and he was hardly oozing warmth even by his own restrained standards.	然而，即使是按照普京先生一向内敛的标准来看，普京也只是浅浅微笑，几乎未流露出热情之意。
Recep Tayyip Erdogan by contrast talked repeatedly of his "dear friend" Mr Putin - five times, according to one report.	据报道，雷杰普·塔伊普·埃尔多安则五次提到“好朋友”普京。
I lost count.	我记不清了。
He also pledged that relations with Russia would return not just to their pre-crisis level, but even higher.	同时，他承诺与俄罗斯的关系将回归至危机发生前的水平，甚至达到更高水平。
The next day one newspaper here described Mr Erdogan as acting as if nothing bad had ever happened.	次日，此间一家报纸写到，埃尔多安先生则表现的好像什么都没发生一样。
To me, his enthusiasm implied the opposite.	但是，我认为他的热情暗示了某些相反的东西。
But a lingering coolness emanating from Mr Putin showed that Russia's leader has forgotten nothing.	然而，普京先生持续冷淡的态度说明他什么都没有忘记。
In fact, the cause of the crisis was the first thing he mentioned in his opening comments: Turkey's shooting down of a Russian fighter plane on the Syrian border.	实际上，他在开场白中提到的第一件事便是此次危机的原因：土耳其于叙利亚边境击落一架俄罗斯战机。
Moscow's reaction at the time was furious.	莫斯科当时的反应很激烈。
Mr Putin lashed out, accusing Ankara of stabbing Moscow in the back.	普京先生针对该事件进行猛烈抨击，指责安卡拉在背后暗算莫斯科。
The offence was even greater, coming from a supposed friend.	来自所谓朋友的攻击更让人难以接受。
Rebuilding real trust will be hard, perhaps impossible.	双方很难，甚至不可能重新建立真正的信任。
Russian public opinion has also turned since November.	自11月份开始，俄罗斯民意也有所扭转。
For months, state-controlled media conducted a staggering, all-out offensive against Ankara.	数月来，被政府控制的媒体对安卡拉进行了令人震惊的全力进攻。
All of a sudden, it seemed like Turks were to blame for everything.	突然之间，土耳其人似乎要为所有事情负责。
Most serious were accusations from top officials that Mr Erdogan's own family has profited from an illegal trade in oil from areas of Syria controlled by the so-called Islamic State.	其中，最严重的是来自高级官员的指责：埃尔多安先生的家人从所谓伊斯兰国控制的叙利亚地区的非法石油交易中获利。
He's denied that emphatically.	他已断然否认该种说法。
But in St. Petersburg came the official message that it's time to move on.	然而，圣彼德斯堡传来的消息显示，是时候该向前看了。
After all, this meeting only happened because Mr Putin got the apology he demanded from President Erdogan.	毕竟此次会面的前提是普京收到土耳其总统埃尔多安的道歉。
Russia could claim a victory of sorts.	俄罗斯可以宣布胜利了。
For Ankara the benefits of calling a truce are clear.	对于安卡拉来说，休战的好处显而易见。
First and foremost, Erdogan needs all the friends he can get after he was nearly ousted from power last month in a failed coup.	首先，埃尔多安在上个月政变失败后险些被赶下台，因此他需要所有朋友的支持。
Repeat terror attacks on Turkey have clearly shaken him too.	不断的恐怖袭击显然已对他造成很大打击。
There is also an economic motive.	同时也有经济动机。
Russian sanctions have hit hard - particularly the ban on charter flights, which usually carry several million Russian tourists to the Turkish coast each year.	俄罗斯制裁对土耳其打击很大，尤其是禁止每年可输送几百万俄罗斯游客至土耳其海岸的包机服务。
The number has slumped by almost 90%.	该数字已大幅下滑近90%。
As for Russia, tour operators and charter companies here will certainly be relieved when flights eventually resume.	随着航班恢复，俄罗斯的旅行社与包机公司必将松一口气。
They're banking on a late-season rush to the Mediterranean.	他们将迎来季末地中海旅游潮。
And even this week, state TV has been predicting cheaper fruit and vegetables once Turkish agricultural imports are permitted again.	国家电视台甚至在本周预测，一旦土耳其农产品进口重新放开，水果及蔬菜的价格将下降。
"Tourists that way, tomatoes back here," as a report in Vedemosti newspaper phrased it.	莫斯科报纸 Vedemosti 的一篇报道称：“游客去了，番茄回来了。”
But the visit also had additional political value for Moscow.	对于莫斯科来说，此次访问也具有额外的政治价值。
Ankara is angry with the West for what it considers a weak response to the attempted takeover.	安卡拉对于西方世界对接管意图的微弱反应感到愤怒。
Add to that its long-standing grudge at the snail's pace of talks to join the EU and step in Mr Putin - who is keen to capitalise on the chill and chip away at Turkey's ties with the West.	此外，安卡拉对于加入欧盟谈判的缓慢进展及普京的插手长期感到不满，普京热衷于利用政治寒意以及削弱土耳其与西方世界的关系。
The Russian leader certainly won bonus points with Ankara for calling in support of the elected authorities after the attempted coup.	由于在政变失败后拥护当选当局，俄罗斯领导人必将获得安卡拉的加分。
Mind you, that's a given for Moscow which has its own deep-seated fear of regime change.	注意，这对于一直对政权更迭怀抱根深蒂固恐惧的莫斯科来说是一种馈赠。
So the summit at this glitzy, seaside palace allowed Russia and Turkey to present what one analyst described to me as an "alliance of misfits": two countries that feel rejected and mistreated by the West, joining forces.	因此，在这个金碧辉煌的海边宫殿所举行的会面使俄罗斯与土耳其两个被西方世界拒绝与虐待的国家结成盟友，一位分析师将其描述为“格格不入联盟”。
Still, despite the public display of reconciliation, the two still have major differences.	然而，尽管公开和解，但双方仍存在重大分歧。
The key one is Syria, where Moscow has recently been casting itself as peacemaker but where Russia and Turkey back opposite sides.	叙利亚是关键因素之一。莫斯科近日在叙利亚扮演和事佬的角色，而俄罗斯与土耳其却支持相反派别。
It could be telling that after almost three hours of initial talks, the two presidents told a press conference that they hadn't even touched on the topic.	可以预见到的是，在经过近三个小时的初步谈话后，两位总统在发布会上表示，尚未谈及那个话题。
Turkey's president deliberately avoided answering a question on their differences, while Mr Putin chose to underline them.	土耳其总统刻意回避关于双方分歧的问题，而普京则予以强调。
There is no clear consensus on where they can seek common ground on Syria.	双方就如何在叙利亚问题上求同存异未达成明确共识。
But after months of open hostility - and given the potential for utter disaster when Nato member Turkey shot down that Russian fighter jet - it is surely better that the two leaders are at least talking again.	在北大西洋公约组织成员国土耳其击落俄战机所带来的数月公开敌对及引发大型灾难的可能下，两国领导人再次重启对话肯定是件好事。
Royal Bank of Scotland to disappear for customers outside Scotland	苏格兰皇家银行将不再为苏格兰以外客户服务
The brand RBS is to be reduced to a back office role, according to the bank's chief executive.	据苏格兰皇家银行首席执行官透露，银行将简化为一个后勤部门。
Royal Bank of Scotland will disappear for customers outside Scotland.	苏格兰皇家银行将不再为苏格兰以外的客户服务。
Ross McEwan told BBC Scotland that the RBS brand was associated with the bank's global ambitions.	罗斯·麦克尤恩告诉英国广播公司苏格兰分部，苏格兰皇家银行品牌曾经致力于其全球雄心壮志。
It has retreated from them since it nearly collapsed eight years ago and had to be bailed out.	但八年前濒临倒闭，不得不接受救助从那时开始便放弃了那样的追求。
During that time, brand strategists have used 'RBS' to protect other consumer finance brands.	那段时间，品牌策略师使用‘RBS’来保护其它消费金融品牌。
It was backed with millions of pounds in sponsorship of international sport, from Six Nations rugby to Wimbledon champion Andy Murray.	集团曾耗费数百万英镑以赞助橄榄球六国赛和温布尔顿网球锦标赛冠军安迪·穆雷等方式赞助国际体育赛事。
But now, it has been judged right to let more national brands come to the fore.	但是现在，正确的做法是让更多的国家品牌崭露头角。
Royal Bank of Scotland will be used with Scottish customers, but will not be initialised.	苏格兰皇家银行将为苏格兰客户所用，但不会回复原样。
In England and Wales, all RBS references, outside head office and the stock exchange listing, will be changed to NatWest.	在英格兰和威尔士，所有在总部及证券交易所以外的提法将更改为国民西敏寺银行。
The Ulster Bank brand is already used for customers in the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland.	阿尔斯特银行品牌已用于爱尔兰共和国与北爱尔兰自治区的客户。
There are other, smaller brands for private banking, which will get more prominence - Coutts, Adam & Co, Drummond, and Holt's Military Bank.	还有一些其它更突出的较小私人银行品牌，例如顾资银行、Adam & Co、 Drummond 与 Holt's Military Bank。
Mr McEwan was interviewed during a tour of customers and staff in Inverness-shire.	麦克尤恩先生曾在因弗内斯郡客户与员工的参观之旅中接受采访。
He told BBC Scotland: "The RBS brand will end up becoming our investor brand and the one that our staff are employed with, because we are now becoming much more a bank of brands."	他告诉英国广播公司苏格兰分部说：“苏格兰皇家银行品牌将最终成为我们的投资者品牌，同时也是员工受雇品牌之一，因为目前更大意义上我们已成为一个拥有众多品牌的银行。”
As the bank itself became a global brand, RBS became the global brand.	由于该银行本身成为一个国际品牌，RBS也成为全球品牌。
I'm now saying we no longer have global aspirations, we have local aspirations.	目前，我要说的是，我们不再重点关注全球，我们已将目光转向本土。
Each one of those brands will stand for something quite different in their own communities, and our staff will work with customers under those brands.	每一个品牌代表着各自所在行业的不同，而我们的员工通过不同品牌为客户服务。
RBS had already stated that it would not to continue its Six Nations sponsorship, and it has been raising the profile of different brands in its sports sponsorship.	苏格兰皇家银行已表明不会继续赞助六国锦标赛；同时，已努力提升不同品牌在体育赛事赞助的形象。
"The time is right for us to move to the bank of brands, because underneath (we've been asking) how do we focus on making this a better bank for customers?" said the chief executive.	首席执行官表示：“现在到了成为一家多品牌银行的时候，因为私下我们一直在探求如何成为一家更好的服务于客户的银行。”
It would have been very cynical three years ago if we'd said we're going to be a great bank for customers and put those brands out there.	如果三年前我们立志成为一家拥有众多品牌的大银行将备受嘲讽。
But with the work we've been doing, focussing on the customers needs, not our own, I think you're seeing a lot of change.	目前我们重点关注客户需求，并且我相信您已注意到了这些变化。
We can bring those brands back up again, so I think the time is right.	我认为我们可以重新启动这些品牌，而且现在时间正合适。
Frankie Dettori reaches 3,000 winners with victory at Newmarket on Predilection	戴图理凭借 Predilection 在纽马基特的成功取得职业3,000胜
Dettori sprays champagne after a double at Newmarket takes him to 3,000 wins	纽马基特的两场胜利助力戴图理取得职业3,000胜，之后他喷香槟庆祝
Jockey Frankie Dettori secured his 3,000th British winner at Newmarket on Friday.	周五，职业赛马骑师戴图理 (Frankie Dettori) 在纽马基特 (Newmarket) 取得了他的第3,000场胜利。
He brought up the landmark with his second winner of the night at his local track - on Predilection, trained by John Gosden.	他策着出自练马师高仕登 (John Gosden) 之手的 Predilection 在马道上急驰，于当晚收获两场胜利，也借此实现了职业3,000胜。
The 45-year-old Italian is the sixth jockey to reach the landmark in Flat racing.	这位现年45岁的意大利人是第六位在平地赛领域取得这一里程碑的职业赛马骑师。
He follows Sir Gordon Richards, Doug Smith, Lester Piggott, Pat Eddery and Willie Carson.	前五位分别是：哥顿·李察 (Gordon Richards) 爵士、道格·史密斯 (Doug Smith)、柏葛 (Lester Piggott)、魏德礼 (Pat Eddery) 和嘉逊 (Willie Carson)。
Three-time champion jockey Dettori, who earlier won on Ghayyar, said: "It's special."	早前在 Ghayyar 获胜的三届冠军骑师戴图理说：“这很特别。”
I'm very emotional because my family are here as well	我很激动，因为我的家人也在现场
I'm very pleased for it to have happened at Newmarket because this is where I landed 30 years ago.	我对自己在纽马基特取得的成绩感到高兴，因为30年前我就是从这里起步的。
It's not a big meeting, it's not a Royal Ascot - it's a mundane Friday night with 20,000 people.	这不是一场大规模的赛马会，也不是英国皇家爱斯科赛马会 (Royal Ascot)，这只是一个有着20,000名观众的普通的周五晚上。
I'm relieved and very humble.	我很欣慰，也很谦恭。
Dettori soaks up the cheers as he brings in Predilection after victory	戴图理在获胜后牵来了 Predilection，引起了全场欢呼
Two jockeys have reached the milestone in jump racing - champion jockey Richard Johnson and retired 20-time champion Sir Anthony McCoy, who had more than 4,300 victories in a record-breaking career.	在障碍赛领域，有两名骑师取得了这一成就，他们分别是冠军骑师理查德·约翰逊 (Richard Johnson) 和现已退役的20届冠军麦考伊 (Anthony McCoy) 爵士，其中麦考伊爵士在其破纪录的职业生涯中取得了超过4,300场胜利。
Lester Piggott, nine-time Derby winner, 4,493 career wins	柏葛是九届德比赛冠军，在其职业生涯中共取得了4,493场胜利
Frankie is one of the best jockeys of the modern era and it is no surprise he has reached this landmark so few have achieved before him.	戴图理是当代最棒的骑师之一，所以他取得这一里程碑式成就也就不足为奇了，在他之前取得这一成就的人不多。
He is stylish and strong, but it is his tactical nous that sets him apart from others in the weighing room.	他时尚而健硕，但是真正让他在称重室中脱颖而出的却是他在战术上的理性。
He is a fantastic ambassador for racing, his enthusiasm and charisma have been drawing fans to the sport for years.	他是一位了不起的马术大使，多年来，他的热情和魅力为这项运动吸引了大量粉丝。
I said to Frankie a few weeks ago at Epsom he'd have ridden 6,000 winners if he wasn't just a weekend and big-race jockey!	几周前，我在 Epsom 跟戴图理说，如果他不仅仅是一个周末与大赛骑师，他应该已经能取得6,000场胜利了！
Seriously though, Frankie's been riding winners in the UK for the best part of 30 years which is great to see.	说真的，戴图理堪称英国三十年来最好的马术获胜者，这一点太重要了。
He's a lively character which is good for British racing but more than that, he's an incredible jockey.	他性格活泼，这对英国赛马来说是好事，但是除此之外，他还是一位不可思议的骑师。
Frankie Dettori celebrated the milestone with a trademark flying dismount	戴图理以其标志性的跳跃下马动作庆祝这一里程碑
From flying finishes to flying dismounts, Frankie Dettori has been the poster boy of British Flat racing for two decades.	从跳跃冲线到跳跃下马，二十年来，戴图理一直是英国平地赛领域的典型代表。
It has been a rollercoaster ride.	他的职业生涯如过山车一般。
Stacks of big-race winners, including his famous 1996 'Magnificent Seven' at Ascot, but he also survived a plane crash and served a drugs ban.	他获得了多场大赛的冠军，其中包括1996年在英国皇家爱斯科赛马会取得的著名的“七连胜”，但是，他也遭遇了坠机事件，还因服用禁药遭到禁赛。
Three years ago he initially struggled when returning from that six-month suspension, but he showed formidable strength of character to defy the doubters and return to his best.	三年前，当他在六个月禁期结束后重回赛场时，曾一度很吃力。但是，他表现出了惊人的性格优势，并终于重回巅峰，给那些持怀疑态度的人当头一棒。
And he may not be done for some time - Dettori has previously said he would like to carry on competing until the age of 50, at least.	他或许做不了太长时间了——戴图理之前曾说过，他希望至少能参赛到50岁前。
Russia's Putin sacks chief of staff Sergei Ivanov	俄罗斯总统普京解除谢尔盖·伊万诺夫办公厅主任职务
Russian President Vladimir Putin has unexpectedly dismissed his chief of staff Sergei Ivanov.	俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京 (Vladimir Putin) 出乎意料地解除了谢尔盖·伊万诺夫 (Sergei Ivanov) 的总统办公厅主任职务。
Mr Ivanov has been part of Mr Putin's trusted inner circle for many years.	多年来，伊万诺夫先生一直是深得普京先生信任的核心集团的一分子。
The 63-year-old has now been made a special representative for environmental and transport issues.	现年63岁的伊万诺夫如今已被任命为环境与交通问题特别代表。
A statement from the Kremlin said that Mr Putin had "decreed to relieve Ivanov of his duties as head of the Russian presidential administration," but gave no reason.	克里姆林宫的一份声明称，普京先生已“宣布解除伊万诺夫的俄罗斯总统办公厅主任一职，”但是没有给出原因。
Mr Ivanov's deputy since 2012, Anton Vaino, has been appointed as his successor.	2012年开始担任伊万诺夫先生副手的安东·瓦伊诺 (Anton Vaino) 已获任命为他的接任者。
Mr Vaino, 44, is a former diplomat.	瓦伊诺先生现年44岁，是一名前外交官。
Born in the Estonian capital Tallinn in 1972, he graduated from the prestigious Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO) and served in the Tokyo embassy.	他1972年出生在爱沙尼亚首都塔林，毕业于著名的莫斯科国立国际关系学院 (MGIMO)，在东京大使馆工作过。
Later he managed presidential protocol and government staff, the Kremlin website says (in Russian).	后来，他管理总统草案和政府员工，克里姆林宫网站（使用俄语）如是说。
On being appointed, he told Mr Putin: "Thank you for your trust."	获任命后，他对普京先生说：“谢谢您的信任。”
I think the administration's most important task is to support your activity as head of state in terms of drafting laws and control over how your instructions are implemented.	我认为本政府最重要的任务就是支持国家元首起草法律和控制指令实施。
Mr Putin told a Russian TV station on Friday that Mr Ivanov had asked to leave the post, and recommended that Mr Vaino should replace him.	普京先生周五告诉俄罗斯电视台说，伊万诺夫先生自己要求辞职并推荐了瓦伊诺先生来接任自己。
Do the smiles convince?	这样的笑容令人信服吗？
This is a move that has mystified Moscow.	莫斯科对此举感到不解。
Sergei Ivanov has long been one of Vladimir Putin's closest allies and, like him, served in the Soviet security service, the KGB.	长期以来，谢尔盖·伊万诺夫一直是普京最亲密的助手之一，跟普京一样，也在苏联安全局（克格勃）工作过。
As chief of staff he was one of the most powerful men in the country.	作为办公厅主任，他曾是该国最具影响力的人士之一。
In a meeting with President Putin shown on state television both men claimed that the chief of staff was stepping down at his own request.	在国家电视台播出的一次与普京总统的会面上，两人均称是这位办公厅主任自己要求辞职的。
But despite the smiles for the cameras, few here are convinced - especially now, just before parliamentary elections.	尽管在镜头前满面笑容，可是几乎没人信服——特别是在议会选举之前的这个时候。
So is this the fall-out from some kind of power struggle?	所以，这是在某种权力争夺中落败导致的吗？
No-one knows yet.	尚无从得知。
But the official claim - that a man once touted as a potential president, suddenly wanted to run Russia's environmental policy - has been met with great scepticism.	但是，官方说法——一个曾被视为总统候选人的人选突然间选择执掌俄罗斯的环境政策——引来了众多怀疑。
In remarks to Mr Putin, quoted on the Kremlin website, Mr Ivanov said "it's true that in early 2012 I asked you, in a conversation, to entrust me with this very complicated post, even - you could say - troublesome post, for four years.	克里姆林宫网站上引述了伊万诺夫先生与普京先生的对话，他说："是的，2012年初，我曾在一次对话中请求你予以我这个难做的职位，甚至可以说是麻烦的职位，四年的任期。"
Well, it turns out that I've been presidential chief of staff for four years and eight months.	"结果是，我已担任总统办公厅主任四年八个月啦。"
Mr Ivanov took up the post in December 2011.	伊万诺夫先生于2011年12月担任此职。
He served previously as a deputy prime minister and defence minister.	在此之前，他担任副总理和国防部长。
He is a member of the Russian Security Council and a former member of the KGB state security service, like Mr Putin.	他是俄罗斯安全委员会的一员，还跟普京先生一样，也是国家安全局前成员。
In the late 1990s, when Mr Putin was head of the Federal Security Service (FSB), which replaced the KGB, Mr Ivanov was appointed as his deputy.	20世纪90年代末，当普京先生出任联邦安全局（FSB，前身为国家安全局）局长时，伊万诺夫先生被任命为他的副手。
When Mr Putin came to power, he named Mr Ivanov as one of the five people he trusted most.	普京先生上台后，他又指定伊万诺夫先生为他最信任的五人之一。
It was once thought that Mr Ivanov might become president of Russia after Mr Putin's second term, as a third term for Mr Putin would have been unconstitutional.	外界曾一度认为伊万诺夫先生可能会在普京先生第二任期结束后出任俄罗斯总统，因为三连任是违反宪法的。
But that post was taken by another close Putin ally, Dmitry Medvedev.	但是这一职位最终归属于普京的另一位亲密助手德米特里·梅德韦杰夫 (Dmitry Medvedev)。
Mr Putin became prime minister, before returning to the presidency just three-and-a-half years later.	在三年半后重新任职总统之前，普京先生担任俄罗斯总理一职。
Mystery as fish land in Banff garden	神秘鱼惊现 Banff 一花园
A Banff man has appealed for help in identifying fish that have appeared in his garden in Banff.	Banff 的一位居民发现有鱼惊现自家花园，随后发出了求助。
Kevin Bain thinks the 75 fish could be sand eels deposited by a waterspout.	Kevin Bain 认为这75条鱼可能是被海上龙卷风刮来的沙鳗。
Mr Bain, who lives about 500m from the sea, posted footage of the spectacle on Periscope in the hope someone could shed light on the appearance of the two-inch fish.	Bain 先生居住在距离大海约500米的地方，他在 Periscope 上发布了这一奇怪场景的视频，希望有人能为他解释为何会出现这些两英寸长的鱼。
Queensferry Crossing: Bridge now connected to Fife	昆斯费里大桥现已通至法夫
The £1.35bn project is now due to be complete by May 2017	该斥资13.5亿英镑的项目计划于2017年5月完工
Engineers have joined the Queensferry Crossing's north deck and viaduct - meaning the bridge is now connected to Fife.	工程师们已经把昆斯费里大桥 (Queensferry Crossing) 的北桥面和高架桥连接到一起，也就是说大桥如今已通至法夫。
It is the first of four closures between the "deck fans," which are now nearing completion around each of the bridge's three towers.	位于每座大桥三个桥头堡附近的四处“桥面风机”合龙现已接近竣工，而该项目为首个合龙的大桥。
The bridge section from Fife is now 600 metres long and weighs 30,000 tonnes.	起始于法夫的这段大桥长600米，重30,000公吨。
It has 10,000 tonnes of steel and 20,000 tonnes of concrete and 46 stay-cables.	它使用了10,000公吨钢材、20,000公吨混凝土和46根斜拉索。
The £1.35bn project is now due to be complete by May 2017.	该斥资13.5亿英镑的项目计划于2017年5月完工。
Economy Secretary Keith Brown visited the site today and was among the first to walk from the land on to the bridge.	经济部长基思·布朗 (Keith Brown) 今天参观了现场，成为首批登上大桥的人之一。
He said: "This is a historic and symbolic moment in the building of the Queensferry Crossing.	他说："这是昆斯费里大桥建造过程中的一个历史性时刻。"
We're all witnessing engineering on a truly epic scale on this project, with over 30,000 tonnes of concrete and steel used just to build this part of the bridge.	我们都见证了在如此宏大项目上的工程作业，光是建造该大桥的这一段就使用了超过30,000公吨混凝土和钢材。
Despite the massive size and weight of the bridge completing the closure between the viaduct and bridge deck is a delicate operation involving extremely precise tolerances for fit up.	尽管该桥的规模和重量都很巨大，但是完成高架桥和桥面之间的合龙却需要精细作业，需要非常精准的装配。
Overall, nearly 79% of the total bridge deck is now in place, the final section of deck is having its concrete deck cast in Rosyth today, meaning all the deck is ready to be lifted into place on the bridge.	总的来说，近79%的总桥面现已安装完成，最后一段桥面的混凝土桥面今天在 Rosyth 浇注，也就是说所有桥面都已做好就位准备。
Michael Martin, Forth Crossing Bridge Constructors project director said: "The first closure on any bridge project is always a significant milestone.	昆斯费里大桥建造公司项目总监 Michael Martin 说："不管是哪个大桥项目，第一次合龙都是一个重大里程碑。"
On this fantastic project, this closure represents leading edge civil engineering.	就该了不起的项目而言，此次合龙展现出前沿的土木工程技术。
After installing the last road deck section and connecting it to the expanding North Tower road deck, we then had to close the remaining gap on the north - or landward - side.	安装最后一段路面板并将之连接至扩大的北桥堡路面板之后，接下来需要完成北侧或者接近陆地一侧的剩余缺口合龙。
This was done by pulling the northern approach viaduct 700 millimetres southwards.	完成该项作业需把北部高架引桥南移700毫米。
This was a massive and, at the same time, very delicate operation.	这是一次规模巨大的作业，同时也是一次非常精密的作业。
Massive because the viaduct is 222 metres long, weighs approximately 6,000 tonnes and had to be pulled up a gradient of about 3%.	说它规模巨大，是因为高架桥长222米，重约6,000公吨，需要拉出一个约3%的斜度。
Delicate because the tolerances the team were working to were tiny - just a few millimetres either way.	说它精密，是因为工程团队需要确保偏差非常之小，每边只有几毫米。
Happily, it all went very well.	令人欣慰的是，一切都进展得很顺利。
Simone Biles nails all-around gold in women's gymnastics	西蒙·拜尔斯摘得女子体操全能冠军
Forget the pressure.	忘掉压力。
Forget the hype.	忘掉炒作。
Simone Biles is immune to all of it.	西蒙·拜尔斯 (Simone Biles) 不受这一切的影响。
Dynamic on vault.	跳马时充满活力。
Effortless on beam.	平衡木上游刃有余。
Jaw-dropping on floor.	自由体操动作惊艳。
Brilliant all over.	整体表现非常精彩。
And now, finally, an Olympic champion.	现在，终于成为了奥运冠军。
The 19-year-old American gymnast soared to the all-around title on Thursday, putting the gap between herself and the rest of the world on full display under the Olympic spotlight.	这位19岁的美国体操运动员周四摘得了全能冠军，充分在奥运赛场上展示了她在体操方面领先世界的天赋。
Her total of 62.198 was well clear of silver medalist and "Final Five" teammate Aly Raisman and Russian bronze medalist Aliya Mustafina.	她以62.198的总分远超银牌得主、“终极五人组”(Final Five) 队员莱斯曼 (Aly Raisman) 和铜牌得主俄罗斯选手穆斯塔芬娜 (Aliya Mustafina)。
United States' Simone Biles performs on the balance beam during the artistic gymnastics women's individual all-around final at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Thursday.	来自美国的西蒙-拜尔斯于周四在巴西里约热内卢举的2016年夏季奥运会的艺术体操女子个人全能决赛上进行了平衡木表演。
Biles became the fourth straight American woman to win the all-around title and fifth overall while cementing her reputation as the best of her generation and perhaps ever.	拜尔斯帮助美国队在奥运会女子体操个人全能上实现了四连冠，她个人在本届奥运会上共夺得五枚奖牌，进一步印证了她是这一代，也可能是有史以来，最优秀的体操队员。
She burst into tears when her final total was posted and her long journey to this moment ended.	当看到自己总分的那一刻，拜尔斯忍不住流下泪水。她终于结束了这一漫长的旅程。
The achievement puts her in the same league as once-in-a-generation athletes like Michael Phelps who have taken their sports to new heights:	拜尔斯因此跻身像迈克尔-菲尔普斯 (Michael Phelps) 一样的“几十年一遇运动员”的行列，他们将各自领域的体育项目提升到新高度：
Biles has spent the last three years dominating her sport, winning 15 world championship medals - including 10 gold - with routines so astonishing in their mix of ambition and precision that 1984 Olympic champion Mary Lou Retton called her "the greatest gymnast I've ever seen."	拜尔斯最近三年一直称霸赛场，共夺得15枚世界锦标赛奖牌，其中包括十枚金牌。怀揣志向的她每日刻苦训练，以达到更高的精确度。1984年奥运冠军玛莉·卢·雷顿 (Mary Lou Retton) 称：“拜尔斯是我见过的最棒的体操运动员。”
One last test awaited in Brazil, a contest not so much between Biles and the rest of the field but between herself and the burden of oversized expectations.	在巴西还有最后一场比赛，但这场比赛与其说是拜尔斯与其他体操选手的竞争，不如说是她自己与巨大期望压力之间的较量。
Anything less than heading back to her family's home in Spring, Texas, with a fistful of golds would be seen as a disappointment.	如果拜尔斯没有满载金牌回到她位于德克萨斯州斯普林的家，大家一定会非常失望。
United States' Simone Biles, left, and Aly Raisman embrace after winning gold and silver respectively for the artistic gymnastics women's individual all-around final at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Thursday, Aug.	来自美国的西蒙·拜尔斯（左）与莱斯曼相互拥抱，她们在8月份（周四）巴西里约热内卢举办的2016年夏季奥运会的艺术体操女子个人全能决赛上分别获得金牌与银牌。
Biles earned the first one on Tuesday while serving as the exclamation point to retiring national team coordinator Martha Karolyi's going away party.	拜尔斯于周二斩获第一枚金牌，给即将退役的国家队教练卡罗利 (Martha Karolyi) 的欢送会奉上一份惊喜的厚礼。
While Biles insisted she's never looked ahead during her long run at the top, that's not exactly true.	尽管拜尔斯坚称自己在常年占据冠军宝座的过程中并没有计划未来，但事实不完全是这样的。
A portion of her floor exercise routine - the one that includes her signature tumbling pass - is set to Latin music that would fit right at home in the street right outside the Rio Olympic Arena.	拜尔斯自由体操当中的一段——包括她标志性的翻腾串连的那一段，配的是拉丁音乐，而这段音乐正是她在与里约奥运会场馆仅有一街之隔住所里常听的。
It's not a coincidence.	这绝非巧合。
The girl adopted by her grandparents as a toddler and discovered by coach Aimee Boorman's mother during a field trip to the gym where Boorman was coaching has become a force.	这个在婴儿时期被祖父母收养，并在一次体育馆实地考察旅行时被教练艾米·伯尔曼 (Aimee Boorman) 的母亲发现的女孩现已成长为中坚力量。
She hasn't lost an all-around competition since the summer of 2013, a winning streak that should go for as long as Biles wants it to.	自从2013年夏季以来，拜尔斯就没有在全能比赛中失手过，只要想赢，她就一定会赢。
Though Mustafina took a small lead through two rotations, it was a mirage.	穆斯塔芬娜两次旋转后的稍稍领先只是一个幻觉。

She went back in front with a 15.433 on beam - and capped it with a 15.933 on floor.	她的平衡木得分15.433，自由体操得分15.933。
Raisman hugged her gently as they awaited the final score - a mere formality - and tears appeared around Biles' glittery red, white and blue eyeliner when the vision she once wrote in a scrapbook became a reality.	在等待最后比分出来的时候，莱斯曼轻轻抱了一下拜尔斯。当拜尔斯得知自己取得梦寐以求的成绩后，顿时留下了眼泪。
Raisman's performance was a bit of revenge from four years ago, when she tied for third but lost the bronze to Mustafina on a tiebreaker.	莱斯曼的表现有点像是对四年前的复仇，当时她并列第三，但在决胜局中输给了穆斯塔芬娜。
