Government Retires 15 More Senior Tax Officials On Graft Charges	印度政府再次以贪污罪责令15名税务高官退休
New Delhi:	新德里：
The government has compulsorily retired 15 more tax officers in the fourth tranche of its crackdown on errant officials accused of corruption and other malpractices.	印度政府第四轮反腐行动针对被指控贪污等渎职罪的失职官员。此次行动中，政府再次责令15名税务官员退休。
The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) -- the agency that oversees GST and import tax collections -- compulsorily retired 15 senior officers under Fundamental Rule 56 (J) on corruption and other charges, official sources said.	中央直接税和关税税务局（Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs ，CBIC）——负责商品及服务税（GST）以及关税征收的监管机构——依照基本规定（Fundamental Rule，FR）第56条第（J）款对贪污等指控罪名的规定，责令15名高官退休，官方消息表示。
Since June, this is the fourth round of sacking of corrupt tax officials. In the previous three rounds, 49 high ranking tax officers, including 12 from the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT), were compulsorily retired.	六月以来，此已是第四轮腐败税务官员遭下台。前三轮中，总计49名税务高官被责令退休，其中包括12名中央直接税税务局（Central Board of Direct Taxes，CBDT）官员。
Sources said the action was in line with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address to the nation from the ramparts of the Red Fort when he had said some black sheep in the tax administration may have misused their powers and harassed taxpayers, either by targeting honest assesses or taking excessive action for minor or procedural violations.	有消息称，反腐行动是为契合首相纳伦德拉·莫迪（Narendra Modi）的德里红堡全国演讲，他表示，税务部门的某些害群之马工于应付诚信评估，又或频繁违规但情节不重或为程序性违规，以此滥用个人职权和压榨纳税人。
"We have recently taken the bold step of compulsorily retiring a significant number of tax officials, and we will not tolerate this type of behaviour," he had said.	“最近我们已采取严厉措施，责令相当数量的税务官员退休，绝不姑息任何此类行为，”他表示。
Nearly half of the officials retired were those who were arrested by the CBI for allegedly receiving illegal gratification. One of them was caught accepting a bribe of Rs 15,000. One official is accused of having assets disproportionate to his known source of income.	有将近一半的退休官员都是因被指控非法受贿而遭印度中央调查局（CBI）逮捕。其中一人被当场抓住收贿15000卢比。另一官员则因其资产与收入来源不匹配被指控。
In June, the government had compulsorily retired 15 commissioner-level officials of CBIC on charges of corruption, collecting and giving bribes, smuggling and even criminal conspiracy. Prior to that, the government had compulsorily retired 12 senior IRS officials from the Income Tax department over charges of corruption, sexual harassment, disproportionate assets under Rule 56 (J) of the Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules.	六月，政府已责令15名被指控腐败、受贿行贿、走私甚至同谋等罪名的CBIC干事级官员退休。 此前，政府依照中央公务员（Central Civil Services ，CSS）（退休金）规定第56项第（J）款的规定，责令12名被指控腐败、性侵、资产不实等罪名的国税局（IRS）收入税部门高官退休。
In August, the government compulsorily retired 22 CBIC officials. The Rule 56 (J) of Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules, 1972 provides for periodical review of the performance of government servants with a view to ascertain whether they should be retained in service or retired in public interest.	八月，政府又责令22名CBIC官员退休。1972年版中央公务员规定（退休金）第56条第（J）款规定，应定期考核政府公务员的绩效，以评判其是继续履职还是应公众呼声退休。
As per these instructions, the cases of government servants covered by FR 56 (J), 56 (1) or Rule 48 (1) (b) of CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972 should be reviewed six months before they attain the age of 50-55 years, in cases covered by FR 56 (j) and on completion of 30 years of qualifying service under FR 56 (1) or Rule 48 of CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.	依照上述规定，FR第56条第（J）款、第56条第（1）项或1972年版CCS（退休金）规定第48条第（1）项第（b）款涵盖的政府公务员应于其达到50-55年龄段前定期接受考核，但以下情况除外：符合FR第56条第（j）款规定且依照FR第56条第（1）项或1972年版CCS规定（退休金）第48条的规定合格供职年限满30年。
A woman in Maine got 500 letters from United Healthcare within five days	缅因州一妇女五日内收到联合健康保险公司500封信
Stephanie Lay said she found the piles of letters from the insurance company stashed in her mailbox between Thursday and Monday.	斯蒂芬妮·莱（Stephanie Lay）说，她从周四至周一在她的信箱中发现了来自保险公司的成堆的信件。
"A week ago Thursday was the first wave of letters, I got 46 letters," she told CNN. "I immediately called United Healthcare insurance and told them I received 46 letters of the same letter."	“一周前，也就是周四，开始有了第一波来信，我收到46封，”她告诉CNN，“我马上打电话给联合健康保险，告诉他们我收到了46封一样的信。”
And the letters just kept coming, piling up to more than 500 by Monday.	但还是不断有信件寄到她家，截至周一已累计超过500封。
They were addressed to her son, who has autism and lives in a private care facility, she said. But instead of her son's name inside when you opened them, the letters said Dear Maine's Department of Health and Human Services -- in Cincinnati, she told local media.	她说，信件收件人全部是她患有自闭症的儿子，他目前住在一家私人护理机构。但打开信件，信中却并没有提及她儿子的名字，反而信件的称谓是“尊敬的缅因州卫生及公共服务部“——那是在辛辛那提，她告诉地方媒体。
The letters were about a $54 or $0 healthcare claim that United Healthcare said is not covered, Lay said.	莱说，信件内容是关于一项54美元或0美元的医疗赔付申请，联合健康保险说不在承保范围内。
When she asked United Healthcare why she was receiving a mountain of letters, she was told it was a coding issue, she said.	她说，当她询问联合健康保险为什么她收到如此多信件，她被告知这是由于代码错误导致的。
In a statement, United Healthcare told CNN it's working to resolve the issue but it cannot provide details due to privacy requirements.	联合健康保险在其一份声明中告诉CNN，他们正在努力解决该问题，但由于隐私要求，他们无法提供更多细节。
"We have determined the cause of the problem. We are very sorry this occurred, and we have contacted the family to discuss the situation with them," the health insurer said.	“我们已确定了问题原因。非常抱歉发生了这样的错误，我们已联系该家庭商讨具体情况。”这家健康保险公司说。
Lay said the letters all have a message at the bottom urging people to go paperless. " I'm thinking they had to take down half of a forest just to send this," she said.	莱说，所有信件底部都有一句话，建议人们无纸化交流。她说，“我觉得他们砍倒了一半森林就为了发这些信。”

HSBC flips crime-spotting tool to scope new business	汇丰银行翻牌犯罪监测工具以挖掘新商机
British bank HSBC (HSBA.L) has converted a financial crime-spotting algorithm it was forced to build in the wake of a money-laundering scandal into one that can scope out new business opportunities, bank executives said.	英国汇丰银行（HSBA.L）发生洗钱丑闻后，将一不得已开发的金融犯罪监测算法变成嗅探新商机的工具，该银行高管表示。
The system combines data on clients" banking activities, with public data on company ownership and directorships, to flag desirable potential clients to HSBC staff and offer ways to connect to them through existing relationships.	该系统兼有客户银行活动数据和某公司持股人以及董事的公开数据，以识别出目标潜在客户并推给汇丰银行员工，还提供通过已有关系联系客户的方式。
Using data and artificial intelligence to try and boost revenues is part of HSBC's broader push to squeeze more out of its large physical network and client data, a key priority for interim Chief Executive Noel Quinn.	以数据和人工智能意图提高营收是汇丰银行欲更好利用其庞大实体网络和客户数据而作出的进一步努力之一，也是临时首席执行官诺埃尔·奎因（Noel Quinn）的第一要务。
"It's one of the first commercial uses of investment in financial crime prevention, and the business we're getting in this way is inherently lower risk and quicker to win," said Stuart Nivison, HSBC's global head of client network banking.	“其是预防金融犯罪投资中首次投入商业使用的项目之一，以此方式开展的业务从根本上风险较低、更容易成功，”斯图尔特·尼维森（Stuart Nivison）表示，其是该行客户网络银行全球主管。
HSBC declined to comment on how much it expects to make from the new system but said the broader "network income" initiative has already yielded hundreds of millions of dollars in additional revenue.	该行拒绝评论新系统可能带来的营收，但表示进一步的“网络收入”行动已产生数亿美元资金和额外营收。
The drive is an important part of the bank's efforts to defend its global presence at a time when some analysts and investors are saying it should shrink or exit markets like the United States where it makes returns below its cost of capital.	汇丰银行在美面临亏损，而某些分析人士和投资者表示其应该解体或退出诸如美国之类的市场。此时该行付出的努力作为其全力捍卫全球地位的一部分就显得尤为重要。
HSBC was forced to invest hundreds of millions of dollars in financial crime compliance as part of a $1.9 billion settlement in 2012 with U.S. authorities over the bank's failure to prevent money laundering by drug cartels though its Mexican unit.	2012年，汇丰银行和美国政府就其未能阻止贩毒团伙通过其墨西哥网点洗钱达成19亿美元的和解协议。作为协议的一部分，该行不得不投资数亿美元于金融犯罪合规。
The system works by mapping individual customers" and companies ties to each other and then looking for unusual patterns of transactions or unearthing previously unknown connections between those entities.	此系统工作机制如下：绘制个人客户和公司之间的关系网，然后分析出不正常交易模式或者发现上述实体之间未曾有过的联系。
That system has already freed up more than 400 staff to go from manually checking transactions and records to client-facing roles where they can spend time helping customers, said Adrian Rigby, chief operating officer of HSBC's trade business.	此系统使得该行无需动用400多名员工手动核查交易和相关记录，而令其转向面对面服务客户的岗位，留出时间帮助客户，阿德里安·里格比（Adrian Rigby）表示，其是该行贸易业务首席运营官。
HSBC's Nivison said the lightbulb moment was realizing the tool could be repurposed to look for "green flags" of attractive potential clients rather than "red flags" of wrongdoing.	该行尼维森表示，我们的初衷是通过重整该工具以发现有利之处——吸引潜在客户，而非逾越红线。
"We took our customer dataset and combined it with (Britain's) Companies House data and turned the algorithm around to look for attractiveness in a client, whether that be through sector, growth of the company, and connection to existing clients," Nivison said.	“我们将客户数据库和英国公司登记局（Companies House）的数据合并，并以此算法转向分析目标客户，无论是通过领域划分、公司业绩增长还是与已有客户的关系。”尼维森表示。
The tool has mapped 22.5 million entities and people in Britain, and can identify in three minutes a network of connections that a staff member would have taken three hours to map out manually, he said.	此工具已绘制出英国2.25千万个体与实体的关系网，3分钟内便可识别出某一个关系网，而动用一名员工手动识别则可能要耗费三个小时，他表示。
Iran was promised that 'all' US sanctions would be lifted in return for talks, Rouhani claims	鲁哈尼称伊朗得到承诺，美国将解除“所有”制裁以换取谈判
European nations were so eager to negotiate with Iran that they suggested the US would end its sanctions regime if Tehran was willing to engage in dialogue, President Hassan Rouhani has said.	伊朗总统哈桑·鲁哈尼表示，欧洲国家迫切希望与伊朗谈判，乃至提议，只要德黑兰愿意进行对话，美国将解除对伊朗的制裁。
According to Rouhani, European signatories of the 2015 nuclear deal urged him to meet with US President Donald Trump, promising that Washington would lift "all" sanctions in return.	据鲁哈尼所言，2015核协议的欧洲签署国敦促他与美国总统唐纳德·特朗普会面，并承诺作为回报，华盛顿会解除“所有”制裁。
"Three out of the six countries, that is the chancellor of Germany, prime minister of Britain, and president of France, all insisted for the meeting to be held, saying that the US would lift all sanctions," stated the Iranian president.	伊朗总统表示：“六个国家中有三个国家，即德国总理、英国首相和法国总统，坚持举行会议，并称美国将解除所有制裁。“
He said he rejected the proposal because, "under sanctions and maximum pressure," it would have been impossible to predict the end result of any negotiations.	他说他拒绝了这个提议，因为“在制裁和极端压力下”，不可能预测任何谈判的最终结果。
Trump quickly denied that he had offered Iran any relief, tweeting that Tehran had asked him to lift sanctions as a prerequisite to talks, but that he had "of course" refused.	特朗普迅速否认了他曾提出对伊朗解除制裁，并发表推特说，德黑兰向他要求解除制裁，作为会面的先决条件，但他“当然”拒绝了。
In his statement, Rouhani also said that numerous countries were on Iran's side during their one-on-one talks on the sidelines of the UNGA. "We discussed various issues with various countries, and all of them condemned the United States" withdrawal from the JCPOA and its pressures. This is a huge success for Iran."	鲁哈尼还在声明中说，在联合国大会间隙一对一谈话的时候，很多国家支持伊朗。“我们与各国讨论了各种问题，他们所有人都谴责了美国退出联合全面行动计划及其施加的压力。这对伊朗而言是个巨大的成功。“
Dog control laws to be reviewed in government consultation	政府咨询将重审犬只管理条例
Dog control laws in Scotland are being reviewed amid concerns about out-of-control animals and irresponsible owners.	鉴于失控动物和失职饲主所引发的担忧，苏格兰正在重审其犬只管理条例。
A consultation has been launched by the Scottish Government seeking the public's views.	苏格兰政府已开始咨询公众意见。
Scotland's Community Safety Minister pledged to "keep communities safe from irresponsible owners," with reviews to determine whether laws for out-of-control dogs need changing.	苏格兰社区安全事务次官承诺“保护社区免受失职饲主的伤害”，重审失控犬只法律，以确认是否需要修改。
Ash Denham MSP said: "We are holding two reviews into dog control legislation because we are absolutely determined to help keep communities safe from irresponsible owners and their out-of-control dogs.	苏格兰议会议员Ash Denham说：“我们将两次重审犬只管理法规，因为我们下定决心要确保社区免受失职饲主和其失控犬只的伤害。”
"This consultation seeks views on improvements on how the Control of Dogs Act 2010 can operate across Scotland, and next year we will take a wider look at all dog control legislation to assess whether changes are needed.	“本次咨询目的在于征求意见，以改进《2010犬只管理法》在全苏格兰的推行。明年我们会更广泛地重审所有犬只管理法规，评估是否需要进行修改。”
"Owning a dog brings with it certain responsibilities, including keeping your dog under effective control, and I encourage everyone with an interest in this area to respond to our consultation."	“拥有一只狗带来了相当的责任，包括如何有效管理你的狗。我鼓励所有对此感兴趣的人积极响应我们的咨询活动。”
The consultation runs until January 15 and contains proposals to toughen and clarify the current legislation, including questioning whether a national dog control database should be created.	此次咨询将持续至1月15日，包括一些加强和澄清现有法规的提案，其中也针对是否需要建立全国犬只管理数据库提出疑问。
The Scottish Parliament's Post-Legislative Scrutiny Committee has been hearing evidence from victims and parents of children who have been attacked or killed by dogs, prompting the Government to review dog control laws.	苏格兰议会立法后审查委员会长期听取关于被犬只攻击或杀害的受害人及儿童父母的证词，促使政府重审犬只管理法律。
MSPs were told the legislation needs urgent reform to protect vulnerable people and children.	苏格兰议会议员获悉，相关法律急需改革，以保护弱势群体和儿童。
The committee heard that, in Greater Glasgow and Clyde alone, there were 1,417 people arriving at A&E departments with dog-related injuries, 255 of them children, last year.	委员会听说，去年仅在大格拉斯哥及克莱德地区就有1417人因犬类相关伤害到访急诊室，其中255人为儿童。
NHS Lanarkshire treated 912 people and NHS Ayrshire 439, both four-year highs.	拉纳克郡国家医疗服务体系治疗了912人，埃尔郡国家医疗服务体系治疗了439人，均创四年历史新高。
In July, the committee's MSPs concluded current dog control legislation is not fit for purpose and called on the Scottish Government to undertake a comprehensive review of all dog-control laws.	委员会议员在7月得出结论，目前的犬只管理法规没有达到目的，并呼吁苏格兰政府全面重审其所有犬只管理法律。
Convener Jenny Marra said: "Dog law in Scotland is not fit for purpose. There are still far too many dog attacks on children and little enforcement or understanding of the current laws that might prevent these attacks.	召集人Jenny Marra说：“苏格兰的犬只法规达不到它的目的。现在还有太多犬类袭击儿童的案例，而很少人能执行或者了解可能阻止这类袭击的现行法规。”
"It has become clear that current dog control law doesn't work. It needs reform urgently so that out of control and dangerous dogs can be dealt with properly and we can try to move to a system that prevents our children being injured by dogs."	“很明显，现有的犬只管理法律并没有起作用。它急需改革，这样我们可以恰当地处理失控及危险犬只，构建一个保护孩子免受犬只袭击的系统。”
The consultation, launched on the Government's website on Friday, says: "Effective and consistent enforcement across Scotland is fundamental in helping address issues relating to out-of-control dogs.	此次咨询于周五正式登陆政府网站，并表示：“在全苏格兰进行有效且持续的执法，对解决失控犬只相关问题至关重要。”
"This review is focused on steps that can be taken to help aid enforcement agencies such as local authorities, as they use their powers to help keep communities safe."	“这次审核的重点是如何一步步帮助地方当局等执法机构使用他们的权力确保社区安全。”
Saudi Arabia To Offer Tourist Visas For First Time, Abolish Abaya Rule	沙特阿拉伯将首次开放旅游签证并废除罩袍规定
Visas in Saudi are currently restricted to expat workers, their dependents and Muslim pilgrims.	目前，沙特签证仅限于侨居工作者及其亲属、以及穆斯林朝圣者。
Saudi Arabia said Friday it will offer tourist visas for the first time, opening up the ultra-conservative kingdom to holidaymakers as part of a push to diversify its economy away from oil.	沙特阿拉伯于星期五表示，作为推动石油依赖型经济转向多元化的举措之一，其将首次开放旅游签证，为度假者打开极端保守王国的大门。
Kickstarting tourism is one of the centrepieces of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's Vision 2030 reform programme to prepare the biggest Arab economy for a post-oil era.	刺激旅游业发展是沙特王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）为建立“后石油时代”之下阿拉伯国家中最强盛经济体而推出的“2030愿景”改革计划核心之一。
The announcement comes just two weeks after devastating attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil infrastructure -- blamed by Washington on Iran -- which roiled global energy markets and raised fears of a wider regional conflict.	此消息恰好于沙特石油设施惨遭破坏之后两周传出。华盛顿以此谴责伊朗，全球能源市场因此遭到重创，有人担忧地区矛盾也会因此扩大。
"Opening Saudi Arabia to international tourists is a historic moment for our country," tourism chief Ahmed al-Khateeb said in a statement.	“向国际游客开放沙特，对我们国家可谓历史性时刻。”沙特旅游部长艾哈迈德·哈提卜（Ahmed al-Khateeb）在一讲话中表示。
"Visitors will be surprised... by the treasures we have to share -- five UNESCO World Heritage Sites, a vibrant local culture and breathtaking natural beauty."	“游客将会赞叹不绝……我们展示的珍宝包括五处联合国教科文组织（UNESCO）世界遗址、活力四射的本土文化和让人流连忘返的自然美景。”
Saudi Arabia will open applications for online tourist visas to citizens of 49 countries on Saturday, Bloomberg News quoted Khateeb as saying.	据彭博社援引哈提卜的说法，沙特将于星期六对49个国家的游客开放在线旅游签证的申请。
Khateeb said the kingdom will also ease its strict dress code for foreign women, allowing them to go without the body-shrouding abaya robe that is still mandatory public wear for Saudi women.	哈提卜表示，沙特也将放宽对外国女性的衣着规定，允许其无需如本国女性必须穿戴包裹全身的公共服饰——罩袍（Abaya）。
Foreign women, however, will be required to wear "modest clothing," he added, without elaborating.	然而，外国女性穿着必须“得体”，他补充道，并对此没有过多解释。
Visas in the desert kingdom, endowed with rich bedouin heritage and archaeological sites, are currently restricted to expat workers, their dependents and Muslim pilgrims travelling to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.	这个沙漠王国拥有许多贝都因文化遗产和考古遗址，但其签证却仅限于侨居工作者及其亲属，还有前往麦加和麦地那圣地的穆斯林朝圣者。
In a rare move, Saudi Arabia last year began issuing temporary visas to visitors to attend sporting and cultural events in a bid to kickstart tourism.	沙特去年破天荒开始为参与运动会和文化活动的游客发放临时签证，以期刺激旅游业的发展。
But the austere kingdom, which forbids alcohol and has a strict social code, is seen by many as a hard sell for tourists.	但沙特社会呆板严肃，包括禁止饮酒以及社会制度森严，许多人认为其并不会受到游客欢迎。
Prince Mohammed is seeking to change that through a sweeping liberalisation drive that has brought new cinemas, mixed-gender concerts and sporting extravaganzas to Saudi Arabia.	穆罕默德王子试图借助大规模的自由化扭转现状，下令国内可以开办影院、举行男女共同参加的音乐会和体育盛会。
International criticism of the kingdom's human rights record, including the gruesome murder last year of critic Jamal Khashoggi and a crackdown on female activists, could further put off foreign visitors, observers say.	观察人士表示，国际社会对沙特人权纪录的批评，包括去年评论家贾迈勒·卡舒吉（Jamal Khashoggi）遭恐怖谋杀以及对女权运动者的镇压，更让外国游客反感沙特。
Fears of a regional conflict after the September 14 attacks on state oil giant Aramco may also dampen the kingdom's appeal to holidaymakers.	9月14日的国有石油巨头阿美公司（Aramco）遇袭事件之后，地区矛盾的担忧也让沙特对度假者的吸引力黯淡不少。
The government, reeling from low oil prices, says it hopes tourism will contribute up to 10 percent of the gross domestic product by 2030, compared to three percent currently.	沙特政府惨遭油价下滑的打击，表示期望到2030年旅游业占国内生产总值（GDP）的比例可以从目前的3%提高到10%。
It says by 2030 it aims to attract up to 100 million annual visits by both domestic and foreign tourists.	其还表示，到2030年，力求每年吸引的国内外游客数达到1亿人次。
But the kingdom currently lacks the infrastructure to accomodate visitors in such high numbers, with officials estimating 500,000 new hotel rooms will be required nationwide over the coming decade.	但是，目前沙特国内缺乏容纳大量游客的基础设施。为此，官方预计接下来十年全国需要新增五十万套客房。
The sector is expected to create up to one million tourism jobs, the government says, as it battles high youth unemployment.	沙特政府表示，预计旅游业会创造一百万个相关的工作岗位，以缓解年轻人居高不下的失业率。
Saudi Arabia has splurged billions in an attempt to build a tourism industry from scratch.	沙特耗资数十亿资金，意图从无到有促成旅游业的繁荣。
In 2017, the kingdom announced a multi-billion dollar project to turn 50 islands and other pristine sites on the Red Sea into luxury resorts.	2017年，沙特宣布一耗资数十亿美元的工程，以将红海50个岛屿以及其他的未开发地区变成奢侈旅游景点。
Last year, construction of Qiddiya "entertainment city" was launched near Riyadh, which would include high-end theme parks, motor sport facilities and a safari area.	去年，靠近利雅得的Qiddiya娱乐城开始施工，其将包括高端主题公园、机动体育设施和野生动物园。
The country is also developing historic sites such as the centuries-old Mada'in Saleh, home to sandstone tombs of the same civilisation which built the Jordanian city of Petra.	沙特也正开发历史文化景点，如历史悠久的马拉因萨利赫，那里是砂岩古墓聚集地，和约旦古城佩特拉同属一种文明。
Facebook hides 'likes' in new Australia trial	Facebook在新的澳大利亚体验版中隐藏“点赞”功能
Facebook has begun hiding the number of "likes" for posts in Australia, it said today, a trial designed to ease social pressure that could be rolled out worldwide.	Facebook今日表示，已经在澳大利亚体验版本中隐藏帖子下面的点赞量。这一版本旨在缓解社交压力，可能推行至全球范围。
Account holders across the country will also be blocked from viewing the number of reactions and video views on other people's posts from today, but will still be able to see how people respond to their own.	今日起，澳大利亚全国的Facebook用户将不再能看到其他人帖子下的反应次数和视频观看次数，但还是可以看到别人对自己帖子的反应。
"We don't want Facebook to feel like a competition," the company said in a statement.	该公司在一份声明中表示：“我们不希望上Facebook变成一种较量。”
"This is a test to see how people engage with this new format. We hope to learn from this over time in order to see if we will roll this out more broadly," it said.	声明表示：“这是一个测试，我们希望看一下人们如何参与到这种新形式中。随着时间的推移，我们希望能够了解我们是否要把这种形式推广到更大范围。”
More than one billion people use Facebook worldwide, but the social media giant has come under pressure to combat the platform's impact on mental health.	全球有超过10亿Facebook用户，但这家社交媒体巨头需要解决他们对心理健康的影响，因此正承受着巨大压力。
In Australia, one in five children report experiencing cyberbullying, according to the country's eSafety commissioner.	澳大利亚网络安全专员表示，在澳大利亚有五分之一的孩子报告遭受网络欺凌。
Facebook's decision comes after it launched a trial in July to hide "likes" on the company's other major social media platform, Instagram.	7月，Facebook在公司另外一个主要社交媒体Instagram上测试了隐藏点赞量后，做出了这一决定。
What began as a test on Instagram in Canada was expanded to Australia, Brazil and several other major markets.	Instagram的测试在加拿大开始，后扩展至澳大利亚、巴西和其他几个主要市场。
The Facebook trial was described as "a limited test in order for us to get some early learnings."	Facebook试验被描述为“一个小范围试验，帮助我们获得早期反馈。”
"While this has been testing on Instagram, Facebook and (Instagram) are different surfaces and we will likely see different data come from this test," the company said.	公司表示：“虽然这已经在Instagram上测试过，Facebook和（Instagram）是不一样的平台，我们可能会从这次测试中收获不一样的数据。”
The social media giant did not confirm how long the trial would run for.	这家社交媒体巨头没有确认测试会持续多久。
"We want to understand from people whether removing the total counts improves their experience, while also not limiting any positive interactions," said Mia Garlick, of Facebook Australia.	澳洲Facebook的Mia Garlick说：“我们想从人们那里了解移除总数量是否可以改善他们的体验，同时又不影响任何积极的互动。”
Lorenzo strengthens into Category 4 hurricane east of Caribbean	飓风洛伦佐在加勒比海以东增强为4级飓风
Hurricane Lorenzo strengthened into a Category 4 storm Thursday, producing swells that could affect parts of the Windward Islands and South America, the National Hurricane Center said.	国家飓风中心表示，飓风洛伦佐周四增强为4级飓风，产生的涌浪可能影响向风群岛和南美部分地区。
The eye of the major hurricane was about 1,660 miles southwest of the Azores in the NHC's 11 p.m. EDT update. The storm was moving north-northwest at 14 mph with 145 mph maximum sustained winds.	国家飓风中心晚11点EDT报道，主飓风的风眼位于亚速尔群岛西南约1660英里处。风暴以14英里/小时的速度向西北偏北移动，最大持续风速为145英里/小时。
The storm isn't forecast to make landfall in the coming days, though a turn toward the northeast Saturday could bring Lorenzo near the Azores in the middle of next week. Forecasters predict the storm will weaken below Category 3 on Monday.	虽然周六往东北方向的转向可能导致洛伦佐下周周中靠近亚速尔群岛，但预计风暴不会在未来几天内登陆。预报员预测，周一风暴会减弱至3级以下。
Swells generated by the storm could cause life-threatening surf and rip currents in the Windward Islands and northeastern South America.	风暴引发的涌浪可能在向风群岛和南美东北部产生威胁生命安全的海浪和激流。
Lorenzo is the season's second Category 4 or higher storm. Dorian reached Category 5 status near the Bahamas.	洛伦佐是本季第二个4级以上风暴。多里安在巴哈马群岛附近达到了5级。
According to Colorado State University Meteorologist Philip Klotzbach, the Western Hemisphere, which encompasses the Atlantic and eastern Pacific basins, has generated 16 named storms since Aug. 21.	根据科罗拉多州立大学气象学家Philip Klotzbach，涵盖大西洋和东太平洋海盆的西半球自8月21日以来已形成16个命名风暴。
"This is the most on record for the Western Hemisphere between Aug. 21-Sept. 23, breaking the old record of 15 named storms set in 1984 and 2002," he wrote on Twitter.	他在推特上写道：“这是每年自8月21日至9月23日之间，西半球记录风暴数量最多的一次，打破了1984年及2002年15个命名风暴的旧记录。”
Patriot missile system to Saudi Arabia after Iran oil attacks	伊朗袭击石油设施，“爱国者”导弹系统部署沙特
U.S. Soldiers talk after a routine inspection of a Patriot missile battery at a Turkish military base in Gaziantep, Turkey.	土耳其加济安泰普军事基地，美国士兵在例行检查“爱国者”导弹发射装置后交谈。
The Pentagon on Thursday announced that the U.S. will send a Patriot missile battery, radars and roughly 200 support personnel to Saudi Arabia in the wake of the attacks on its oil facilities earlier this month.	美国五角大楼周四宣布，因本月早些时候沙特石油设施受到袭击，美国将向沙特派遣一套“爱国者”导弹发射装置、雷达，以及大约200名支持人员。
Defense Secretary Mark Esper has "approved putting additional forces on prepare to deploy orders," Pentagon spokesman Jonathan Hoffman wrote in a statement. "While no decision has been made to deploy these additional forces, they will maintain a heightened state of readiness."	五角大楼发言人乔纳森·霍夫曼在一份声明中写道，美国防部长马克·埃斯珀已“批准增派部队为部署命令做准备”，同时，“目前尚未决定如何部署增援部队，但他们将保持高度战备状态。”
Those additional forces include two Patriot missile artillery batteries and one Terminal High Altitude Area Defense, or THAAD missile defense system.	增援部队包括两套“爱国者”导弹发射装置和一套末段高空区域防御系统，即“萨德”（THAAD）导弹防御系统。
THAAD, one of the world's most advanced missile systems, can target incoming missiles and blast them out of the sky. THAAD interceptors, fired from a truck-based launcher, use kinetic energy to deliver "hit to kill" strikes to ballistic threats.	“萨德”是全球最先进的导弹系统之一，可瞄准来袭导弹并在空中将其摧毁。车载式发射架发射的“萨德”拦截弹可利用动能“击杀”弹道导弹威胁。
"It is important to note these steps are a demonstration of our commitment to regional partners, and the security and stability in the Middle East. Other countries have called out Iranian misadventures in the region, and we look for them to reinforce Saudi Arabia's defense," Hoffman wrote.	“需要注意到的是，如此举措体现了我们对区域伙伴及中东安全和稳定的承诺。其他国家让我们看到了伊朗在该地区造成的灾难，我们希望这些能加强沙特的防御。“
President Donald Trump slammed Iran's alleged role in the attacks on Saudi oil facilities, telling world leaders at the U.N. General Assembly on Tuesday that they should pressure Tehran into diplomatic talks.	美总统特朗普在周二的联合国大会上猛烈抨击伊朗在沙特石油设施袭击事件中扮演的角色，并号召各国领导人向德黑兰施压，迫使伊方进行外交谈判。

The Sept. 14 strikes on the world's largest crude-processing plant and oil field forced Saudi Arabia to shut down half of its production operations. The drone attacks triggered the largest spike in crude prices in decades and renewed concerns of a budding conflict in the Middle East. While Tehran has been widely blamed for the attacks, it maintains that it was not involved.	世界最大原油加工厂和油田于9月14日遭受的袭击，迫使沙特削减了一半的石油生产业务。无人机袭击事件引发了几十年来最大幅的原油价格飙升，并再次引发了对中东冲突初现的担忧。尽管德黑兰被广泛指责为此次袭击的罪魁祸首，但其坚称自己并未参与其中。

The U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI said a federal review of the 2018 shooting of 22-year-old Stephon Clark found "insufficient evidence" to pursue charges against Officers Terrance Mercadal and Jared Robinet. Both will be returned to active duty.	美国联邦检察官办公室及联邦调查局表示，他们审查了2018年的22岁青年斯蒂芬·克拉克枪击案，发现“证据不足”，无法起诉警员特伦斯·梅卡达尔及贾里德·罗比内。两位警员都将返岗。
The California attorney general's office in March declined to issue state criminal charges after a nearly yearlong investigation. Attorney General Xavier Becerra said then evidence showed the officers had reason to believe their lives were in danger because he was advancing toward them holding what they thought was a gun. Investigators found only a cellphone.	经过一年调查，3月，加州总检察长办公室拒绝提出刑事诉讼。总检察长哈维·贝塞拉表示，有证据表明，当时警方有理由相信自己受到生命威胁，因为他们认为斯蒂芬·克拉克正持枪接近。而调查人员仅发现一部手机。
Sacramento police also announced Thursday their internal investigation did not find any policy or training violations.	周四，萨克拉门托警察局还宣布，内部调查中没有发现违反政策或培训的行为。

The federal investigation looked at evidence such as witness statements, audio and video recordings, dispatch records, police reports, and autopsy reports to determine whether the officers acted willfully with the intent to use objectively unreasonable force.	联邦调查人员检查了目击者证词、音频及视频记录、派遣记录、警局报告、验尸报告，以确定警方是否故意使用客观上不合理的武力。
Lawmakers last month updated the nation's oldest law governing police use of deadly force, making it now among the country's most comprehensive when combined with additional training.	上个月，立法者们修订了全国最古老的法律，即对警察使用致命武力手段的管制。该法若与培训相结合，将成为现今全国最全面的法律之一。
California's old standard made it rare for police officers to be charged following a shooting and rarer still for them to be convicted. It was based on the doctrine of "reasonable fear," meaning if prosecutors or jurors believed officers had a reason to fear for their safety, they could use lethal force.	依照加利福尼亚的旧标准，警察极少因枪击被指控，更不会被判刑。旧标准基于“合理恐惧”的说法，意味着如果检察官或陪审员相信警察有理由认为自己的安全受到威胁，他们就可以采取致命措施。
The new law, which takes effect Jan. 1, will allow police to use deadly force only when "necessary" to defend against an imminent threat of death or serious injury to officers or bystanders.	1月1日起生效的新法律则规定，警察只有在“必要”的情况下，即对其或旁人有明显的致死致伤威胁时，才可以诉诸致命武力手段。

Francis addressed a Vatican conference that brought government envoys and Facebook and Google representatives together with philosophers, physicists and ethicists. A smattering of academics and Catholic bishops rounded out participants at "The Common Good in the Digital Age" conference.	梵蒂冈举行的一次会议，聚集了各国使节、Facebook及谷歌代表、哲学家、物理学家、伦理学家。方济各在此次会议上致辞。众多学者及天主教主教也共同参与了此次《数字时代的共同利益》会议。
The three-day gathering is the latest evidence of the Vatican wanting a place in the debate over the prospects and perils of artificial intelligence.	此次会议持续三天，是最近一次梵蒂冈在关于人工智能利弊的讨论中为自己争取一席之地。
The debates included technology advancements in warfare and the future of work with increasing reliance on machines, as well as a case study examining the Christchurch, New Zealand, massacre and decisions taken by social media companies after video spread of the carnage.	论题包括战争中的科技进步和对机器与日俱增的依赖，还分析了新西兰基督城屠杀一案，以及屠杀视频流传开后社交软件公司所作的决策。
In his speech to the conference, Francis praised the potential of technological progress, noting that machines at the dawn of the industrial revolution spared workers dangerous and monotonous labor. But he warned that increased reliance on robotics for the sake of profits risked depriving people of the dignity of labor.	方济各在讲话中赞扬了科技进步的潜力，指出工业革命之初，机器使得工人们得以摆脱危险单调的工作。同时他也提出警告，因为追求利益而日益依赖机器人，将剥夺人们劳动的尊严。
"If technological advancement became the cause of increasingly evident inequalities, it would not be true and real progress," he warned. "If mankind's so-called technological progress were to become an enemy of the common good, this would lead to an unfortunate regression to a form of barbarism dictated by the law of the strongest."	他警告道：“如果科技进步逐渐加剧不平等现象，那就不是真切实际的进步。如果人类所谓的科技进步是成为共同利益的敌人，那将使人类不幸退回到强者决定一切的野蛮状态。”

The Democratic-held chamber passed a resolution to terminate Trump's action by a 236-174 margin, sending it to the president. Eleven Republicans and one independent supported it. Neither chamber of Congress appears to have the two-thirds majority needed to override the president's opposition.	国会参众两院似乎都没有三分之二的支持以推翻总统的否决。
Failing to get the funding he desired for borders on the southern border from both the Mexican government and Congress, Trump declared the national emergency in February. Google Marks Its 21st Birthday With a Doodle: All You Need to Know	划重点：谷歌以涂鸦纪念21岁生日
Google is marking its own birthday today with a doodle. The doodle features a photo of a 90s' style computer with Google search page and date stamp for September 27, 1998, surrounded by confetti in Google colours. A smaller doodle with number 21 as candles, as a part of Google logo, shows on the search results page. The search giant was founded 21 years ago in 1998 by Larry Page and Sergey Brin, then students at Stanford University in California. September 27 is, however, not Google's actual birthday.	今天谷歌以涂鸦纪念21岁生日。涂鸦以一张充满九十年代风格电脑的照片为主体，上有谷歌搜索页的绘图，并附上一日期戳记——1998年9月27日，谷歌式色调的五彩纸屑撒于其间。另一较小的涂鸦则将数字“21”作为蜡烛融入谷歌标志，展示于谷歌搜索结果页面中。作为搜索引擎巨头，其于1998年由当时的加州斯坦福大学学生拉里·佩奇（Larry Page）和谢尔盖·布林（Sergey Brin）创立。不过，9月27日却并非谷歌真正的生日。
If you take the company's incorporation date as its birthday, then Google was born on September 4, 1998, however, the company never celebrated the day as its birthday, at least not in the form of a doodle. Google celebrated September 7 as its birthday in doodles until 2005, following which it switched to September 27.	如果将公司合并日期视为诞生之日，则谷歌应诞生于1998年9月4日。但谷歌从未将其作为生日纪念，至少没有以涂鸦的形式。 谷歌2005年之前将9月7日视为生日并作涂鸦纪念，之后才改为9月27日。
Initially, the search engine was called "BackRub" and it was later renamed "Google."	刚开始，谷歌不称为“谷歌”，而称为“BackRub”，之后才改名。
"We chose our systems name, Google, because it is a common spelling of googol, or 10100 and fits well with our goal of building very large-scale search engines," Sergey Brin and Lawrence (Larry) Page wrote in 1998 in a paper published about launching a prototype of a "large-scale search engine."	“我们取googol（10100）的常见拼写，将我们的系统命名为谷歌（Google），完美契合我们想建立超大规模搜索引擎的目标，“谢尔盖·布林和劳伦斯（拉里）·佩奇1998年于一篇关于“大规模搜索引擎”原型的论文中写道。
The company got its start thanks to Sun co-founder Andy Bechtolsheim who invested $100,000; in June 1999, the company had raised a $25 million round from Sequoia Capital and Kleiner Perkins. Google moved to its Mountain View location in the same year, where it remains. In 2001, the company was granted a patent for its technology.	该公司因太阳计算机系统公司联合创始人安迪·贝希托尔斯海姆（Andy Bechtolsheim ）10万美元的投资开始起步。1999年6月，该公司从红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）和凯鹏华盈（Kleiner Perkins）筹得2500万美元风投。同年谷歌总部迁至山景城，并保持至今。2001年，该公司因其技术获批专利。
What started out as a Web search engine has since turned into a massive conglomerate that calls itself Alphabet and Google is a subsidiary company. Today, Google operates all over the world in over 100 languages, answering trillions of search queries each year.	最初以网页搜索引擎起家的公司，如今蜕变成大型控股集团Alphabet，而谷歌则是其子公司。今天，谷歌以100多种语言遍及全球，每年处理上万亿计的搜索查询。

The Next Big Labor Strike Hits Oregon	俄勒冈州面临下一场大罢工
The state university workers" most pressing complaints center on low wages and a lack of dignity at work. The pay disparities alone are shocking. About half of these workers earn less than $40,000 per year (and hundreds make less than $25,000). Meanwhile, university presidents" annual salaries average out to $500,000 and four university athletics coaches are pulling down a cool $1 million. While school administrators enjoy six-figure salaries and overall administrative spending continues to bloat, one in six classified staffers qualify for food stamps.	大学工作者对低工资及缺少工作尊严提出最严厉的控诉。仅工资差异一项就令人震惊。大约半数员工年收入不足四万美金（数百人不到两万五千美金）。同时，校长年均收入为50万美金，四位大学运动教练甚至赚到可观的100万美金。学校行政工作者享受高达6位数的工资，总体行政花销持续上涨。与此同时，六分之一分类员工可领取政府资助的食品券。
As Alejandro Segurra, another IT worker at Portland State University, said, "I'm willing to go on strike because I don't think it's fair that people are paid wages that don't allow them to live in the city that they serve." Portland State library worker Theresa Stapleburg was even more direct: "I want to strike because I've been here 24 years, and I need a raise - a living wage."	波特兰州立大学另一位IT工作者Alejandro Segurra说：“我愿意参加罢工，因为我觉得所发工资无法让人在他们工作的城市生活，是不公平的。”波特兰州立大学图书馆馆员Theresa Stapleburg更为直接：“我想罢工，因为我已经在这24年了，我要加薪。”
As inflation climbs and the cost of living in Oregon soars, these workers are being left to flounder, and management has shown little sympathy for their plight. Contract negotiations that began in February broke down in mid-August. At that point, the bosses had laid out some particularly egregious proposals - a paltry cost-of-living increase, a denial of seniority demands from long-term university workers, and a price hike for staff meals - that workers saw as disrespectful, and even cruel. "There is an unwritten class system at the universities," Fulmer said. "And we are at the bottom of it."	随着通货膨胀加剧，俄勒冈州生活成本飙升，这些员工开始挣扎，而行政管理层对他们的困难没有半点同情。二月开始的合同谈判于八月中旬告吹。当时，老板们提出了令人震惊的建议，增加了一点微不足道的生活费，拒绝大学长期员工的资历要求，员工餐价格大涨。员工们感到这些建议十分无礼，甚至残忍。Fulmer说：“大学中有一个不成文的阶级系统，而我们在这个系统的最底层。”
"Education workers have been under attack for decades," he continued. "We are finally standing up and fighting back. It's one thing to see classism and the squeezing of the middle class in the corporate world as executives see their relatively obscene pay continue to go up at rates above inflation. But for the same thing to be happening in education is not something workers will continue to tolerate."	他接着说：“教育工作者已经遭到数十年的攻击，我们现在终于站起来反抗。这是阶级的表现，在企业世界中对中产阶级进行压榨，而高管们的工资，却比通货膨胀涨得还快。但教育界工作者不会容忍同样的情况发生。”
And Oregon's state university workers aren't the only ones taking action. Oregon is a powder keg of militancy right now, and its fuse is now burning bright and hot. Grocery store workers at the Fred Meyer supermarket chain are ramping up their campaign against their employer, and while there are no official plans to strike yet, tensions are running high; their union, United Food and Commercial Workers Local 555, has already called for a boycott, and filed an unfair labor practice report against the chain.	俄勒冈州州立大学员工并非孤军奋战。俄勒冈州现在是个火药桶，急欲求战，燃烧正炽。Fred Meyer连锁超市的杂货店员工正加大对雇主的打击力度。虽然目前没有正式罢工计划，但气氛越来越紧张。他们的555食品与商业工人联合会已经呼吁会员开始抵制，并针对连锁店提出不公平劳动实践报告。
In the healthcare sector, the 4,500 members of the Service Employees International Union Local 49 workers at Kaiser Permanente authorized a strike (with a 98 percent approval rate) if a deal isn't reached before their existing contract expires in October - which was only narrowly avoided with a new tentative agreement. Elsewhere in the industry, the Oregon Nurses Association, which represents more than 120 nurses at Astoria Hospital, has been deadlocked in contract negotiations with the hospital administration; their last contract expired in May, and the clock is ticking.	在医疗保健领域，49服务业从业人员国际联合会的4500名凯撒医疗集团员工同意（98%同意率），如果在当前合同结束的十月之前，没有达成协议，他们将进行罢工。因最后双方达成了新的临时协议，这才勉强避免了这一罢工。业内其他方面，俄勒冈州护士协会代表Astoria医院的120多名护士与医院行政层进行合同谈判，陷入僵局。他们上一份合同5月到期，现在时间很紧张。
"Oregon has a really strong labor movement that is really building from the ground up," Burley explains. "This is a part of the national wave of labor growth. People are seeing a precarious economy where real wages are falling and the solution is collective action in the workplace."	Burley解释道：“俄勒冈州有强有力的工人运动，它真的是从零开始的。这是全国劳动力增长浪潮的一部分。人们看到了一种危险的经济，实际工资下降，而解决方案，是在工作场所采取集体行动。”
It's unclear just how deeply such collective action may take root this fall, but it certainly would be fitting if the general strike returned to the Northwest in 2019. And from there we can only hope that its spirit will spread even further, into the heart of Midwestern farming, Southern manufacturing, Texan oil fields, Appalachian coal mines, Northeastern construction, the Silicon Valley tech giants, and everywhere in between. Lord knows that something's gotta give.	这种群体行动今秋将如何站稳脚跟，还不清楚。但如果2019年再次发生西北大罢工，这一行动就很合适。我们只能期望，这种精神会由此传播开来，传播到中西部农场、南部制造业、德克萨斯州油田、阿巴拉契煤矿、东北建造业、硅谷科技巨人，以及其间的各行各业。上帝知道，必须要有妥协。

Setting the example? Income inequality in the US is at an all-time high	树立榜样？美国收入不均衡创历史新高
Last year the income gap between richest and poorest people in the US stood at its highest level since 1967, the first year the Census Bureau started tracking it. DC and New York are among places where the differences are worst.	去年，美国最富有和最贫穷人群收入差距达1967年以来新高。1967年是人口普查局开始跟踪人均收入的第一年。华盛顿特区和纽约是收入差距最大的地区。
The US may be the world's wealthiest nation, but it is also one where the super-rich thrive no matter what while the desperately poor often rely on GoFundMe to pay their medical bills. The economic inequality affects both wealth and incomes, with the latter being at an all-time high.	美国也许是全球最富有的国家，但在这里，超级富豪无论何时都蓬勃发展，绝望的穷人却常常依靠GoFundMe平台来支付医疗账单。经济不平衡影响着财富和收入，而收入差距今创历史新高。
One way to measure income inequality is the Gini index. It measures between 0, a score for absolute equality and 1, which stands for a hypothetical situation in which a single household gets all income in a nation. The Census Bureau has been tracking the index for over 50 years. In 1967 it stood at 0.397 but, in 2018, it rose to 0.485, the highest figure on the record.	衡量收入不均衡的一种方法是基尼系数。基尼系数在0和1之间，其中0代表绝对平等，1则代表一种假设情况，即由一个家庭掌握全国收入。人口普查局已经对基尼系数进行了50多年的跟踪。1967年基尼系数为0.397，但到2018年，这个数值已攀升至0.485，创历史新高。
There are nations with worse income inequalities, including some with reasonably strong economies. For example, the World Bank estimates that South Africa's Gini index stood at 0.63 in 2014 while Brazil's was 0.53 in 2017. By comparison, all EU countries have a Gini index below 0.4.	有些国家的收入不均衡情况更加严重，其中一些国家的经济状况还相当好。比如，世界银行估计南非2014年基尼系数为0.63，而巴西在2017年为0.53。相比之下，所有欧盟国家的基尼系数均低于0.4。
The new data shows that income inequality is most acute in places where wealth is concentrated, including DC, New York and Connecticut, as well as in poverty-ridden areas like Puerto Rico and Louisiana. Utah, Alaska, Iowa, North Dakota and South Dakota had the most economic equality.	新数据表明，财富最集中的地区，包括华盛顿特区、纽约和康涅狄格，还有贫困地区，如波多黎各和路易斯安那，收入不均衡的情况最为严重。犹他州、阿拉斯加州、爱荷华州、北达科他州和南达科他州的经济最平衡。
The census also showed a stagnating growth of median household income, which grew to over $62,000. It's the highest level ever measured by the American Community Survey, but the increase was just 0.8 from 2017 to 2018, much smaller compared to increases in the previous three years and amounting to virtually no growth at all if adjusted to inflation.	人口普查局还显示，中位数段家庭收入增长停滞不前，目前增长至62000美元。这是美国社区调查得出的最高水平，但2017年至2018年间，增幅仅为0.8，与前三年相比非常小，如考虑通胀因素，则几乎没有实现任何增长。
The new statistics will likely put some wind into the sails of progressive Democratic contenders for the party nomination for next year's presidential election, who call for leaning on the super-wealthy individuals and on big corporations to pay more taxes.	对明年的总统选举来说，新的统计数据可能会为进步派民主党候选人的党内提名推波助澜，因为他们不断呼吁增加超级富豪和大型企业的税款。
It may also undermine the rationale behind the current administration's corporate tax breaks, which were passed through Congress in 2017. The goal was to convince multinationals to bring back manufacturing jobs as money trickles down to the middle and poor classes. In practice, it seems, it led to extra bonuses for executives and the rest of the country largely missing out on the benefits a growing economy and record low unemployment. Well, someone needs to pay for all those private jet trips.	这也可能颠覆国会2017年通过的本届政府企业减税政策的逻辑依据。这个政策的目的本是说服跨国公司重新将制造业工作带回国内，进而让财富流入中产和贫穷阶级。然而实践中，这似乎为高管们带来了更多的奖金，而这个国家的大部分人口却并没有享受到经济发展和失业率历史新低带来的利益。好吧，总有人要为那些私人飞机的来来回回买单。
North Carolina man wins five times in the same lottery drawing	北卡罗来纳州男子同一次彩票抽奖中五次中奖

Stem cells of 56 child cancer patients lost at Children's Hospital after freezer malfunction	儿童医院冷冻柜发生故障，56名儿童癌症患者干细胞被毁
A freezer malfunction at Children's Hospital Los Angeles resulted in the loss of 56 children's blood stem cells that were harvested at the beginning of each patient's oncology therapy and stored in the event they could prove useful in the future.	洛杉矶儿童医院冷冻柜发生故障，导致56名儿童癌症患者的干细胞被毁。这些干细胞是在每名患者的肿瘤治疗早期时被采集并保存的，以备将来使用。
"We apologize for any distress or confusion that this has caused our patients and their families," the hospital wrote in a statement. "If you have not received a letter or phone call from our team, your child is not impacted."	医院在声明中写道：“我们对在这起事件中感到忧虑以及受到困扰的病人及其家属表示道歉。您若没有接获本院的信函或电话通知，表示您的孩子未受影响。”
All but one patient had gone through initial therapy. That patient did require the recollection of stem cells, chief medical officer James Stein said.	除一名患者外，其余患者均已完成初步治疗。该患者的干细胞的确需要再次采集，首席医疗官詹姆斯·斯特恩说道。
A letter sent to families earlier in September informing them of the loss was accidentally addressed to the children - rather than the parents. The hospital has also apologized to parents for the messaging oversight.	早前于九月间，一封通知这些家庭关于干细胞丢失的信件，被错误地发给了孩子们，而不是他们的父母。医院也已就此疏忽向家长们道歉。
The hospital said that the loss of stem cells, which had been placed in long-term storage, has not jeopardized any child's health. The hospital has also offered to assist families who want to harvest again. But the process can be grueling.	医院方面表示，长期保存的干细胞被毁，并未对任何儿童的健康造成危害。同时，医院也表示会协助那些决定再次采集干细胞的家庭。然而整个过程会很艰辛。
One of the patients described it as "painful." Sean Anderson Corona, 13, underwent stem cell therapy when he was diagnosed with Stage 4 Neuroblastoma - a cancer often found in the adrenal glands. The boy was hooked up to machines for a daylong process that collects the stem cells from the blood. The blood is then reinfused back into the body.	其中一个患者将其描述为“很痛苦”。现年13岁的肖恩·安德森·科罗那，在被诊断出罹患神经母细胞瘤第4期后接受了干细胞疗法。神经母细胞瘤经常生长于肾上腺。这名男孩全天被连接到机器上，以便从他的血液中收集干细胞。随后，血液又被重新输回他的体内。
"I would try to sleep and my body would just start shaking, and then I just started to freak out and I'd start crying," Corona told ABC-7.	科罗那告诉ABC-7电视台：“我尝试睡觉，我的身体就会开始发抖。接着我就开始抓狂，大哭起来。”
Corona will be cancer-free for three years in November. But his mother, Elizabeth Anderson, said that she worries that if his cancer does return, it may be impossible to harvest more stem cells from his blood.	到今年11月，科罗那就三年没有复发癌症了。可是他的母亲伊丽莎白·安德森担心，如果他的癌症复发，可能无法从他的血液中采集更多的干细胞。
Stein said that the recollection of patients" stem cells would only be recommended in the event that they are needed in the event that the patient relapses.	斯特恩说，只有当患者的癌症复发时，才会建议再次采集他们的干细胞。
"We think that's going to be incredibly unlikely so we wouldn't ask anyone to do that in advance," he said.	他说道：“我们认为这种情况出现的可能性微乎其微，因此我们不会要求任何人提前进行采集。”
The freezer has since been replaced, and the sensor-monitoring and alert system have been upgraded.	冷冻柜随后已被替换，传感监测以及警报系统也已被升级。
"Obviously, this is a huge deal for us." Stein said. "We're reaching out directly to every single family in person to make sure that all their questions are answered."	斯特恩说：“显然这对我们来说是一起非常严重的事件。我们正在直接联系每一户家庭，当面确保他们的所有问题都得到回复。”
