EU, British negotiators work toward Brexit deal in Belgium	欧盟与英国代表在比利时就脱欧协议进行谈判
The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator began talks With British officials in Belgium Friday to work toward an agreement, with about a month remaining before the departure deadline.	欧盟首席脱欧谈判代表周五开始在比利时与英国官员就脱欧协议进行谈判，离预计脱欧时间还有一个月左右。
Michel Barnier met with Brexit secretary Stephen Barclay in Brussels, who was adamant the Irish "backstop" be stripped from any deal. The backstop, effectively an assurance of a soft border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Britain leaves, has been perhaps the chief obstacle in negotiations.	米歇尔·巴尼尔在布鲁塞尔会见了英国脱欧事务大臣斯蒂芬·巴克利。后者坚称协议不得出现爱尔兰“边境保障”条款。边境保障可能是谈判的主要障碍。它可以在英国脱欧后，有效确保爱尔兰和北爱尔兰之间的软边境。
While Barclay said Britain is committed to finding a deal, he said there isn't much time left.	巴克利表示英国正在努力达成协议，但他也说剩下的时间不多了。
"I think there is still a long way to go. I think we are coming to the moment of truth in these negotiations," he said.	他说：“我觉得还有很长的路要走。我认为我们马上要到达谈判的紧要关头。”
The deadline to leave the EU is Oct. 31, but a new British law prevents Prime Minister Boris Johnson from completing the withdrawal without a trade agreement, or Parliament's approval to leave without one by Oct. 19.	脱欧的最后期限是10月31日，但根据英国的一项新法案，在没有达成贸易协议、或者国会10月19日前未同意无协议脱欧的情况下，首相鲍里斯·约翰逊不能完成脱欧程序。
Last week, EU negotiators said they are open to an alternative to the backstop -- but Irish deputy Simon Coveney said Friday London hasn't yet submitted a "serious" proposal.	欧盟谈判代表上周表示，他们对“边境保障”的替代方案持开放性态度。但爱尔兰代表西蒙·科夫尼周五表示，伦敦尚未提交“像样”提案。
"Until there is a serious proposal, which can be the basis of negotiations, then the gaps which are wide at the moment will remain," he said.	他说：“除非他们提交一份像样的提案作为谈判基础，不然现在这种鸿沟将一直存在。”
He added that "time is running out" and "the onus is on the British prime minister and his team" to put serious proposals on the table.	他补充说“时间不多了”，并且“英国首相和他的团队有责任”在谈判中拿出像样的提案。
Johnson's office said Friday there are still "significant obstacles" to a deal.	约翰逊办公室周五表示，离正式达成协议还有“重大障碍“。
"From an Irish perspective, we of course think that an extension is preferable to a no-deal," Coveney said. "But I think there would have to be good reason behind that to ask for an extension."	科夫尼说：“从爱尔兰的角度看，我们当然认为延期比不达成协议要好。但我认为要求延期必须有一个恰当的理由。”
EU President Jean-Claude Juncker said he and Barnier are doing everything they can for a deal and if they fail, it's Britain's fault.	欧盟主席让-克洛德·容克表示，他和巴尼尔正在尽全力达成协议，如果协议失败，那就是英国的错。
Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said he's not optimistic about a deal, but urged British leaders to present a plan at a Brexit summit on Oct. 17.	爱尔兰总理利奥·瓦拉德卡表示，他对能否达成协议并不乐观，但他敦促英国领导人在10月17日的欧盟脱欧峰会上提出计划。
"The withdrawal agreement is actually an international treaty," he said. "It's not the kind of thing that can be amended or cobbled together late at night."	他说：“脱欧协议实际上是一个国际公约，不是那种可以深夜修改或拼凑出来的东西。”
Scientists puzzled by really big planet orbiting really little star	科学家被一大行星围绕小恒星旋转的现象困惑
Scientists are expressing surprise after discovering a solar system 30 light-years away from Earth that defies current understanding about planet formation, with a large Jupiter-like planet orbiting a diminutive star known as a red dwarf.	科学家对一距离地球30光年“太阳系”的发现感到诧异，因为一个类木行星竟然围绕一较小恒星即红矮星旋转，此有违当前对行星起源的认识。
An artistic impression of the gas giant planet GJ 3512b orbiting its red dwarf host star, released on September 26, 2019.	一张气态巨行星GJ 3512b围绕其主星红矮星旋转的艺术效果图于2019年9月26日公布。
Stars generally are much bigger than even the largest planets that orbit them. But in this case, the star and the planet are not much different in size, the researchers said on Thursday.	恒星通常比围绕其旋转行星中最大的行星还要大出许多。但在此情况下，恒星和行星大小差别不是很突出，研究者于星期四表示。
The star, called GJ 3512, is about 12% the size of our sun, while the planet that orbits it has a mass of at least about half of Jupiter, our solar system's largest planet.	该恒星名为GJ 3512，大小约为太阳的12%，而围绕其旋转的行星质量至少为木星——太阳系中最大行星的一半。
"Yes, an absolute surprise," said astrophysicist Juan Carlos Morales of the Institute of Space Studies of Catalonia at the Institute of Space Sciences in Spain, who led the research published in the journal Science.	“是啊，真的让人意外，”胡安·卡洛斯·莫拉莱斯（Juan Carlos Morales）表示，其是西班牙空间科学研究所（Institute of Space Sciences）加泰罗尼亚空间研究所（Institute of Space Studies of Catalonia）的天体物理学家，也有领导该发表于《科学》杂志的研究。
"The discovery was surprising because theoretical formation models suggest that low-mass stars typically host small planets, similar to Earth or small Neptunes. In this case, we have found a gas giant planet similar to Jupiter around a very small star," Morales added.	“此发现令人惊讶，因为星体起源理论模型表明，低质量恒星通常被类似于地球或者海王星的小行星围绕。在此情况下，我们发现一类似于木星的气态巨行星围绕一超小恒星旋转，”莫拉莱斯补充道。
The planet, which like Jupiter is composed mainly of gas, was discovered using a telescope at the Calar Alto Observatory in Spain. It travels around its star in a very elliptical orbit lasting 204 days.	该行星犹如木星主要由气体构成，被西班牙卡拉阿托天文台（Calar Alto Observatory）以天文望远镜观察到。该行星以一典型的椭圆轨道围绕其恒星旋转，周期204天。
Red dwarfs are small, with relatively low surface temperatures. GJ 3512 is not only much smaller than our sun, it is somewhat comparable in size to a very large planet, being only about 35% bigger than Jupiter.	红矮星较小、表面温度较低。GJ 3512不仅比太阳小得多，而且比起超大行星其大小都不是很大，只有木星大小的35%。
"They emit less energy, so they are fainter than the sun, and their surface temperature is rather cool, below 3800 (degrees) Kelvin (6,380 degrees Fahrenheit/3,527 Celsius) approximately. This is why the have a reddish color," Morales said.	“他们释放的能量很少，所以比太阳都暗，表面温度也极低，大约不到3800开氏度（6380华氏度或3527摄氏度）。这就是为什么他们表现出暗红色，”莫拉莱斯表示。
There is evidence of a second planet currently orbiting the star, while a third planet might have been ejected from the star system in the past, explaining the elliptical orbit of the Jupiter-like planet, Morales said.	有证据显示，该恒星还被第二个行星围绕旋转，而第三个行星有可能在过去被弹出该恒星系，此便能解释此类木行星椭圆轨道的成因，莫拉莱斯表示。
Planets are born from the same disk of interstellar gas and dust that produces the star around which they orbit. Under the leading model for planetary formation, called the "core accretion" model, an object initially forms from solid particles in the disk and the gravitational tug of this embryonic planet allows for an atmosphere to arise from the surrounding gas.	星际气体盘和尘埃盘既可形成恒星，也可形成围绕其旋转的行星。根据主流的行星起源模型——“核心吸积”模型，星际盘的固体颗粒形成最初的行星，新生行星的引力拖拽使得周围气体开始形成大气。
A competing model, called the gravitational instability model, may explain this unusual system.	另一对立模型——引力不稳定模型，有望解释此不同寻常的系统。
"In this case, the protoplanetary disk around the young star may be slightly more massive than expected and cold," Morales said. "This makes the disk become unstable so some dense regions can appear. These clumps can grow until they collapse, forming a planet."	在此情况下，新生恒星周围的原行星盘可能比预期略微更大并处于冷却态，”莫拉莱斯表示。“这让原行星盘变得不稳定，以至于出现某些致密区。这些聚集团不断变大直至崩塌，行星因此形成。”
School strikers around the world march to demand action on climate	世界各地罢课的学生举行游行，要求对气候问题采取行动
Children around the world launched another wave of school strikes demanding action on climate change Friday, in their first major action since the issue topped world leader's agenda at the United Nations this week.	周五，世界各地的儿童再次发起学校罢课潮，要求人们对气候变化采取行动，这是自从该问题在本周成为联合国世界领导人的首要议程以来，他们的第一次重大行动。
The Fridays for Future movement that began as a lone demonstration by Swedish teen Greta Thunbergjust over a year ago has mushroomed, with millions of students taking to the streets of cities like New Yorkand attracting attention in developing nations across Africa.	仅一年多，由瑞典少女格蕾塔·桑伯格发起的“为未来而战(Fridays for Future)”运动已经发展壮大，数百万学生走上纽约等城市的街头，吸引了非洲各发展中国家的关注。
Some of the first protests began in New Zealand, where Thunberg saidorganizers estimated 170,000 people marched across the country. There were also marches in cities in Italy, Finland, Nigeria, Austria and India, among other countries.	部分首批抗议活动开始于新西兰，格蕾塔说，组织者预计有17万人在全国各地游行。在意大利、芬兰、尼日利亚、奥地利和印度等国的城市也举行了游行。
Friday's protest followed a week of climate talks at the United Nations in New York, which included a scathing speech by Thunbergto world leaders reprimanding them for inaction.	周五的抗议是在纽约联合国气候谈话一周后举行的，其中包括格蕾塔对世界各国领导人的严厉演讲，谴责他们的不作为。
"You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words," she said on Tuesday. "The eyes of all future generations are upon you and if you choose to fail us, I say we will never forgive you."	周二，她说：“你们用空话偷走了我的梦想和童年。所有后代的目光都在你们身上，如果你们选择辜负我们，我们绝不会原谅你们。”
Citing a U.N.-backed reportreleased last year, demonstrators are demanding governments implement measures to prevent global temperatures from rising more than 2.7 degrees, which scientists warn result in dire consequences for human life and the planet.	抗议者引用去年发布的一份受到联合国支持的报告，要求各国政府采取措施，防止全球气温上升超过2.7度，科学家警告说，这将给人类生命和地球带来可怕的后果。
Thunberg and the young people she has inspired say they will not stop their weekly classroom walkouts until they see a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions responsible for climate change.	格蕾塔和她所启发的年轻人说，只要造成气候变暖的温室气体没有减少排放，他们就不会停止每周一次的走出教室活动。
In Nigeria's capital Abuja, Oladosu Adenike marked her 46th consecutive strike on Friday. The activist posted images on Twitter of students dressed in blue school uniforms carrying banners with messages, "Climate change is real" and "We don't have time."	周五，在尼日利亚首都阿布贾，Oladosu Adenike开始她连续第46次罢课。这位活动者将学生穿着蓝色校服、举着横幅的照片发布在推特上，横幅上写着“气候变暖是真实的”和“我们没有时间了”。
In Lausanne, Switzerland, where hundreds of climate strike organizers gatheredin August planning for this week's events, thousands of people marched through the city, according to local reports.	根据当地报道，在瑞士洛桑，数百名气候罢课的组织者八月聚集在一起计划本周的活动，几千人在城里游行。
Thousands more were expected to take to the streets of Helsinki, Finland, where local media reportedthat the city's school would allow students to participate.	预计还有数千人将走上芬兰赫尔辛基的街头，当地媒体报道称，该市的学校会允许学生参加。
Thunberg, who remains in North America following her visit to the U.N., was scheduled to participate in climate strikes in Montreal, Canada.	格蕾塔在访问联合国后仍留在北美，计划在加拿大蒙特利尔参与气候罢课活动。

Are hopes for a nuclear-free world realistic?	实现无核化世界的希望是否现实？
Seventy-four years ago, two nuclear bombs were detonated over Hiroshima and Nagasaki, killing tens of thousands of people.	六十四年前，两枚核弹在广岛和长崎引爆，杀死了数以万计的人民。
Since then, wherever conflict between major powers rises, so does the threat of a nuclear war.	自此，无论大国在何处发生冲突，都伴随着核战争的威胁。
Various treaties have attempted to suppress that threat, yet today there are nearly 14,000 nuclear weapons based around the world.	有各种条约试图压制这种威胁，然而时至今日，世界范围内依然存在近14000件核武器。

'We both have sons, and we were bearing in mind that we are not just role models for girls but boys - and not just our sons, but generally in public too.'	“我们都有儿子，而且都信守我们不仅是女孩的榜样，也是男孩的，不仅是自己儿子的榜样，更是整个社会的。”
She added that having Meghan present 'didn't feel hierarchical', as it was 'women gathered together and a talk about the struggles we have, as well as the things we need to do to move forward and grow and change our societies'.	她补充道，梅根王妃并没有让会场显得“尊卑分明”。相反，“我们只是女性聚在一起，畅谈付出的心血，以及为推动社会发展变革我们需要做的事情。”
Matsi Modise, founder of skills training company Simodisa, said Meghan is determined to continue to champion the issues close to her heart despite being a member of the Fold.	马兹·莫迪塞（Matsi Modise）是技能培训公司Simodisa的创始人，她表示，梅根尽管身为皇室成员，但她意志坚定，决心继续捍卫心中关切的重大议题。
'She talked about being a mother and having duties as a duchess and fulfilling what her heart desires - and that it can't just fade away now that you're a duchess,' Modise recalled.	“她说起当妈妈的事情、作为公爵夫人的责任，还有内心渴望的追求——即便身为王妃也无法被淹没。”莫迪塞回忆道。
'That you have to be true to who you are.'	“那就是活出真正的自己。”
She said the duchess pushed them to plough ahead with their new ideas and spoke about how they have to keep pushing and going forward, knowing they are doing it for others who will follow.	她表示，王妃鼓励在场的女性不断尝试自己新的想法，也谈到她们该如何自强不息、急流勇进，让她们明白这样的自己将成为众人效仿的榜样。
'She wasn't referring to being a royal, but life in general when you have challenges,' Modise added, admitting she felt a bit 'awestruck' by Meghan.	“她所指的不是成为贵族，而是普通人在生活中遇到的挑战，”莫迪塞补充道，并承认梅根王妃让自己感到有点“肃然起敬”。
'She radiates grace and she is taking this task that she has with such grace,' Modise said.	“她浑身散发出优雅的气质，而如此优雅的她正肩负自己的使命。”莫迪塞表示。
'A lot of us have done amazing things as founders, but meeting a royal is quite daunting. She made it easy. She is an easy-going royal.'	“在场的很多人作为创业者做过不少惊天动地的大事，但会见贵族还是让人局促不安，王妃却让这变得很自然。王妃为人很随和。”
Meghan also revealed she's enjoying the pressures of being a working mother, admitting she finds juggling being a royal and looking after baby Archie 'a lot' but 'all so exciting'.	梅根王妃也表示，她享受边工作边带孩子的压力，同时承认，既要做王妃，又要照顾宝宝Archie，这让她觉得“工作量很大”，但“非常令人兴奋”。
Speaking to mother-of-two Lara Rosmarin, CEO of Cape Innovation and Technology, Meghan said: 'We're only five months in right now. Being a working mum and travelling as well with a baby, my goodness it's a lot, but it's all so exciting.	罗拉·罗斯马林（Lara Rosmarin)是两个孩子的妈妈，也是开普创新科技公司（Cape Innovation and Technology）的CEO。和她谈话时，梅根说道：“我们家宝宝现在只有五个月大，作为上班妈妈还要带孩子出差，老天，这工作量很大，但非常令人兴奋。
'There are days when it's a lot to juggle but then you meet someone and you have an impact on them and you say "ah-ha," and it's so rewarding.'	“有时候，你要兼顾各种事情，但当你见到一些人，并影响到了他们，那时你会觉得‘啊哈’，一切都值得了。”
Meghan then went to the city's Mothers2Mothers organisation, which trains and employs women with HIV.	梅根王妃随后前往当地的母亲互助组织（Mothers2Mothers）——一个培训和雇佣感染HIV女性的机构。
She took along some of Archie's baby clothes, including a onesie saying 'The Future' and his Invictus babygro which he no longer fits, alongside donations from her friends with children.	她捐赠了一些Archie的宝宝衣服，包括一件写着“未来”的连体衣，还有一件穿小了的“勇者不败”（Invictus）宝宝连体衣。她还代表她的妈妈朋友们进行了捐赠。
Parents of 5-month-old stuffed in suitcase and tossed in dumpster get 6 years in prison	五个月大婴儿被藏尸行李箱并遭丢弃垃圾箱，父母被判入狱六年
The parents of a 5½-month-old boy whose body was thrown in a dumpster were sentenced to six years in prison after pleading no contest Thursday to charges in the baby's death.	一名五个半月大男婴的尸体被丢弃在垃圾箱里，其父母对导致该婴儿死亡的指控供认不讳，随后于周四被判处六年有期徒刑。
Adam Manson, 34, and Kiana Williams, 32, each pleaded no contest to one felony count of child abuse resulting in death and admitted to a special allegation that they caused the death of their son, Jacsun Manson, the Los Angeles County district attorney announced.	洛杉矶县地方检察官宣布，现年34岁的亚当·曼森和现年32岁的琦安娜·威廉姆斯对一项虐待儿童导致死亡的重罪指控均选择不抗辩，并承认自己导致其子杰森·曼森死亡。
Manson and Williams had initially pleaded not guilty to the charges.	起初曼森和威廉姆斯对指控拒不认罪。
The two had been doing drugs in a South L.A. motel on New Year's Eve when they found the baby dead, prosecutors said. They placed his body in a suitcase and tossed it in a trash bin near the Baldwin Hills Crenshaw Plaza, prosecutors said.	据检察官说，两人于元旦前夜在洛杉矶南部的一家汽车旅馆内吸毒时，发现婴儿死亡。他们将尸体放在一个行李箱里，并将其丢弃在鲍德温山克伦肖广场附近的垃圾箱内。
In late April, weeks after searching through the El Sobrante Landfill in Corona, authorities called off the search. The child's body was never found.	四月下旬，在科罗纳的爱索布伦垃圾填埋场进行的为期数周的搜寻中，并未找到孩童尸体，当局随后终止了搜寻。
Police said in a statement at the time that they made the decision to end the search for Jacsun with a "heavy heart," but noted they couldn't pinpoint a location in the landfill "to a point that would make continuing the search reasonable."	警方在当时的一份声明中表示，他们在决定结束对杰森的搜寻时，是怀着“沉重的心情”的，并指出他们无法在垃圾填埋场里找出尸体的确切位置，因此“没有理由再继续搜寻下去”。
UK's medical drug supply still uncertain in no-deal Brexit	无协议脱欧下英国药品供应前景不明
Britain's government watchdog says there is still a "significant amount" of work to do to ensure the country has an adequate supply of medical drugs in case of a no-deal Brexit.	英国政府监察机构表示，为确保英国在无协议脱欧的情况下有足够医疗药品供应，仍有“大量”工作要做。
In a report issued Friday, Britain's National Audit Office said additional shipping capacity chartered by the U.K. for sending goods across the English Channel might not be operational until the end of November - one month after the Oct. 31 deadline for Britain to leave the European Union. Of the more than 12,300 medicines licensed in the U.K., about 7,000 arrive from or via the EU, mostly across the Channel.	在周五发布的报告中，英国国家审计署表示，英国拟定通过英吉利海峡运输物资的航运量，大概11月底才能实现，也就是英国离开欧盟的截止日10月31日之后一个月。在英国注册的12300种药品中，约7000种来自欧盟或途经欧盟，大多是通过英吉利海峡运送。
According to the British government's "reasonable worst-case" scenario, the flow of goods could be cut by half on Day One of a no-deal Brexit and could take a year to recover. It said time was "extremely limited" if the shipping issues were to be resolved by the end of October.	根据英国政府所设想的“合理的最坏局面”，物资运输量可能在无协议脱欧后的第一天减至一半，并有可能需要一年来恢复。如果要在10月底前解决航运问题，时间“极其有限”。
The report also said there was "incomplete information" about the levels of medicine stockpiling but that levels were increasingly daily. As of Sept. 20, suppliers reported that 72% of medicines had a six-week stockpile.	报告还表明，药品库存相关“信息不全”，但库存每天都在持续增加。截至9月20日，各供应商报告，72%的药品库存可维持六周。
"In the event of a no-deal exit, the department (of health) would be working in a highly uncertain environment and operating all the elements of its plan would be a hugely demanding task," the watchdog wrote.	监察机构表示：“如果无协议脱欧，（卫生）部门将在充满不确定性的环境下工作，要实现计划中的所有环节，将极为困难。”
Meg Hillier, who chairs a committee overseeing the audit office, called the findings "deeply concerning." She said she had seen "countless examples" of the British government missing deadlines, but that this one was particularly striking.	主持审计署监督委员会的梅格·希利尔称这些调查结果“非常令人担忧”。她表示她曾在“无数例子”中目睹英国政府错过截止日期，但这一次尤其令人胆战。
"If the government gets this wrong, it could have the gravest of consequences," she said.	她说：“如果政府这次出错，后果将是最为惨重的一次。”
Dr. Richard Torbett of the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry said that while companies have been working to prepare for Brexit, "some things are outside of their control."	英国制药行业协会的理查德·托贝特博士表示，虽然各公司在为脱欧进行准备，“有些事并非他们能力所及”。
He said more details were needed on how companies might access government-planned freight capacity if Britain sees a no-deal departure from the EU.	他表示仍需要更多信息，来了解一旦无协议脱欧，各公司如何才能获得政府计划货运量。
"Securing a (Brexit) deal remains the best way to protect patients," he said.	他说：“确保脱欧协议，仍是保障病人的最佳方式。”
Cleveland police branded 'failing' in all areas by inspectors	监督员认定克利夫兰警方“全面失败”
Scandal-hit Cleveland police has become the first force to be branded "failing" in all areas by inspectors.	丑闻缠身的克利夫兰警方成为首个被监督员打上全方位“失败”标签的警队。
It has been rated inadequate overall and in three key areas by Her Majesty's Inspectorate of Constabulary and Fire and Rescue Services (HMICFRS), which scrutinised its ability to reduce crime and keep people safe, operate efficiently, as well as the way it treats the public and its workforce.	英国皇家治安消防与救援服务监督局(HMICFRS)对克利夫兰警局减少犯罪、保障人民安全、有效运作的能力以及警方面对公众及其工作人员的处理方式进行了严格审查，并认为警方工作在总体层面和三个关键方面均不合格。
The findings mean the force is effectively plunged into special measures, where the chief constable and police and crime commissioner are called before a national board and questioned about their plans to ensure "critical improvements" are made.	这些调查结果意味着，警局实际上已被采取了特别措施，国家委员会已传唤警察局长以及警务和犯罪专员，并质询其确保“关键性改进”的计划。
The home secretary could then step in to tackle the problem if no progress is made.	如果没有进展，内务部长可能会介入解决这个问题。
A string of scandals has plagued the force, covering Hartlepool, Redcar and Cleveland, Stockton and Middlesbrough in the north east of England.	一系列丑闻困扰着警队，包括哈特尔浦、雷德卡和克利夫兰，以及英国东北部的斯托克顿和米德尔斯堡。
It has seen six chief constables in almost as many years.	在几乎六年的时间里，已经换了六名警察局长。
Former chief constable Sean Price was sacked for gross misconduct in 2012; seven officers were under investigation after journalists" phones were unlawfully monitored, and there have been long-standing claims of racism within the ranks.	前警察局长肖恩·普莱斯在2012年因严重不当行为而被解雇；七位警官因记者的手机遭到非法监听而受到调查，据说警局中还长期存在着种族主义。
Work practices were recently described by the chief inspector of constabulary as being about as "inefficient as you can possibly imagine," with officers having to share laptops and bodyworn cameras.	最近，首席监督员将警方的实际工作描述为“难以想象得效率低下”，警官不得不共用笔记本电脑和随身携带式相机。
HM Inspector of Constabulary Phil Gormley said it was a "failing force" where there had been "significant" deterioration in the last two years.	英国皇家治安监督员费尔·戈姆利表示，这是一个过去两年退化“十分显著”的“不合格警队”。
Tees Valley mayor Ben Houchen said the report described the "worst findings ever into any police force in the country" which was "finally the official validation" that the force is "broken" and said the Home Office needed to intervene now.	提斯谷市长本·休晨说，这份报告描述了“有史以来国内警察部队最糟糕的调查结果”，是警队已经“腐败”的“最终官方定论”，还说英国内政部必须马上介入。
He added: "It's no longer in dispute. It is a fact described in black and white in this report.	他还补充：“这已经没有争议了。这是报告中白纸黑字描述的事实。
"The findings are some of the most distressing and shocking I have ever read."	“有些调查结果是我读到过最痛心疾首和令人震惊的。”
Cleveland is one of 15 forces that has been recently inspected by HMICFRS inspectors, and the only one rated inadequate in all areas.	克利夫兰是近期督察局督察员调查的15支警队之一，也是唯一一支被评为全面不合格的警队。
Gormley added: "The force doesn't appropriately prioritise crime prevention. There is a lack of strategic direction, and the force doesn't allocate enough resources to prevention work ... It is failing to respond appropriately to vulnerable people, including children. It is missing opportunities to safeguard them and exposing them to risk."	戈姆利补充说：“该警队没有正确地把预防犯罪作为首要任务。这支警队既缺少策略上的指导，在预防工作上也没有分配足够的资源……对包括儿童在内的弱势人群，他们没有做出恰当的回应。这是在错失保护他们安全的机会，让他们暴露在危险中。”
He said senior leaders were not consistently demonstrating "ethical behaviour," and the "inappropriate behaviour of senior leaders within Cleveland is so profound that it is affecting the efficiency and effectiveness of the force."	他说，高层领导没有保持“符合道德的行为”，而“克利夫兰内部高层领导的不当行为如此严重，对警队的效率和作用都产生了影响。”
He added: "It doesn't consistently treat its workforce with fairness and respect and it doesn't effectively communicate with or engage its workforce; its processes aren't perceived to be fair and it doesn't understand its workforce well enough to support them."	他还补充：“警队没有保持以公平和尊重的态度对待员工，没有与员工进行有效的沟通，也没有与他们建立联系；他们的流程并不公正，对员工也没有足够的了解，无法提供支持。”
Despite the findings, the force did receive a small amount of praise for the way it tackles serious and organised crime but was told it must improve the way it investigates crimes.	虽然有这些调查结果，但该警队确实在应对有组织的严重犯罪方面获得了少许赞扬，但他们被告知必须改进调查犯罪的方式。
The force's police and crime commissioner Barry Coppinger said: "I am deeply concerned at the worrying contents of this report.	该警队的警察和犯罪专员巴里·科平格说：“我对这份报告中令人忧虑的内容十分关切。

He said he had received assurances from the current chief constable Richard Lewis that "swift action" was taken as soon as he became aware of the failings.	他说，现任警察局长理查德·李维斯已作出保证，表示自己发现问题后，就立刻采取了“迅速的行动”。
Coppinger has been ordered by the Home Office to respond to the report within 56 days.	科平格已被内政部命令在56天内对这份报告作出回应。
Lewis said the report would act "as a line in the sand" for the force, adding: "Improvements have already been made and I take full responsibility for driving through the changes that are so obviously needed. In the five months I've been here I have met some exceptional police officers and staff, at all levels, and have seen lives saved and vulnerable people protected by the efforts and determination of frontline officers."	李维斯说，这份报告将成为警队的“警戒线”，并补充道：“我们已经做出了改进，我也完全有责任推动这些明显需要的改变。”在我来到这里的五个月内，遇到了一些优秀警官和各级工作人员，也看到因为一线警官的努力和决心，人们的生命得到挽救，弱势人群得到保护。”
If drastic improvements are not made quickly enough, the Government could step in, as it can when prisons are failing.	如果不能迅速作出重大改善，政府可能会介入，就像当监狱无法正常运作时一样。
But so far politicians have never had to resort to this measure with police forces, inspectors said.	但是监督员说，迄今为止，政治家还从来没有需要对警方采取这样的措施。

Immanuel Christian School: Sixth-grade boys accused of pinning down black girl and cutting off her dreadlocks in Virginia	以马内利基督教会学校：弗吉尼亚州六年级男生被指控压制黑人女孩并剪掉辫子
A black middle school student from Virginia is accusing three white boys of pinning her down and cutting off her dreadlocks. The incident took place at Immanuel Christian School - where Vice President Mike Pence's wife, Karen Pence, is a teacher.	弗吉尼亚州一位黑人中学生控告三名白人男生压制住她，并剪掉她的辫子。事件发生在以马内利基督教会学校，副总统迈克·彭斯的妻子凯伦·彭斯便在此校执教。
Amari Allen, a 12-year-old student at the private K-12 Christian school, said the boys called her dreadlocks "ugly" and "nappy" before cutting them off on the playground during recess.	阿玛丽·艾伦是这家私立K-12基督教会学校的一名12岁的学生，她说，那些男生说她的辫子很“丑陋”，是“尿布”，然后在课间休息时在操场上剪掉了她的辫子。
"They kept laughing and calling me names," Amari told CBS affiliate WUSA-TV, tearing up. "They called me 'ugly,' said, 'I shouldn't have been born.' They called me 'an attention-seeker.'"	“他们不停地笑着辱骂我，”阿玛丽泪流满面地告诉CBS旗下的WUSA-TV。“他们说我很‘丑’，”还说‘我不应该被生下来。’他们说我是个‘哗众取宠的人’。”
According to WUSA, one of the boys allegedly covered Amari's mouth while another held her hands behind her back and a third took a pair of scissors to her dreadlocks.	根据WUSA报道，据称其中一名男生捂住阿玛丽的嘴，另一名男生抓住她的双手反剪在背后，而第三名男生用一把剪刀剪掉她的辫子。
Amari didn't tell her family about the incident until after her grandmother noticed the length of her hair had changed.	直到她的祖母发现她的头发变短了，阿玛丽才把这件事告诉家人。

She feared retaliation if she confessed the truth, she said.	事件据说发生在周一，但这位害羞的少女说，直到周三她才告诉家人，因为她的祖母发现她的头发看起来不一样了。她说，她害怕说出事实之后遭到报复。

Allen's family pays nearly $12,000 per year for Amari to attend the school, which made headlines earlier this year after Karen Pence took an art teaching job at the famously anti-LGBTQ institution.	艾伦家每年要为阿玛丽支付将近1.2万美元学费，今年早些时候，凯伦·彭斯在这所著名的反性少数群体学校就任美术教师一职后，这所学校成为了头条新闻。

We have also reached out to law enforcement to ask them to conduct a thorough investigation, and further inquiries should be directed to the Fairfax County Police."	“我们严肃对待所有学生的身心健康，并对任何形式的霸凌或虐待采取零容忍政策。”以马内利基督教会学校在声明中表示。“我们对这些指控深感不安，正在与受害者的家庭沟通来收集信息，并提供我们力所能及的支持。我们也联系了执法部门，要求他们进行彻底调查，更多问题请联系费尔法克斯郡警方。”

The vessel's seizure, however, was widely seen as retaliatory for British forces capturing a tanker off Gibraltar on suspicion of transporting Persian oil to Syria in violation of international sanctions. The ship was released in mid-August despite the Trump administration making a last-ditch attempt to length its detention.	然而，人们普遍认为，伊朗的扣押行为是报复性的。英国海军曾在直布罗陀扣押了一艘涉嫌违反国际制裁令将波斯石油运至叙利亚的油轮。尽管特朗普政府坚持试图延长其扣留时间，这艘船于8月中旬被释放。
The Stena Impero was officially given permission to leave on Monday but was kept in port until a probe into the ship's conduct completed, the New York Times reported.	《纽约时报》报道，“史丹纳帝国”周一正式获准离开，但直到对该船的行为调查结束为止，这艘船一直待在港口。
"The vessel has left the port of Bandar Abbas and is transiting to Dubai for the crew to disembark and receive medical checks and debriefing," Hanell said. The ship became victim to escalating tensions near the Persian Gulf where both the United States and Iran shot down the other's drone and at least two tankers were sabotaged by explosives, which the Trump administration has blamed Iran for.	该船成为波斯湾附近紧张局势升级的受害者。美国和伊朗都在波斯湾附近击落了对方的无人机，并且至少有两艘油轮被爆炸物破坏。特朗普政府将此归咎于伊朗。
The Trump administration most recently blamed Iran for drone attacks on Saudi Arabian oil facilities, which Tehran denies having any involvement with.	近日，特朗普政府指责伊朗对沙特阿拉伯石油设施发动无人机袭击，而德黑兰否认参与其中。

Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the death of former French president Jacques Chirac, saying India mourns the loss of a true global statesman and friend.	印度总理纳伦德拉·莫迪（Narendra Modi）吊唁法国前总统雅克·希拉克（Jacques Chirac）的去逝，并表示印度哀悼痛失了一个名副其实的全球政治家和朋友。
Jacques Chirac, who supported India after it conducted nuclear tests in 1998, died on Thursday at age 86. He served as the president of France from 1995 to 2007.	雅克·希拉克于1995年到2007年时任法国总统，于星期四去逝，享年86岁。在1998年印度进行核试验后，其对印度持支持态度。

India and France have a strategic partnership, initiated in January 1998 during Jacques Chirac's first visit to India. He again visited the country as president in 2006.	雅克·希拉克首次访问印度时，印度和法国便于1998年1月建立战略合作伙伴关系。2006年他任职总统期间再次访问印度。

Uganda: Government Launches Oral HIV Self-Test Kit	乌干达：政府推行HIV自测试剂盒
Ministry of Health has launched an oral HIV self-test kit aimed at empowering citizens, especially men to carry out HIV testing.	卫生部推出了一种HIV自测试剂盒，旨在让公民、尤其是男性公民进行HIV检测。
The initiative is aimed at reducing new HIV/Aids infections by 2020.	初衷是在2020年前减少新增HIV/艾滋病感染。
The oral HIV test kit dubbed, OraQuick HIV self-test, a product of Orasure technologies, targets young people aged 18 to 24 years, men and priority populations such as sex workers.	该HIV自测试剂盒名为“OraQuick”HIV自行测试，产自Orasure科技公司，目标人群是18至24岁的青年、男性以及性工作者这类的少数群体。
"Currently we are targeting young people 18 to 24 years. For the young people that's the age bracket we are looking at but of course any one above 18 and it's because we do not have evidence of children by the Constitution but as more evidence unfolds we are going to get there. For the men, we give the kit to the mother and they take it to the partner, key and priority populations such sex workers," Mr Geoffrey Tasi, the technical officer-in-charge of HIV testing services, said yesterday.	“目前我们的目标人群是18到24岁的年轻人。对于年轻人来说，这就是我们关注的年龄段，当然还包括所有年满18岁的人。这是因为我们没有儿童研究的证据，但是随着更多证据的发现，我们也会进一步前进。对于男性，我们会把试剂盒交给母亲，她们再交给伴侣以及关键的高危人群，例如性工作者。”HIV测试服务的技术负责人乔弗里·塔司昨天说。
Easy use	简单易用
Initially, the self-test kits available involve the use of blood to detect the HIV, however, with oral HIV self-test kit, oral fluids are involved.	最初的自测试剂盒需要血液来检测HIV，然而使用HIV口腔自测试剂盒，只需要口腔液体。
The test works by detecting antibodies, the body's natural defenders against infection. If one is infected with HIV, these antibodies will be present in your blood and also in the salivia. The test will detect the antibodies in the mouth.	试剂的原理是检测抗体，即人体对抗感染的天然防御措施。如果受试者感染了HIV，这些抗体就会出现在血液和唾液中。试剂将检测口腔中的抗体。
Data by the Uganda Aids Commission (UAC) shows that Uganda is registering 1,000 new HIV/Aids infections and 500 deaths from the viral disease per week, translating into 53,000 new infections and 23,000 deaths annually.	乌干达艾滋病委员会(UAC)的数据显示，乌干达每周新增1000例HIV/艾滋病感染病例，和500起因病毒性疾病导致的死亡，即每年53000例新增感染和23000起死亡。
Dr Diana Atwine, the permanent secretary in the Ministry of Health, said this is timely and will enhance the fight against HIV/Aids.	卫生部常任秘书长戴安娜·艾特文博士表示，这次及时的举措能够加强HIV/艾滋病的防治工作。
She, however, urged the men to take HIV testing as an important issue.	而她敦促男性将HIV检测重视起来。
She added that there is still effort to reach the 14 per cent of the people, who are living with HIV but do not know their HIV status.	她补充说，还有14%的人群需要我们的帮助，他们携带HIV，却并不知道自己的HIV状态。
"Currently, 86 per cent people living with HIV know their status; that means it leave us with 14 per cent of those living with HIV and do not know their status. So how do we now utilise that additional innovation. Really for me this is it ... how do we now move from this kit and create demand, especially for that 14 per cent that are sick and they need care and they are not getting care," Dr Atwine said.	“目前，有86%的HIV携带者知道自己的情况，意味我们还有14%的HIV携带者不知道自己的情况。那么，我们现在该如何利用这次额外的创新之举呢？对我来说，这就是……我们该如何从这些试剂出发，进一步创造需求，尤其是对那14%的患者，他们需要照顾，却无法得到，”艾特文博士说道。
However, health officials warn one should not eat or drink within 15 minutes before starting the test.	卫生部官员还提醒，受试者在开始检测之前的15分钟内不应吃喝。
Mr Tasi said studies conducted showed no suicide cases and the ministry is confident that the potential of harm can be avoided because the test is voluntary.	塔司称，所做的实验显示没有自杀病例的出现，卫生部有信心避免潜在的伤害，因为检测是自愿的。
Dr Atwine said apart from graphics and videos provided to educate the users, there should be toll free numbers always available to offer counselling in both government and private facilities, including all pharmacies.	艾特文博士说，除了提供图片和视频来教育使用者外，政府、私人机构以及所有的药店都应提供免费电话咨询服务。
Research. According to the research, OraQuick HIV self-test detected more than 99 per cent of people, who were infected with HIV and people, who were not infected with HIV.	研究。根据这项研究，OraQuick HIV自测试剂能够检测出99%已感染HIV和未感染HIV的人群。
Athletes feeling the heat at Qatar world championships	卡塔尔世界锦标赛上运动员喊热
Some competitors at the world athletics championships that began on Friday have already encountered their most challenging opponent: the sweltering Qatari heat.	星期五，世界田径锦标赛拉开帷幕，而有些参赛者则已遇到最具挑战性的对手——卡塔尔的难耐酷热。
With its suffocating humidity and daytime temperatures hovering around 38 degrees Celsius, Doha weather has been widely discussed among athletes and athletics officials and seen as a cause for concern in some events.	由于让人窒息的闷热和徘徊在38摄氏度的日间温度，多哈天气备受运动员和田径运动会官方的争论，也引起人们对某些赛事的担忧。
Those competing on the road in the marathon and walking races will begin their events in the middle of the night to minimize the heat's harmful effects.	马拉松和竞走比赛因为需要动用城市道路，因此将选择午夜作为比赛开始时间以使酷热的不良影响降到最低。
Although the heat is less of a threat to the athletes competing inside the Khalifa International Stadium, where temperatures are kept at around 21 degrees with the help of a cooling system, they have still had to adjust their training because they practise at an outdoor facility.	哈利法国际体育场内由于制冷系统的运作，温度保持在21摄氏度左右，因此酷暑对场内参赛者的影响不是很大，但还是需要调整赛前训练因为参赛者是在室外运动场地练习。
"We are from a hot climate as well, but nothing to compare with this," Bahamian coach Ronald Cartwright told Reuters.	“我们也是来自气候炎热的地方，但没办法跟这里比，”巴哈马队教练罗纳德·卡特赖特（Ronald Cartwright）告诉路透社。
"Here you walk outside and it's like somebody put a heater on you. I guess that is why they are doing it at night."	“在这里，你到外面去，就感觉有人放了个热炉在你身上。也许这就是为什么要晚上比赛。”
Athletics officials have pledged additional medical and safety measures for marathon runners and race walkers.	田径运动会官方已保证为马拉松和竞走参赛者提供额外的医疗和安全措施。
The IAAF, the global governing body of athletics, said the women's marathon, scheduled to start at midnight on Friday, would go ahead as planned as temperatures would be at or below 30 degrees.	国际业余田径联合会（IAAF）为田径运动会的全球性管理机构，表示定于星期五午夜举行的女子马拉松比赛，只要温度低于30度便会如期进行。
It said its medical delegate had assured athletes that weather conditions would be monitored all day and reported to the teams "to ensure the event is run at an acceptable level of health risk."	其还表示，该机构的医疗代表已向田径运动员保证，将全天监测天气状况并向相应团队报告以“确保各个赛事以允许的健康风险水平进行”。
Track athletes competing inside the stadium said it was unlikely that the heat would significantly affect their performances, but conceded that practices have been especially draining.	体育场内的田赛参赛者表示，酷暑不太可能影响到他们的发挥，但坦承赛前练习相当耗费体力。
"At practice I'm glowing because I'm sweating because it's so humid," said Rai Benjamin, who competes in the 400m hurdles.	“练习时，我感觉全身发烫，因为我浑身是汗再加上非常湿热的天气，”拉伊·本亚明（Rai Benjamin）表示，其是400米跨栏参赛者。
"It's like I got out of the shower. But I don't think it will be that bad because of the cooling system."	“就感觉洗了个澡一样。但是事情也没那么严重，毕竟还有制冷系统在。”
Shot putter Ryan Crouser, the 2016 Olympic champion, said he has had to heat up his shots to around 38 degrees Celsius to prevent them from becoming wet during practices in the sizzling heat and high humidity.	铅球参赛者瑞安·克劳泽（Ryan Crouser）是2016年奥运会冠军，他表示，铅球得加热到38摄氏度以防练习时因为酷热和高湿而被弄湿。
"The shot is far below the dew point, the instant you take it out, it's just soaking wet and it's dripping water," the American said. "It's worse than if it was pouring down rain... We've been fighting this a little bit."	“铅球温度远低于露点温度时，你一扔出去，它立马湿透而且在滴水，”这位美国运动员表示。“比下瓢泼大雨还麻烦……克服这个问题有点费力。”
European pole vault champion Armand Duplantis, who trains in the heat of the southern U.S. state of Louisiana, said the humidity can prove helpful in practice because the addition of moisture to the chalk on his hands "makes for a really nice grip."	欧洲撑杆跳高冠军阿曼德·杜普兰蒂斯（Armand Duplantis），其有经历美国路易斯安那州南部酷热下的训练，他表示，事实证明湿热可以帮助练习，因为额外的水汽遇到手上的粉末，“让你完美一握”。
But other pole vaulters who spray a sticky grip enhancer on their hands might have more difficulty holding onto their poles in the humidity, he said.	但有些撑杆跳高运动员将粘性握力增强剂撒在手上时，湿热条件下可能不太容易握紧撑杆，他表示。
"For people who use sticky spray, I can see it being a problem because it can get a little slimy and gooey," Duplantis said.	“使用粘性增强剂恐怕会带来麻烦，因为增强剂可能会变得有点粘稠湿滑，”杜普兰蒂斯表示。

A transcript of July phone conversation released by the White House on Wednesday shows Trump repeatedly pushed Zelensky to investigate former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter.	声明发布于周四，当时华盛顿正处于一片震惊当中。举报人指控特朗普滥用职权向乌克兰总统弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）“要求干预”即将到来的2020大选，白宫则采取措施予以掩盖。白宫周三发布的七月通话文字记录显示，特朗普反复向泽连斯基施压，要求其调查前副总统乔·拜登（Joe Biden）及其子亨特（Hunter）。
There is no evidence of wrongdoing by either Joe or Hunter Biden.	没有证据表明乔·拜登或亨特·拜登有任何不正当行为。

Moment hero police officer rushes onto busy motorway to save dog hit by car	英雄时刻，警察冲上繁忙高速救助被撞小狗
This is the heroic moment a police officer ran out onto a busy motorway to rescue an injured dog.	这是一个英勇的时刻，一名警察冲上繁忙的高速公路救助一只受伤的小狗。
Footage from Joseph Puglia's dashcam shows him jumping out of his police car within seconds of seeing the dog get hit by another vehicle.	Joseph Puglia的行车记录仪录像显示，他在看到小狗被另一辆车撞到之后，几秒内就跳出了自己的警车。
The officer, who works in Pinellas Park, Florida, wrapped the wounded pup in an emergency blanket, placed him in his SUV rushed to the nearest animal hospital.	这名在佛罗里达皮内拉斯公园工作的警察将受伤的小狗包在急救毯中，放在他的SUV内，立即赶往最近的动物医院。

The dog was brought to a local animal shelter and his rescuer has since been hailed as a hero.	这只小狗被带到了当地一个动物收容所。自此，救了它的警察也被盛赞为英雄。

After WeWork debacle, IPO market slams brakes on unprofitable companies	WeWork崩溃之后，IPO市场叫停无盈利公司
BOSTON (Reuters) - Companies making their debut on the U.S. stock market are getting a rough welcome, especially if they are losing money, casting a shadow over the calendar for initial public offerings for the rest of the year.	路透波士顿报道，首次在美国股市亮相的公司受到了不太友好的欢迎，尤其是他们如果亏损，将为全年剩余时间中的首次公开募股（IPO）日程都蒙上阴影。
The surprise postponement of the WeWork IPO has underscored how confidence is eroding in the market both for companies looking to raise capital and investors.	WeWork IPOr的意外延期，突显出市场对寻求融资的公司和投资者正在失去信心。
A more discerning market for initial public offerings continued to punish Peloton Interactive Inc PTON.O on Friday, a day after it began trading, as shares of the fitness startup fell 4% to $24.74. The company is now trading 15% below its Wednesday IPO price.	上周五，在Peloton Interactive公司开始交易的一天后，对首次公开募股更为挑剔的市场继续对其进行惩罚。这家健身初创公司的股价下跌4%至24.74美元。公司目前交易价格比其周三的IPO价格低15%。
In the past, public market investors have typically expected companies to become profitable within 18 months or so of an IPO. This timeline has been relaxed with money managers eager to add businesses with fast-growing revenue to their portfolios.	过去，公开市场投资者通常期望公司在IPO后18个月左右的时间内实现盈利。因资金经理急于将收入快速增长的业务加入其投资组合中，这一时间表已经放宽。
Recent deals, however, suggest an uncertain economic outlook is pushing investors to be more selective about the loss-making companies they are willing to back.	然而，近期交易表明，经济前景的不确定，让投资者在选择他们愿意支持的亏损公司时变得更加挑剔。
Peloton reported rapid top-line growth of 110% during the fiscal year that ended June 30. But the company also showed negative operating leverage, with operating expenses surging 147% over the prior year.	Peloton报告称，在6月30日截止的财政年度中，公司收入迅速增长，高达110%。但公司经营杠杆系数也显现负值，运营支出较上年激增147%。
Loss-making teeth-alignment company SmileDirectClub SDC.O earlier this month became the first U.S. IPO in three years to price above its target range and close down on its first trading day, according to research firm Renaissance Capital.	根据研究公司Renaissance Capital的数据，亏损的牙齿矫正公司SmileDirectClub本月早些时候，成为三年来第一家价格高于其目标区间，并在第一个交易日收盘的美国IPO。
The average IPO return in 2019 is now about 9%, down from more than 30% at the end of June and more than 18% about two weeks ago.	目前，2019年平均IPO回报率大约为9%，低于6月底的30%以上及大约两周前的18%以上。
In the United States, much of the attention in the third quarter has focused on a deal that failed to come to fruition - the planned IPO of WeWork parent We Company.	美国第三季度的注意力大多集中在一笔未能实现的交易上，即WeWork母公司We公司的IPO计划。
Having aimed to launch its IPO earlier in September, the company postponed plans to list until later in 2019, before replacing its chief executive officer and saying it was reviewing its timetable to go public.	该公司原本目标是在九月早些时候启动IPO，但后来推迟到2019年晚些时候再上市。此后公司更换了首席执行官，并表示正在重审其上市时间表。
Endeavor Group Holdings (EDR.N), an entertainment and talent agency company backed by Hollywood power broker Ari Emanuel with a track record of losses, made a last-minute decision to abandon its IPO due to the tough market conditions. Taking a lesson from the struggles earlier in 2019 of ride-hailing companies Uber Technologies (UBER.N) and Lyft Inc (LYFT.O), which have no stated timetable for becoming profitable, investors have started to push back on companies with a history of steep losses. "It will be a dialogue among bankers and boards and senior management teams where they say, "these were isolated and not comparable," or say "we have a sentiment shift and we need to be more conservative and use a different strategy,"" said David Ethridge, U.S. IPO services leader at audit firm PwC. The market was more receptive to lesser-known names such as cyber security company Ping Identity PING.N and cloud monitoring company Datadog Inc DDOG.O. Both companies have reported more modest losses and rely on selling to companies rather than to consumers.	Endeavor Group Holdings是一家由好莱坞实力经济人Ari Emanuel支持的娱乐及艺人经纪公司，曾有过亏损记录。由于严峻的市场形势，该公司在最后一刻决定放弃IPO。2019年早些时候打车公司Uber Technologies和Lyft公司的挣扎，让Endeavor Group Holdings引以为诫。这两间公司都没有明确的盈利时间表，而投资者已经开始对有急剧亏损史的公司进行反击。审计公司普华永道美国IPO服务主管David Ethridge说：“这将是银行家、董事会和高级管理团队之间的对话，他们会说‘这些是孤立个案，没有可比性’，或者说‘我们改主意了，我们必须更加保守，采取不同策略’。”市场更容易接受鲜为人知的公司，比如网络安全公司Ping Identity和云监控公司Datadog。这两家公司报出了较小亏损，并且都是依靠面对公司而不是面对消费者的销售。

"Queer Eye" star Jonathan Van Ness strutted his stuff on Capitol Hill on Thursday, joining forces with House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) to discuss the Equality Act.	“粉雄救兵”的明星乔纳森·凡·奈斯周四在国会山大放异彩，与众议院议长南希·佩洛西（加利福尼民主党人）共同探讨平权法案。
The Equality Act would extend nondiscrimination protections to LGBTQ individuals in credit, education, employment, housing, federal financial assistance, jury service and public accommodations.	平权法案将在信贷、教育、就业、住房、联邦经济援助、陪审团工作和公共场所方面，扩大对LGBTQ个人的无差别保护。
The bill would amend the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to include sexual orientation and gender identity to the list of already protected classes.	该法案将修订1964年的“民权法案”，将性取向和性别认同列入已得到保护的类别清单中。

He then shared a longer post picturing the two of them arm in arm, urging his followers to stand up to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.) and apply pressure to GOP senators to bring the Equality Act up for a Senate vote:	他随后分享了一段更长的帖子，描绘了他们两人手挽手的画面，号召他的粉丝站出来面对参议院多数党领袖米切·麦康奈尔（肯塔基州共和党人），并对共和党参议员施加压力，要求他们将平权法案提交给参议院表决：
Pelosi introduced the Equality Act on March 13. The House passed the legislation in May. It has not yet been brought to the Senate floor.	佩洛西在3月13日提出了平权法案。众议院在5月通过了这条法案。还没有提交给参议院讨论。
In August, the Trump administration asked the Supreme Court to essentially legalize anti-gay discrimination in the workplace, arguing in an amicus brief that the federal laws on employer discrimination in the Civil Rights Act of 1964 were not intended to protect individuals from being fired based on their sexual orientation.	8月，特朗普政府基本上要求美国最高法院将工作场合中的反同性恋歧视合法化，并在法庭之友意见书中争辩说，1964年“民权法案”关于雇主歧视的联邦法律，并不是为了保护个人不因性取向而被解雇。

Mr Corbyn was facing a backlash for his video which opens with him talking about Mrs Cox's murder three years ago by a far-Right activist in her West Yorkshire constituency.	他还分享了一篇帖子，称乔·考克斯的名字“不仅是政客拉拢人心的工具”，附文为：“这个。谢谢。”科尔宾先生的视频遭到强烈抵制，他在视频开头谈到了三年前考克斯女士被其西约克郡选区一名极右翼谋杀一事。
Speaking over a montage of clips of Mrs Cox, Mr Johnson and female MPs, Mr Corbyn said: "This Prime Minister knows these words can promote violence and have real consequences. He wants division. Clearly, he doesn't care about the violence on our streets."	伴随这一系列考克斯女士、约翰逊先生和其他女性议员的蒙太奇剪辑，科尔宾先生说：“这位首相明白这些语言会助长暴力，并带来实际后果。他想要分裂。很明显，他不在乎我们街头发生的暴力。”

When this was raised with him by women MPs, who themselves face death threats, he arrogantly dismissed them. It was nothing short of disgraceful." Former Labour MP John Woodcock shared the video and said: "You can really shut up. Meanwhile Tory MP and business minister Nadhim Zahawi said: "You are so wrong to use Jo Cox in this way, when her family have specifically asked for her not to be used in this way. To be kept out of politics.	与此同时，保守党议员兼英国商务部长纳齐姆·扎哈维说：“你这样利用乔·考克斯，实在大错特错。她的家人已经特地要求不要以这种方式利用她，不要再将她名字牵扯进政治。”
"If you have an ounce of decency Jeremy Corbyn you would take this video down." It follows a row over language in Parliament this week in which Mr Johnson said that the "best way" to honour Mrs Cox was to "get Brexit done." Her sister Kim Leadbeater called for a dialling down of extreme language saying it was "not helpful to Jo's kids."	“如果你还有一丝礼貌，杰里米·科尔宾，你应该撤下这个视频。”继本周国会上发表的一系列言论后，约翰逊先生说纪念考克斯女士“最好的方式”就是“完成脱欧”。考克斯女士的姐姐Kim Leadbeater呼吁减少极端语言，她说这“对乔的孩子毫无帮助”。
She told ITV: "For me to come out and say outrageous things about Boris Johnson - I just don't think that's a useful way of moving forward. I can say what I think is right and what I think is wrong but I'm going to try and do that in a measured manner."	她告诉ITV：“我只是觉得，让我站出来疯狂批判鲍里斯·约翰逊，对事情的进展毫无益处。我可以说我认为什么是对的，什么是错的，但我会尝试做到字斟句酌。”
The daughter of Labour MP Yvette Cooper spoke out yesterday to say she constantly fears for her mother's life because of the way people speak about politicians.	工党议员伊维特·库珀的女儿昨日表示，由于人们谈论政客的方式，她对母亲的生命感到担忧。
House rebukes Trump on border wall, but he plans veto	众议院就边境城一事谴责特朗普，而特朗普打算否决
The Democratic-controlled House is making a second attempt to overturn President Donald Trump's use of emergency powers to raid military base projects such as schools and target ranges to pay for his long-promised border fence.	总统唐纳德·特朗普动用紧急状态权力，攫取建设学校和靶场等军事基地项目的经费来修建他早就承诺的边境墙。民主党主导的众议院正为扭转这一局面进行第二次尝试。
The 236-174 vote sent the legislation to Trump, who is sure to veto it just as he killed a similar measure in March.	236票赞成、174票反对的结果将该法案交到特朗普手中，而他3月就曾扼杀了一项类似议案，这次也一定会予以否决。
The Senate passed the measure last week with about a dozen veteran Republican lawmakers rebuking Trump.	参议院上周通过了这项议案，约有十几名资深共和党议员谴责特朗普。
Friday's vote was different because it followed the recent release by the administration of a list of 127 military construction projects totaling $3.6 billion that will be canceled to pay for the border wall, including numerous projects in GOP districts and states.	周五的投票有所不同，因为这次投票是在政府最近公布127个军事建设项目名单之后进行的。总额36亿美元的这些项目将被取消，以支付边境墙的费用，其中包括许多共和党地区和州的项目。
Brazil says oil in spill along northeast beaches not Brazilian	巴西表示其东北海岸出现的原油泄漏并非巴西所为
Brazil's environmental agency Ibama said on Thursday that an analysis of a vast oil spill along the country's northeastern beaches showed the spilled crude did not originate in the country.	巴西环境机构环境和可再生资源协会（Ibama）于星期四表示，根据对该国东北海岸大片泄漏原油的分析结果，泄漏原油并非来自巴西。
Ibama said in a statement that it had been investigating the spill in several beaches in some northeastern states since Sept. 2. Local media showed pictures of sea turtles coated in black tar by the slick.	Ibama在一讲话中表示，9月2日以来，其正调查东北几个州某些海岸的原油泄漏。当地媒体登出海龟遭浮油围裹于黑色沥青的图片。
The spill spans over 1,500 kilometers (932 miles) of Brazil's northeast coast, affecting wildlife and polluting some of the postcard beaches in one of the nation's top touristic destinations, such as Praia do Futuro, in the state of Ceara, and Maragogi, in Alagoas state.	此次原油泄漏波及巴西东北部1500千米（923英里）的海岸，野生动物因此遭殃，该国热门旅游目的地之一某些如诗如画的海滩如塞阿拉州的未来海滩（Praia do Futuro）、阿拉戈斯州的马拉戈日，也受到污染。
Brazil's state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA said in a statement that it had concluded after a molecular analysis of the oil that the crude spilled was not produced nor sold by the company.	巴西国有石油公司巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）在一讲话中表示，根据对原油的分子分析结果，其认定泄漏原油并非由该公司生产或销售。
Crude oil is tested before export to make sure it complies with the standards of the refinery it is being shipped to. Crude oil from different fields can be identified according to a series of chemical signatures, including levels of sulfur and nitrogen, acidity and viscosity.	原油出口前会经过检测以保证其符合进口地炼油厂的标准。根据一系列化学标记，包括硫氮元素的含量、酸度、粘度，可以识别产自不同油田的原油。
The head of Brazil's oil agency ANP Decio Oddone said the agency believes the oil could have been spilled by a tanker transporting the crude far from the Brazilian coast, but added this possibility has not yet been confirmed yet. An ANP statement said there were no reports of spills by any operator of oil drilling rigs in the country.	巴西石油部门巴西国家石油管理局（ANP ）局长德西奥·奥多内（Decio Oddone）表示，该部门认为本次原油泄漏可能由某艘远离巴西海岸的运油油轮引起，但补充道尚不确定此猜测。ANP在一声明中表示，尚未接到国内任一钻油平台负责方的原油泄漏报告。
Some marine turtles were contaminated by the oil. They were rescued alive in the state of Rio Grande do Norte and sent to rehabilitation centers. Other animals were found dead, Ibama said, without disclosing species or numbers.	某些海龟惨遭原油毒害。在北里奥格兰德州，海龟被救活后会送到动物康复中心。其他的动物则已经死亡，Ibama表示，但没有透露具体物种或数字。
Petrobras, as the state oil company is known, said in a statement that even though it was not involved in the spill it was contributing to the clean-up efforts, with some 100 Petrobras employees helping clean the beaches.	巴西石油（Petrobras）又称巴西国家石油公司，在一讲话中表示，其虽然未涉及到此次原油泄漏，但还是在尽力执行清理工作，有出动100名员工帮助清理海滩。
Skoda to provide drivers with voice activated digital assistant	斯柯达将为驾驶员提供声控数字助理
Skoda is to introduce a digital assistant that can be activated with a verbal command. In an announcement Wednesday, the Czech car maker said the digital assistant could be activated by the phrase "Okay, Laura."	斯科达即将推出一款可通过口头指令激活的数字助理。这家捷克汽车制造商在周三的一份公告中表示，说出“Okay，Laura“即可唤醒数字助理。
The system, which supports six languages, is able to undertake a range of tasks including starting navigation to a destination and searching for music. It will initially be available in models of the Kamiq city SUV and the compact Scala. Part of the Volkswagen Group since 1991, the Skoda brand delivered 1.25 million vehicles globally in 2018, according to its annual report.	该系统支持六种语言，可执行包括开始目的地导航和搜索音乐等一系列任务。柯米克（Kamiq）城市SUV和紧凑型Scala两款车型会最先配备该系统。斯科达自1991年起成为大众集团子公司，据其年报，斯科达品牌于2018年在全球交付了125万辆汽车。
The company's introduction of a virtual, voice activated assistant mirrors efforts by other manufacturers in the sector. Some BMW cars, for instance, are now equipped with an "intelligent personal assistant" which can be activated by using a button, a personal activation word or the phrase "Hello, BMW." Verbal commands can be used to, among other things, activate seat heating, get information on tire pressure, and adjust the in-car temperature.	斯科达公司推出虚拟声控助理反映了汽车行业其他制造商的努力重点。比如，部分宝马车型现配备有“智能个人助理”，该系统可通过按键、个性激活词或短语“你好，宝马”激活。口头指令可用于激活座椅加热、获取胎压信息及调整车内温度等。
"Voice is the ideal interaction tool in the vehicle," Jack Palmer, a senior connected car specialist at SBD Automotive, said in a statement sent to CNBC via email on Thursday.	英国汽车咨询公司SBD的一位互联汽车专家Jack Palmer在周四发给CNBC的一封电子邮件声明中说道：“语音是理想的车内交互工具。”
"If the lion's share of commands from the driver can be inputted through virtual assistants, rather than fiddling around with touchscreens and buttons, the current epidemic of driver distraction will be greatly mitigated," Palmer added. "Automakers have realized this and the race is on for them to integrate their own solutions or partner with consumer electronics companies such as Google and Amazon."	“如果可以通过虚拟助手输入驾驶员的大部分指令，而非让驾驶员自己操作触控屏和按钮，那将可以大幅减少驾驶员分心的情况，”Palmer补充道，“汽车制造商已经意识到这点，现在他们正在竞争如何整合自己的解决方案或与谷歌、亚马逊等消费电子企业合作。”
The moves by firms such as Skoda and BMW point to a potential shift in the way people interact with their cars. Hannah Keshishian, an automotive analyst at market intelligence firm Mintel, told CNBC via email that one of its recent reports had highlighted how nearly 40% of U.S. consumers who owned a vehicle "would like to use a digital personal assistant in their vehicle." This, she added, "opens the door to greater possibilities for digital assistant vehicle connectivity."	斯科达和宝马等公司的举动表明，人类和汽车的交互方式可能发生改变。市场情报公司英敏特（Mintel）的一位汽车分析师Hannah Keshishian在一封邮件中告诉CNBC，其最近的一份报告中强调了近40%的美国车主“希望在汽车中使用个人数字助理。”她补充道，这“为数字助理汽车互联提供了更多可能。”
Ghana: World Rabies Day Observed	加纳：世界狂犬病日活动
The 13th World Rabies Day was marked in Accra on Wednesday with a call on pet owners to vaccinate their dogs in order to safeguard the lives of the citizenry.	周三在阿克拉市举行了第13届世界狂犬病日活动，呼吁宠物主人为宠物狗接种疫苗，以保障公民的生命安全。
The programme which was held under the theme "Rabies: Vaccinate to eliminate" was organised by the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture Veterinary Service.	活动主题为“接种疫苗，消除狂犬病”，由联合国粮农组织(FAO)与农业与兽医服务部联合举办。
It was aimed at highlighting the essential role of mass canine vaccination in rabies elimination in the country.	活动目的是强调大规模接种犬类疫苗在国内消灭狂犬病的重要作用。
Addressing the conference, the Assistant Director General and FAO Representative to Ghana, Mr Abebe Haile-Gabriel indicated that the issue of rabies could be minimised if efforts were geared towards vaccination and keeping stray animals away from humans especially children.	助理总干事兼粮农组织驻加纳代表Abebe Haile-Gabriel在会议上发言表示，如果努力接种疫苗，并让流浪动物远离人群，尤其是儿童，狂犬病问题就可以降到最低限度。
According to him, the 'Zero by 30' Global Strategic Plan "of the 500,000 people who died from rabies each year, 40 per cent are children living in Asia and Africa," and called for holistic approach to deal with the situation to save kids from rabies.	据他所说，“2030年前清零”全球战略计划中，“每年死于狂犬病的50万人中，40%是亚洲和非洲的儿童”，并呼吁采取整体性方法应对这种情况，保护儿童免受狂犬病的困扰。
Mr Haile-Gabriel stated that most stray animals carried rabies and re-echoed the need for the country to supplement the United against Rabies 2030 strategy that requires the pet owners to vaccinate animals that carried zoonotic diseases.	Haile-Gabriel表示，大多数流浪动物都携带狂犬病毒，并再次表示国家需要对“2030年联合抗击狂犬病战略”进行补充，要求宠物主人对携带人畜共患疾病的动物接种疫苗。
He underscored the need for the country to embark on five-year campaign and vaccination programme to create awareness to eliminate potential exposure of human to rabies.	他强调，国家需要开展五年计划和疫苗项目以提高人们的认识，消除人类暴露于狂犬病毒的潜在可能性。
A comprehensive roadmap for progressive elimination of rabies, he noted had been rolled out through the Ghana Rabies and Prevention Action Plan (2018-2030) to end epidemics of neglected tropical diseases by 2030.	他指出，逐步消除狂犬病的全面蓝图已通过“加纳狂犬病和预防措施计划(2018-2030)”展开，以在2030年前结束这种被人忽视的热带疾病的流行。
Mr Haile-Gabriel pledged the readiness of the FAO to collaborate with other stakeholders in preventing and controlling rabies in the country.	Haile-Gabriel保证，粮农组织愿意与其他利益相关方合作，对国内的狂犬病进行预防和控制。
Dr Owen Kaluwa, the World Health Organisation (WHO) Representative to Ghana observed that rabies was an endemic which had to be controlled to save lives.	世界卫生组织(WHO)驻加纳代表欧文·卡卢瓦博士指出，狂犬病作为一种传染病，必须加以控制，以挽救人们的生命。
He explained that through the "Zero human rabies deaths by 2030" strategy, countries were supported to develop and implement their national rabies elimination plans that embrace the One Health Concept and cross sectoral collaboration.	他解释说，通过“2030年前清零人类狂犬病死亡”战略，支持各国制定与实施本国狂犬病消除计划，包括“健康一体概念”和跨部门合作。
Dr Kaluwa noted that 99 per cent of zoonotic disease like rabies was transmitted from dogs to humans, adding that One Health approach to controlling and ultimately eliminating human rabies was expedient.	卡卢瓦博士指出，99%的狂犬病等人畜共患疾病是由狗传染给人类的，并补充说，“健康一体”策略对于控制和最终消灭人类狂犬病是有利的。
Director of Veterinary Service, Dr Asiedu Baah lamented that rabies had become global burden.	兽医服务部长Asiedu Baah博士感叹，狂犬病已成为全球负担。
"Though rabies has no cure, the infection is vaccine preventable, hence its elimination is feasible therefore any animal owner must ensure their animals are vaccinated," he stated.	“虽然狂犬病无法治愈，但可以用疫苗来预防感染，因此消灭狂犬病是可能的，而所有宠物主人必须确保宠物接种疫苗，”他说。
Dr Baah said although rabies was fully preventable using appropriate sustainable control strategies, lack of funds and concerted efforts had continued to result in escalation of human death and the spread of the endemic.	Baah博士说，尽管使用适当而可持续的控制措施完全可以预防狂犬病，但由于缺乏资金和共同努力，仍在导致人类死亡数量增加以及疾病的传播。
"It is imperative that the animal sector is adequately resourced to prevent transmission of rabies in dogs as a protective measure against the disease," he added.	“动物部门急需充足的资源来预防犬类狂犬病的传播，作为对抗疾病的保护措施。”他补充道。
The 12-year-old who "silenced the world"	“让世界沉默”的12岁女孩
Greta Thunberg has established herself as the planet's spokeswoman on climate change at the tender age of 16. But long before social media, another teenager was scolding UN leaders on the world stage 27 years ago.	格蕾塔·桑伯格在青涩的16岁那年已经成为了全球气候变化的发言人。但早在27年前，社交媒体尚未出现之时，就有另外一位青少年在世界舞台上指责了联合国领导人。
In the year since she organized school walkouts in her native Sweden to protest climate change, Greta Thunberg's environmental crusade has been unavoidable, culminating on Monday in an angry and passionate speech before the UN's Climate Action Summit, in which she lambasted politicians for stealing her "dreams" and her "childhood" with "empty words" while humanity stares down "a mass extinction."	自从格蕾塔·桑伯格在她的祖国瑞典组织学校罢课抗议那年起，她的环保运动势不可挡，并在周一联合国气候峰会前的一次愤慨的演讲中达到高峰。她在演讲中抨击政客用“空话”偷走了她的“梦想”和“童年”，而人类正面临“大灭绝”。
Thunberg's grim pronouncements have earned her savage criticism, and glowing praise. New York Magazine called her "the Joan of Arc of climate change," while The Guardian ranked her speech alongside President Lincoln's Gettysburg Address for its historical significance.	桑伯格的严厉声明给她带来了猛烈抨击和热情赞扬。《纽约杂志》盛赞她为“与气候危机作战的圣女贞德”，而《卫报》称，这一演讲的历史意义，堪比林肯总统的葛底斯堡演说。
Then again, they said the same about Severn Cullis-Suzuki in 1992. Long before Thunberg deadpanned to parliamentarians that "we probably don't even have a future any more," and netizens tore each other to shreds attacking and defending her, 12-year-old Cullis-Suzuki became known as the "The girl who silenced the world for five minutes" when she delivered a similar sermon before the UN Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro.	但他们在1992年就曾对珊文·古立斯-铃木说过一样的话。远在桑伯格面无表情地告诉国会议员“我们可能根本就没有未来”之前，远在攻击和支持桑伯格的网民争得你死我活之前，12岁的珊文铃木就已在里约热内卢举行的联合国地球峰会上发表了类似演说，并被誉为“让世界沉默五分钟的女孩”。
The tone of Cullis-Suzuki's speech is strikingly similar to Thunberg's. "We've come...to tell you adults that you must change your ways," she opened, just like Thunberg told the assembled adults "we will not let you get away with this."	珊文铃木与桑伯格的语气如出一辙。她开场便道：“我们是来……告诉你们成年人，你们必须改变你们的方式。”正如桑伯格对台下的成年人说：“我们不会让你就此逃脱。”
Just as Thunberg told the UN summit "we are in the beginning of a mass extinction and all you can talk about is the money and fairytales of eternal economic growth," Cullis-Suzuki told leaders that "losing my future is not like losing an election or a few points on the stock market."	再比如，桑伯格在联合国峰会上说：“我们正处于一场大灭绝的初始阶段，而你们现在讨论的只有金钱和经济永恒增长的童话故事，”而珊文铃木对领袖们说：“失去我的未来，跟输掉一场选举或股市上的几个点是不一样的。”
And underpinning both girls" messages was a nihilistic fatalism. "I am afraid to go out in the sun now because of the hole in our ozone. I am afraid to breathe the air because I don't know what chemicals are in it," Cullis-Suzuki said in 1992. Striking schoolchildren in 2019 carry banners reading "You'll die of old age, I'll die of climate change."	两个女孩演讲的根基都是虚无主义宿命论。珊文铃木1992年说：“因为臭氧层空洞，现在我害怕出门走在阳光下，我害怕呼吸空气，因为我不知道里面有什么化学物质。”2019年罢课的学生们举着标语：“你们会寿终正寝，我们则将死于气候变化。”
The environmental problems addressed by Cullis-Suzuki reflect the world of the early 1990s, when deforestation, the depletion of the ozone layer, and the extinction of species were the ecological concerns de jour. Yet humanity has been fairly successful at resolving those problems in the intervening years. Thanks to a landmark chemicals ban, ozone depletion has slowed dramatically, and forest cover worldwide has increased by an area the size of Texas and Alaska combined.	珊文铃木提出的环境问题反映了20世纪90年代初的世界，砍伐森林、臭氧层消耗和物种灭绝是当时聚焦的生态问题。但在人类对此进行干预的几年中，这些问题已得到相当成功的解决。由于划时代的化学物质禁令，臭氧层消耗速度大大降低，全球森林覆盖所增加的面积，相当于得克萨斯州和阿拉斯加州的总和。
Cullis-Suzuki herself went on to found an environmental think tank and work for UN Secretary General Kofi Annan's Special Advisory Panel in the early 2000s.	珊文铃木后来自己组建了一个环境智囊团，并在2000年代初为联合国秘书长科菲·安南的特别顾问小组工作。
So what does the future have in store for Thunberg? Well that depends how you look at Cullis-Suzuki's example. On one hand, none of her worst fears came to pass. On the other, world governments still have ecological problems to contend with, and are still being lectured by children about them.	那桑伯格未来将会如何呢？好吧，这取决于你如何看待珊文铃木的经历。一方面，她最害怕的事情都没发生；另一方面，全球各国政府仍需与生态问题进行斗争，也仍然因此受到孩子们的教训。
Assuming the world as we know it still exists 27 years from now - as Thunberg says it won't unless we slash carbon emissions to absolute zero in the next decade or so - then the teenage activist will likely look back on a long UN and NGO career that kicked off with one famous speech.	据桑伯格所言，如果我们不能在未来十年左右将碳排量减至零，27年后我们所知的世界将不复存在。假设27年后这个世界仍然存在，那么这位激进青年很可能会有一段由著名演讲而开启的漫长的联合国和非政府组织职业生涯供她回顾。
By then, another concerned child will likely be delivering a passionate warning about acid rain in the Martian colonies.	到那个时候，又会有另外一个忧心忡忡的孩子为火星殖民地的酸雨愤然发出警报。

The SNP has signalled it could support installing Jeremy Corbyn in Downing Street on a temporary basis to thwart a no-deal Brexit.	苏格兰民族党表示，他们可能支持杰瑞米·科尔宾在唐宁街暂时上位，以阻止无协议脱欧。
As tensions between MPs and Downing Street deepened, Nicola Sturgeon suggested it could row in behind the Labour leader as a caretaker prime minister until a general election.	随着议员与唐宁街之间的紧张关系加深，尼古拉·斯特金暗示，他们可能会支持工党领袖出任临时首相，直到再次大选。
Mr Corbyn called on rebel Tories and opposition MPs to back him to lead a temporary administration in August - but the move was met with resistance, particularly from the Liberal Democrat leader Jo Swinson.	科尔宾呼吁托利党反叛人士和反对派议员支持他在八月领导临时政府，但此举遇到了阻力，尤其是自由民主党领袖乔·斯文森的抵制。
Under the proposals, opposition parties would seek to oust Boris Johnson in a vote of no confidence and then form a unity government that would seek an extension to prevent the UK crashing out of the EU on 31 October.	根据提议，反对党将寻求在不信任投票中罢免鲍里斯·约翰逊，然后组建一个联合政府并寻求延期，以阻止英国在10月31日匆匆脱离欧盟。
The plan failed to gain cross-party support at the time, but senior figures in the SNP are concerned that Mr Johnson could defy a law forcing him to delay Brexit if there is no deal in place before 19 October.	该计划当时并未达成跨党派的支持，但苏格兰民族党的高层担心，如果10月19日前还未达成协议，约翰逊可能会违背迫使他推迟脱欧的法律。
Nicola Sturgeon, the SNP leader, suggested that Mr Corbyn could be brought in to secure the extension as leaving Mr Johnson in charge would be a "terrible idea."	苏格拉民族党领袖尼古拉·斯特金建议，可以请科尔宾来确保延期，因为让约翰逊负责是一个“可怕的想法”。
Responding to a tweet suggesting installing the Labour leader or another temporary prime minister, she said: "Agree with this.	她在回应一条建议推选工党领袖或者其他临时首相的推特中说：“同意这一点。

Veteran MPs Harriet Harman and Ken Clarke have both been named as potential figures to lead a unity government but a senior SNP source insisted it had to be the Labour leader.	资深议员哈里特·哈尔曼和肯·克拉克均被提名为可能领导联合政府的人选，但苏格兰民族党的一位高层信息人士坚持认为必须是工党领袖。

An SNP spokesperson said the party was committed to stopping a no-deal Brexit and removing "this dangerous and undemocratic prime minister as soon as possible."	苏格兰民族党的一位发言人表示，民族党会坚定地阻止无协议脱欧，并“尽快解除这位危险而不民主的首相”。
The spokesperson said: "It is now possible - if the political will is there - that parties could come together to ensure that the letter to secure an extension is not left in the hands of Boris Johnson and his cronies, who are determined to find a way to get around the Benn Act, but is instead sent by a temporary caretaker prime minister, who would be in office only as long as is necessary to send the letter, with an election held immediately afterwards.	这位发言人说：“如果有政治意愿的话，各党派有共同合作的可能，确保这封保证延期的信不要落在鲍里斯·约翰逊及其亲信手中，他们会坚持找到绕过Benn法案的方法；反而让临时首相发出这封信，而他在任的时间只需到发送信件为止，之后便立刻举行大选。”
"We remain open to all options to achieve the aim of stopping a no-deal Brexit and getting rid of Boris Johnson."	“我们仍然对所有能够实现阻止无协议脱欧、罢免鲍里斯·约翰逊的选择保持开放态度。”
Even with SNP support, it would come down to a knife-edge vote for Mr Corbyn. There are 288 Tory MPs, as well as 10 Democratic Unionists, so the opposition would need some of the 34 independent MPs to come on board.	即使有苏格兰民族党的支持，对科尔宾来说依然是一次悬而未决的投票。现有288名托利党议员，还有10位民主统一党员，所以反对派还需要34名独立议员中的一些人支持。
Labour argued that the plan was the "simplest and most democratic way to stop no deal."	工党认为，该计划是“阻止无协议最简单和最民主的方式”。
However the Liberal Democrats believe a temporary government led by Mr Corbyn cannot achieve the necessary support across the House, as he would need the backing of ex-Tory MPs and defectors from his own party.	然而，自由民主党人认为，科尔宾领导的临时政府无法在整个下议院获得必需的支持，因为他需要前托利党议员和本党背叛者的支持。
Kirstene Hair, Tory MP for Angus, said: "This report confirms what many have long suspected - SNP MPs will happily prop up Jeremy Corbyn in No10.	安格斯郡的托利党议员克里斯滕·海尔说：“这份报告证实了许多人们长期以来的猜测——苏格兰民族党的议员很乐意在唐宁街10号为杰瑞米·科尔宾撑腰。
"There is no doubt that Corbyn's weak stance on indyref2 is a deciding factor for the nationalists.	“科尔宾对待IndyRef2的软弱立场，对于民族主义者来说无疑是一个决定性因素。

"Only a Conservative government will stand up for those who voted "No" in what was meant to be a once in a generation event."	“只有保守党政府才会支持，在这种划时代的事件中投否定票的人。”
Over 50 Surrey University students banned from sports teams amid accusations of sexual harassment	因涉嫌性骚扰，50多名萨里大学学生被禁止参加运动队
"People are just doing everything you would expect from a lads holiday. It is accepted that this is an alcohol heavy, raucous trip."	“大家只是在做跟兄弟出去度假时一般都会做的事。这是一次公认的酗酒、喧闹的旅行。”
However, students said that this year behaviour of some students went too far, particularly during a game which involved members of the football club being dared by their teammates to make advances on women, while their friends attempt to "intercept" them.	但学生们说今年有的学生行为过火了，特别是在一场比赛中，参与比赛的足球俱乐部成员被队友煽动去勾搭女性，而他们的朋友则试图“阻拦”他们。
Alan Sutherland, chief executive of Surrey's student unions said: "We became aware of the misconduct, and as investigations proceeded any individual students who were accused of committing a "major" offence as per the student disciplinary regulations were referred to a university investigation."	萨里大学学生会主席Alan Sutherland说：“我们意识到了这种不端行为。随着调查不断推进，根据学生纪律规定被控犯有‘重大’违规行为的学生都已被转至大学调查。”
Three students were formally disciplined by the university, which launched its own investigation into the football team's conduct.	学校已对足球队行为展开调查，并对三名学生正式发出纪律处分。
One student was expelled for three counts of sexual misconduct or harassment, and one count of aggressive behaviour.	一名学生因三次不正当性行为、性骚扰以及一次攻击性行为被开除。
Meanwhile two other students, who were also accused of harassment, were issued with final warnings and made to issue apologies.	同时，被指控骚扰的另外两名学生已接到最后警告，并被要求发布道歉声明。
One was banned from University premises at certain times and the other was banned from attending organised social events. All three students were banned from attending their graduation ceremonies.	其中一名学生被禁止在某些时段进入大学区域，另一名学生被禁止参加有组织的社交活动。所有三名学生全部被禁止参加其毕业典礼。
The Surrey University men's football club said that they "sincerely apologise" for its members actions during the Croatia tour.	萨里大学男子足球俱乐部表示，他们为克罗地亚巡回赛中自己队员的行为“表示最真挚的歉意”。
Matt de Grood shouldn't be punished because of schizophrenia stigma	马特·德格鲁因精神分裂不应受到惩罚
In 2016, Matthew de Grood, the man who killed five people at a house party in Calgary, was found to be not criminally responsible for his actions.	2016年，在卡尔加里的一次家庭聚会中杀死五人的男子马特·德格鲁，被认定为不为其行为负刑事责任。
Now, in 2019, there is a hearing to determine whether or not he should be allowed more freedoms, such as unsupervised outings. The decision won't come for a few more weeks, so in the meantime we're left to wonder whether or not this is a good idea. There are two sides to this: one citing his violent behaviour in the past, calling to prevent it from happening again, and the other side which believes in the power of change and rehabilitation.	2019年的现在将举行听证会，决定是否应该允许他获得更多自由，比如无监督的外出活动。这个决定再过几周才会做出，所以在这期间，我们只能怀疑这究竟是不是一个好主意。对这件事有两方面观点：一方举证他过去的暴力行为，呼吁要防止这种情况再次发生，而另一方则相信改变和改造的力量。
First, let's examine the more pessimistic side. De Grood did stab and kill five people during a psychotic break. It was a violent and unpredictable attack. He suffers from schizophrenia, which is why he was found not criminally responsible, but has since been seeing a psychiatrist and taking his medication. His psychiatrist, Dr. Santoch Rai, has said in front of the review board that "if Matthew de Grood were to commit another offence, it would be severe." Despite his perceived improvement, there is still risk of re-offense. But is this reason enough to remain afraid? Is it enough to keep de Grood locked up?	首先，我们来看比较悲观的一方。德格鲁确实在精神病发作时刺死了五个人。这是一次难以预料的暴力袭击。他患有精神分裂症，因此被认定为无刑事责任，但此后一直在看精神科医生，并服用药物。他的精神科医生桑托赫·莱曾在审查委员会面前说，“假如德格鲁再次犯罪，那会非常严重。”尽管他的情况有所好转，但仍有再次犯罪的风险。但是，这个理由足以让人保持恐惧吗？把德格鲁关起来就够了吗？
As long as de Grood continues to take his medication, there isn't a huge risk of reoffense, so why are people so concerned? I believe the stigma surrounding people with mental illness, particularly those with schizophrenia, largely influences this fear. Certain mental illnesses have become less stigmatized, such as mood and anxiety disorders. But others, including schizophrenia, remain highly stigmatized. This is in large part due to numerous portrayals of schizophrenics as dangerous people with voices in their heads telling them to kill people.	只要德格鲁继续服药，就不会有很大再次犯罪的风险，那么人们为什么会这么担心？我相信，人们对精神病患者、尤其是精神分裂症患者的成见，很大程度地影响了这种恐惧。有些精神疾病已经没有那么污名化了，比如情绪和焦虑失常。但是其他疾病，包括精神分裂症，依然被高度误解。这很大程度上是由于，许多人把精神分裂症患者描绘成危险的人，他们的脑子里有声音告诉他们要去杀人。
That was the case in this situation, but these instances are rare, and that's perhaps why we remember them so well when they occur. In fact, the majority of schizophrenic individuals are nonviolent, and are more likely to be the victims rather than the perpetrators of crime or violence. In light of this, it seems unreasonable to insist that de Grood be denied certain freedoms when the fear of re-offense is based more on a prejudiced attitude towards people with schizophrenia than actual likelihood.	这次案件确实是这种情况，但是这种事情很少见，也许这就是为什么当这种事发生的时候，我们会记得那么清楚。实际上，大多数的精神分裂症患者并不暴力，反而更有可能成为犯罪或者暴力的受害者，而不是施暴者。鉴于此，当人们对再次犯罪的恐惧，更多是基于对精神分裂症患者的偏见，而不是实际的可能性时，坚持剥夺德格鲁的某些自由似乎并不合理。
I don't believe de Grood should ever be unsupervised permanently. A parole-like system where he has to check in to make sure he's still taking his medication could work well. Arguing that he or other mentally ill people remain institutionalized unless absolutely necessary is a form of segregation. It perpetuates the idea that mentally ill people, those with schizophrenia in particular, cannot ever mesh with society; thus continuing the stigma and perpetuating the idea that they are dangerous criminals. He was found not criminally responsible by a court of law, so why should he be treated like a prisoner instead of someone who was ill and is now better?	我认为德格鲁应该被永远监督。一个让他必须登记以确认自己还在服药的类似假释的系统，可能会很有效。要求他或者其他精神病患者必须待在精神病院，除非绝对必要，是一种歧视性的隔离。它使精神病患者、特别是精神分裂症患者永远无法与社会融合的观念长期存在；导致这种成见一直持续，并使认为他们都是危险的罪犯的观念一直存在下去。法院认定他不负刑事责任，那么为什么要把他当作犯人，而不是一个当时生病了、现在有所好转的病人呢？
Hungarian PM Orban defends his candidate for EU executive, "has solutions in pocket"	匈牙利总理欧尔班为其欧盟执行委员候选人辩护，并称“心里有数”

The move is seen as an embarrassment for Orban, who proposed Trocsanyi, and who has been in constant conflict with Brussels over his migration policy and other issues.	此事让欧尔班显得很尴尬，因为是他推举了Trocsanyi。另外，他也一直在移民政策等问题上与布鲁塞尔发生冲突。
Babies on a plane: Japan Airlines unveils tool to tackle horror of screaming infants	飞机上的婴儿：日本航空公司推出工具，解决婴儿尖叫的恐怖问题
Being stuck on a long-haul flight within earshot of a crying baby could be a thing of the past for passengers on Japan Airlines (JAL), after the carrier unveiled an online booking tool that indicates where toddlers will be seated.	对于日本航空公司(JAL)的乘客来说，被困在长途航班中，听着婴儿的哭闹，这种事可能将成为过去。日航推出了一种在线预订工具，能显示幼儿就座的位置。
When passengers with children aged between eight days and two years old reserve their seat, a child icon automatically appears on the seat plan, alerting other passengers who have yet to select their seats.	当携带年龄在八天至两岁的儿童的乘客预定座位时，一个儿童图标会自动显示在座位计划上，提醒其他还未选择座位的乘客。
JAL was quick to point out that the new feature did not guarantee that passengers would be out of earshot of a screaming infant.	日航很快指出，新功能并不能保证乘客听不到婴儿的叫喊声。
The icon would not appear if passengers booked their flight through a third party or were part of a tour group, or if there was a last-minute change of aircraft, the airline's website said.	日航官网说，如果乘客通过第三方预定机票，参加了旅行团，或者在最后一刻更换飞机，这个图标就不会显示。
JAL and other airlines have yet to come up with way of anticipating seat reservations by serial snorers and passengers who fully recline their seats during in-flight meals.	至于打呼噜的乘客和在机上用餐时把座位完全后倾的乘客，日航和其他航空公司还没有想出办法如何检测他们的座位预订。
But the move attracted praise from some social media users.	但此举引来了一些社交媒体用户的赞扬。
"Thank you, @JAL_Official_jp for warnings me about where babies plan to scream and yell during a 13 hour trip," Rahat Ahmed, a businessman, tweeted. "This really ought to be mandatory across the board."	“@JAL_Official_jp 谢谢你提醒我在13个小时的旅途中，婴儿计划在什么地方大喊大叫。”一位名叫Rahat Ahmed的商人发推说。“这真的应该全面强制推广。”
Others, though, castigated travellers for intolerance towards fellow passengers.	不过，也有人指责旅客对其他乘客不宽容。
"They are babies, as we all once were. We need to learn tolerance or will soon start needing a map of seat locations for mouth breathers, droolers, farters, drunks, and perhaps a lot more things in life," one user said.	“他们是婴儿，我们都曾是婴儿。我们需要学会宽容，否则很快就会需要一张座位图，标记用口呼吸的人、流口水的人、爱放屁的人、喝醉的人，或许是生活中的更多方面。”一位用户说。
