Brexit can get plenty more toxic from here	脱欧从此变得更加有毒
Humiliation in the courts at home is a taste of what awaits Johnson in Brussels if he tries to weasel out of his commitments to request an extension. That will comfort European officials, who would most probably agree to it. Mainly because taking more time to find a solution reduces the threat of a no-deal Brexit, which would be economically harmful to both sides.	如果约翰逊在布鲁塞尔试图推诿他的承诺而申请延期，回国后他将面临法庭上的羞辱。这将让欧洲官员得到安慰，他们很可能会同意这一举措。这主要是因为，他们能够用更多时间寻找解决方案，以减少无协议脱欧的威胁，这对双方都将造成经济损失。
Yet European diplomats can also see that the political bedlam in the UK lends itself to delay without decisions. Lawmakers in Parliament were able to set aside their differences to tie Johnson's hands and seek an extension, but that's about all they can agree on. This is the same Parliament that rejected the former prime minister Theresa May's hard-fought Brexit deal with the EU three times. Unless there's an election - another decision on which MPs have a final say - that won't change.	然而欧洲外交官员也发现，英国的政治乱象同样导致无法做出决定，使得脱欧延期。议会议员能够放下分歧，共同约束约翰逊并寻求延期，但他们能达成的共识也仅限于此。这也是当年三次拒绝前首相特蕾莎·梅强硬的脱欧协议的议会。除非再进行一次选举，决定哪位首相拥有最后发言权，否则现状就不会改变。
But even an election is a grim prospect for European capitals hoping for a friendly resolution to the Brexit mess. The opposition Labour Party's Brexit policy is a painful contortion act that's almost impossible to understand; the centrist Liberal Democrats' idea to cancel Brexit altogether is seen as extreme. The longer this drags on, the more it eats away at the smooth functioning of the EU.	然而对于希望友好解决脱欧乱象的欧洲各国来说，即使进行选举，情况也不容乐观。反对党工党的脱欧政策是一个痛苦的扭曲法案，令人无法理解；而中间派的自由民主党要完全取消脱欧的想法似乎又很极端。脱欧拖得越久，就越损耗欧盟的正常运作。
There might be more optimism in Brussels if the outline of a workable deal was already sitting on a desk somewhere in the European Commission's Berlaymont headquarters. But there isn't.	如果欧盟委员会贝雷蒙总部某处的办公桌上已有一份可行方案的大纲，布鲁塞尔也许就会更加乐观。但并没有这样的方案。
Johnson's regular bashing of his predecessor's "backstop" proposal to avoid a return to a hard border in Ireland and protect the EU single market hasn't led to any convincing alternatives. Officials say the proposals sent in by the UK on alternative arrangements aren't concrete enough to be considered operational in time for an October 31 exit.	约翰逊经常抨击前任首相的“后盾”提案，避免回到与爱尔兰划分明确界限，并保护欧盟单一市场，却没有提出任何令人信服的备选方案。官员表示，英国提交的备选安排提案不够具体，不足以在10月31日脱欧前考虑实施。
And Johnson's weakness will give the 27 leaders facing him even less incentive to erase crucial red lines, despite the claim by Michael Gove, the UK minister in charge of a no-deal Brexit, that they're "shifting" on the backstop.	而约翰逊的软弱让面对他的27位领导人更没有了抹除关键红线的动机，尽管负责无协议脱欧的英国大臣迈克尔·戈夫声称，他们正在向后盾政策“转变”。
In an ideal world, a series of blows landing on Johnson - who is also under fire over his rhetoric in the debate over Brexit - would bring the match closer to an end. Europe should still try to extract maximum concessions from the UK, given it has no choice but to negotiate with the current government while trying to preserve unity among the rest of its 27 member states - which is going to get harder the longer this drags on. If there's a window to try yet again to put a deal before the UK parliament, the EU should grab it.	在理想的世界里，对约翰逊的一系列打击，以及他因为脱欧辩论时说的花言巧语而遭受抨击，将让比赛更快结束。欧洲依然应该尝试从英国争取最大的让步，因为欧盟已别无选择，只得和现任政府谈判，同时努力维护其余27个成员国的团结——随着脱欧的拖延已变得日益困难。如果有机会再次尝试向英国议会提出交易，欧盟便应该抓住。
But this is more like a soccer match with 27 players on one side lining up to defend while the player in the opposite team tries to pick up the ball and go home.	但这更像一场足球比赛，一方的27位球员在排队防御，而对方的球员却只想捡球回家。
The EU is good at setting rules and red lines and sticking to them; it's less good at unilaterally imposing its will. The UK is hemmed in by its own internal contradictions, at least until an election or a second referendum breaks the impasse.	欧盟善于制定规则和红线，并且坚持遵它们；却不善于单方面推行自己的意愿。英国正受困于内部矛盾，起码再一次进行选举或者全民公投才能打破这种僵局。
Brexit can get plenty more toxic from here.	脱欧从此变得更加有毒。
Black hole swallowing and ripping apart star captured for first time	首次拍摄到黑洞吞噬并撕裂恒星
A gigantic black hole has been captured pulling in and ripping apart a star for the first time.	一个巨大黑洞吞噬并撕裂一颗恒星的过程首次被拍摄下来。
The star, which was about the same size as our sun, was seen from 375 million light years away warping and spiralling into the gravitational pull of a supermassive black hole, researchers said in the Astrophysical Journal.	研究人员在《天文物理期刊》中说，这颗恒星与太阳大小相当，距离地球约3.75亿光年，在超大质量黑洞的引力作用下，恒星被拉扯变形并旋入黑洞。
It was then sucked into oblivion in a rare cosmic occurrence astronomers call a tidal disruption event.	随后，它消失于无形。天文学家将这种罕见的宇宙事件称为潮汐破坏现象。
NASA's planet-searching telescope, the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite - TESS - captured the detailed timeline from beginning to end for the first time.	美国国家航空航天局的行星搜寻望远镜凌日系外行星勘测卫星TESS首次捕捉到了从头到尾的详细过程。
Astronomers used a worldwide network of telescopes to detect the phenomenon before looking at TESS, whose permanent viewing zones designed to find distant planets, caught the beginning of the violent event.	天文学家在使用TESS之前已经用国际太空望远镜网络检测到了这一现象，而TESS专门用于搜寻遥远行星的固定观察区捕捉到了这一激烈现象的开端。
Thomas Holoien, an astronomer for the Carnegie Institution for Science who led the research, said: "This was really a combination of both being good and being lucky, and sometimes that's what you need to push the science forward."	卡内基科学研究所天文学家Thomas Holoien主领此次研究，他说：“这次真的又好又幸运，有时候科学发展正待于此。“
Stars get sucked in when they venture too close to a supermassive black hole, which lives at the centre of most galaxies, including the Earth's Milky Way.	恒星离超大质量黑洞过近，就会被吸入黑洞。很多星系的中央都有这样的超大质量黑洞，包括地球所在的银河系。
The black hole's impressive gravitational forces tear the star apart, with some of its material thrown into space and the rest into the black hole, forming a disc of hot, bright gas as it is swallowed.	黑洞的惊人引力将恒星撕裂，部分物质会被抛入太空，其他部分则被黑洞吞噬，并在被吞噬的过程中形成一个明亮的气体热盘。
Mr Holoien added: "Specifically, we are able to measure the rate at which it gets brighter after it starts brightening, and we also observed a drop in its temperature and brightness that is unique."	Holoien先生补充道：“具体来说，我们能够测量它开始发光后变亮的速度，我们还观察到它气温和亮度的下降，这是其独有的。”
UK business committee to probe Thomas Cook collapse	英国商业委员会调查托马斯库克破产案
The UK's Civil Aviation Authority said today that 72 flights are scheduled to operate to bring back a further 16,000 people to the country following the collapse of travel group Thomas Cook.	英国民航局今日表示，由于托马斯库克旅游公司破产，已安排72家航班再接1.6万人回国。
The aviation regulator said it has brought back over 40% of the total number of passengers in the largest peacetime repatriation 'Operation Matterhorn' launched on Monday.	航空监管机构表示，周一启动的和平时期最大规模遣返“马特洪峰行动”已带回超过40%的游客。
Meanwhile, the British parliament's business committee has launched an inquiry into the collapse of Thomas Cook and will seek to question the management over issues such as executive pay and accounting practices.	与此同时，英国议会商业委员会已对托马斯库克破产案展开调查，将会就高管薪酬和财会操作等质询管理层。
Thomas Cook, the world's oldest tour operator, collapsed in the early hours of Monday, hitting hotel owners, tourist sites and resorts around the world.	托马斯库克是全球历史最悠久的旅行社，它在周一凌晨宣布破产，波及全球各地酒店业主、景点和度假地。
"The main players in the sad demise of Britain's oldest travel firm should face public scrutiny and be held to account for their actions before the company collapsed," said Rachel Reeves, Chair of the Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) Committee.	英国商业能源和产业战略（BEIS）委员会主席Rachel Reeves说：“在英国最古老旅行社的不幸倒闭中，主要相关人士都应面临公开审查，并为其在公司倒闭前的行为负责。”
Evidence hearings will begin in mid-to-late October.	听证会将在10月中下旬开始。
"Directors will welcome the opportunity to set the record straight and demonstrate that their conduct was always in the best interests of Thomas Cook's customers, employees and stakeholders," a person familiar with the company told Reuters.	一位熟悉该公司的人士告诉路透社：“董事们很乐意借此机会澄清一切，证明他们的行为始终符合托马斯库克客户、员工和利益相关者的最大利益。“
Why The Times Published Details of the Whistle-Blower's Identity	为何《泰晤士报》公布检举人身份
On Thursday, The Times published exclusive details about the identity of the whistle-blower whose claims led Democrats to begin an impeachment inquiry against President Trump this week. (The article reported that the whistle-blower is a C.I.A. officer who was previously detailed to work at the White House and had expertise on Ukraine.)	本周，一名检举人的主张使民主党开始弹劾特朗普总统。周四，《泰晤士报》公布了这名检举人的独家信息。（报道称，该检举人为中央情报局官员，曾在白宫专门从事乌克兰相关工作。）
Many readers, including some who work in national security and intelligence, have criticized The Times's decision to publish the details, saying it potentially put the person's life in danger and may have a chilling effect on would-be whistle-blowers.	包括国家安全与情报处工作者在内的众多读者批评《泰晤士报》这一决定，并称此举可能使检举人面临生命危险，也可能使其他的潜在检举人胆寒。
We took their concerns to Dean Baquet, The Times's executive editor, who responded to them in a discussion with the Reader Center:	我们向《泰晤士报》责任编辑Dean Baquet提出这些忧虑，他在读者中心作出回应：
The president and some of his supporters have attacked the credibility of the whistle-blower, who has presented information that has touched off a landmark impeachment proceeding. The president himself has called the whistle-blower's account a "political hack job."	检举人提供的信息，引发了对特朗普总统的弹劾调查，而总统及其支持者驳斥了检举人的可信度。总统本人称检举人的陈述为“政治打手干的事”。
We decided to publish limited information about the whistle-blower - including the fact that he works for a nonpolitical agency and that his complaint is based on an intimate knowledge and understanding of the White House - because we wanted to provide information to readers that allows them to make their own judgments about whether or not he is credible.	我们决定公布检举人的少量信息，包括他在非政府部门工作，以及他的投诉是基于与白宫的密切接触和深入了解。我们这样做，是想为读者提供信息，让他们自己对检举人是否可信做出判断。
China Says It Didn't Fight Any War Nor Invaded Foreign Land	中国表示既不会主动挑起战争也不会侵占别国领土
China on Friday said it has not provoked a "single war or conflict" or "invaded a single square" of foreign land, skirting any reference to the 1962 war with India.	中国于星期五表示，其既不会挑起“任何一场战争或冲突”，也不会“侵占任何一寸”别国领土，只字不提1962年的中印战争。
"China has always been dedicated to resolving territorial and maritime delimitation disputes through negotiation and consultation," stated an official white paper released, four days ahead of the country set to celebrate its 70th anniversary of the leadership of the ruling Communist Party of China (CPC) on October 1.	“中方始终致力于通过谈判、协商方式解决领土和海洋划界争端，”一官方发布的白皮书陈述道，而四天后将庆祝10月1日中国共产党（CPC）统治中国的70周年纪念日。
"China safeguards world peace through real actions. Over the past 70 years, China has not provoked a single war or conflict, nor invaded a single square of foreign land," the paper titled "China and the World in the New Era" said.	“中方以实际行动维护世界和平。70年来，中方没有主动挑起过任何一场战争和冲突，没有侵占别国过一寸领土，”一名为“新时代的中国和世界”的白皮书说道。
The white paper, while highlighting the CPS's "peaceful rise" made no reference of the bloody 1962 war with India and the vast tracts of land, especially in the Aksai Chin area, occupied by China.	此白皮书强调现行政治体系下中国的“和平崛起”，但却避开1962年波及范围极广的中印血腥之战，又尤其是在中占阿克赛钦地区。
The Sino-India border dispute involving 3,488-km-long Line of Actual Control (LAC) remained unresolved. China also claims Arunachal Pradesh as part of South Tibet, which India contests.	中印边界争端涉及长达3488km的实际控制线（LAC），至今仍未解决。中国同时占有阿鲁纳恰尔邦并将其纳入西藏南部版图，印度对此表示抗议。
So far, the two countries held 21 rounds of Special Representatives talks to resolve the border dispute.	目前为止，双方已举行21轮特别代表对话以解决边界争端。
Besides the 1962 war, India and China had a major military standoff at Doklam in 2017 when the People's Liberation Army (PLA) tried to lay a road close to India"s narrow Chicken Neck corridor connecting with the North-Eastern states in an area also claimed by Bhutan.	除1962年战争外，中印于2017年在洞朗发生紧张军事对峙，起因是中国人民解放军（PLA）意图于一不丹宣称主权的区域修筑公路，该公路靠近毗邻印度东北部的西里古里走廊。
It was finally diplomatically resolved after which both sides pulled back their troops.	双方撤军后最终以外交手段化解冲突。
China also had a major military conflict with Vietnam in 1979. China claims sovereignty over all of South China Sea. Vietnam, Malaysia, the Philippines, Brunei and Taiwan have counter claims.	此外，中国还于1979年与越南发生紧张军事冲突。中国宣称对整个南海拥有绝对主权。越南、马来西亚、菲律宾、文莱、台湾则不以为然。
"China has achieved full resolution of land border delimitation problems with 12 of its 14 neighbouring countries, and delineated the China-Vietnam maritime boundary in the Beibu Gulf," the white paper said, noting that since reform and opening up in 1978, the country has cut its armed forces "by over four million."	“中方同14个邻国中的12个国家彻底解决了陆地边界问题，划定了中越北部湾海洋边界，”该白皮书表示，同时提及改革开放以后，中方已裁军“400余万”。
The two-million strong Chinese military still remain the world's largest.	中国目前拥有200万浩大的军队，仍然是世界之最。
Prolonged monsoon brings floods and chaos to many parts of India	长时间的雨季给印度多地区带来洪水和混乱
India's monsoon season has overrun by almost a month, with unprecedented rainfall causing deaths from collapsing buildings and many crops beginning to rot.	印度的雨季已经持续了近一个月，空前的降雨导致楼房倒塌致人死亡，还有许多农作物开始腐烂。
Normally the monsoon in north India recedes by the beginning of September, but the average rainfall this month has been 37% above normal. If the situation continues for the remaining few days, it will be the latest the monsoon has ever receded in decades, according to experts in the India Meteorological Department.	通常印度北部的雨季在九月初就会消退，但这个月的平均降雨量却比正常情况高出37%。印度气象部门的专家表示，如果这种情况再持续几天，那么将成为几十年来消退时间最晚的雨季。
Many areas of the country are still getting unprecedented rain, the latest being the town of Pune in western India, where torrential rain on Wednesday and Thursday caused several deaths and havoc from collapsed buildings.	印度许多地区仍在遭受空前的降雨，最近一次是在印度西部的普纳镇，周三和周四的暴雨让房屋倒塌，造成数人死亡和混乱局面。
Homes were flooded and people waded through streets with water up to their knees in scenes normally seen only at the height of the monsoon.	房屋遭到淹没，人们在街上涉水而过，水漫到了膝盖处，这种景象通常只有在雨季最盛的时候才能看到。
Other cities such as Kolkata, Lucknow and Hyderabad have also experienced heavy rainfall. Uttarakhand state in the north has seen extensive damage to homes from the prolonged rains.	其他城市如加尔各答、勒克瑙和海德拉巴等地也出现了暴雨。在北乌塔拉坎德邦，持续的降雨对房屋造成了大面积的破坏。
The monsoon was also late to arrive. Many areas suffered water shortages and farmers braced themselves for a possible drought.	雨季到来的时间也很晚。许多地区出现缺水现象，农民也在为可能出现的旱灾作准备。
The extended monsoon is not welcome among farmers. "This amount of rain is not normal at this time of the year. It is making my vegetables - I've got cabbage, beans, peas and tomatoes at the moment - rot," said Prakash Mehra, a small farmer in Bhimtal in Uttarakhand.	延长的雨季在农民种并不受欢迎。“这样的降雨量在这个时节并不正常。我的蔬菜正在烂掉——我现在种的有卷心菜、豆子、豌豆和番茄。”乌塔拉坎德邦比姆塔尔的一个小农户Prakash Mehra说。
For consumers, the impact of the delayed and now late-receding monsoon has meant a rise in the price in the price of onions, an essential ingredient in Indian food. Onions are selling at 80 rupees (about £1) a kilo in cities such as Delhi and Mumbai, as opposed to the normal 20 rupees (23p).	对于消费者来说，受雨季推迟到来又延迟消退的影响，意味着印度食品中必不可少的食材——洋葱的价格上涨。洋葱在德里和孟买等城市的售价是80卢比（约1英镑）一公斤，与之相对地，通常的价格是20卢比（23便士）。
Festivals are also at risk. The next big festival is Dussehra on 8 October, when Hindus erect giant, comic book-style effigies of Ravana, a figure from the Hindu epic The Ramayana who sports a bushy moustache and an evil grin.	节日也有了风险。下一个大型节日是10月8日的十胜节，印度教徒将竖立起巨大的、漫画式的罗波那肖像，罗波那是印度史诗《罗摩衍那》中的人物，留着浓密的小胡子和邪恶的笑容。
Burning Ravana symbolises the triumph of good over evil. But given that the effigies are made of paper, if the monsoon continues, Ravana might have the last laugh.	焚烧罗波那象征着善良战胜了邪恶。但考虑到肖像是用纸做的，如果雨季继续下去，罗波那可能会笑到最后。
Julian Assange: Private security firm 'spied on WikiLeaks founder in Ecuadorian embassy for CIA'	朱利安·阿桑奇：私人安保公司“为中情局监视厄瓜多尔大使馆里的维基解密创始人”
A Spanish private security company hired to protect the Ecuadorian embassy in London when Julian Assange lived there spied on the WikiLeaks founder for the US intelligence service, it has been claimed.	据称，朱利安·阿桑奇在厄瓜多尔驻伦敦大使馆避难期间雇佣的西班牙私人安保公司，是为美国情报机构监视这位维基解密创始人。
A report in Spanish newspaper El Pais said the company, UC Global SL, allegedly handed over audio and video to the CIA of meetings Assange held with his lawyers.	西班牙报纸《El Pais》的一篇报道表示，UC Global SL公司称已将阿桑奇与其律师们会晤的音频和视频交给中情局。
The company is being investigated over the claims by Spain's High Court, the Audiencia Nacional, said the report.	报道称，在西班牙最高法院国家法院的要求下，这家公司正在就这些指控接受调查。
Assange filed a criminal complaint himself, in which he accused the company of violating his privacy and the secrecy of his client-attorney privileges.	阿桑奇本人提起了一项刑事诉讼，指控该公司侵犯了他的隐私权和保密的律师客户特权。
El Pais said UC Global SL had failed to respond to requests for comment on the claims.	《El Pais》表示，UC Global SL对此指控不予置评。
In April, Assange was dragged out of the embassy after being handed over to the British authorities by Ecuador.	4月，阿桑奇被厄瓜多尔移交给英国当局后，被拖出使馆。
He took refuge there in 2012 while on bail and facing extradition to Sweden over sex assault allegations, saying he feared extradition to the US if he left over the activities of WikiLeaks.	他2012年保释期间一直在那里避难，并因性侵指控将被引渡到瑞典。他说他担心如果他遗留一些维基泄密的活动，他将会被引渡至美国。
The US formally requested his extradition in June on 18 charges, including computer misuse and the unauthorised disclosure of national defence information.	美国在6月正式以18项指控要求引渡阿桑奇，其中包括计算机滥用和未经授权披露国防机密。
He is accused of working with former US army intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning.	他被控与前美国陆军情报分析师切尔西・曼宁同谋。
He is now in Belmarsh prison in London after being jailed for violating bail conditions imposed over the Swedish extradition request and was due to be released last week, but was remanded in custody pending a hearing of the US extradition case in London in February 2020.	他因违反瑞典引渡要求的假释条件而被判入狱，现正在伦敦贝尔马什监狱，原定于上周获释，但因即将在2020年2月在伦敦举办的美国引渡听证会而还押候审。
In May, Swedish prosecutors reopened their investigation into an allegation of rape against Assange - an allegation he has always denied.	瑞典检察官于5月重新开始审理阿桑奇一直否认的强奸指控。
Omni Air flight lands in Baltimore after declaring emergency	Omni航空飞机紧急降落巴尔的摩
The Federal Aviation Administration says an Omni Air International jet landed safely at Baltimore Washington International Airport after declaring an emergency.	美国联邦航空局(FAA)表示，一架Omni国际航空飞机在宣布紧急状态后，安全降落于巴尔的摩华盛顿国际机场。
The FAA said in an email that Flight 328 landed at BWI at 6:19 p.m. on Thursday because of what was described as a hydraulic problem with the Boeing B777.	FAA在一封邮件中称，328航班于周四下午6点19分降落在巴尔的摩华盛顿机场，原因是这架波音777飞机据描述出现了液压问题。
According to the FAA, the flight departed from Baltimore, but its destination wasn't known. It's unclear how many people were on board. The agency is investigating the incident.	据FAA所述，此次航班从巴尔的摩起飞，目的地未知。机上人员数量尚不明确。相关部门正在调查此次事件。
A telephone message left at Tulsa, Oklahoma-based Omni Air International was immediately returned Thursday night.	位于俄克拉何马州塔尔萨市的Omni国际航空公司，在周四晚收到电话留言后立刻进行了回复。
Why we still need Gandhi	我们为什么仍需要甘地
The leaders of the world's two largest democracies need to heed the principles of a remarkable man whose 150th birthday we are currently celebrating.	我们正在庆祝一位伟人的150年诞辰。全世界最大的两个民主国领导人都应注意这位伟人所提出的原则。
Mohandas Karamchand "Mahatma" Gandhi, who was born on Oct. 2, 1869, left a worldwide legacy with his focus on ethics, nonviolence, tolerance and social justice. He had a profound impact on two of the most important mass mobilizations in the United States.	圣雄莫罕达斯·卡拉姆昌德·甘地出生于1869年10月2日，他关注伦理、非暴力、宽容与社会公正，为全世界留下丰厚遗产。他对美国的两次大规模动员有深远影响。
The influence of Gandhi on the civil rights movement actually started well before the Rev. Martin Luther King's embrace of his ideals, with African-American activists such as Howard Thurman and Benjamin Mays undertaking long sea voyages to India to meet Gandhi.	其实在马丁·路德·金采用甘地的观念之前，甘地对公民权运动早已产生影响，霍华德·瑟曼及本杰明·梅斯等非裔美国活动家都曾远渡重洋，前往印度探访甘地。
And Cesar Chavez, who modeled many of his tactics on Gandhi's in leading the farmworkers" movement, traced his political awakening to a newsreel he watched at the age of 11 or 12 showing that "this half-naked man without a gun had conquered the might of the British Empire."	塞萨尔·查韦斯很多引领农场工作者运动的策略，都是以甘地思想为摹本。查韦斯将自己的政治觉醒追溯到十一、二岁时看的一则新闻短片，片中“这位半裸的男人，没有枪，却征服了大英帝国。”
Outside the United States, Gandhi had a similar effect. Nelson Mandela, the Dalai Lama, Nobel Peace Prize-winner Malala Yousafzai and climate change activists, to give just a few examples, have acknowledged Gandhi as a guiding light.	在美国以外地区，甘地也有类似的影响力。很多人以甘地为指明灯，其中有纳尔逊·曼德拉、达赖喇嘛、诺贝尔和平奖获得者马拉拉·优素福·扎伊及气候变化活动家。
But President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who triumphantly addressed a joint mega-rally in Houston recently, seem to be impervious to Gandhi's ideas, despite paying lip service to him at the event. Both are right-wing populists who have ruled with scant compassion or tolerance, successfully mobilizing whites and Hindus in their respective countries as voting blocs, and fomenting division and social antagonism.	然而，近日美国总统特朗普和印度总理莫迪在休斯顿隆重举办了一场联合大型集会。尽管他们在会上奉承甘地，但似乎对甘地的思想无动于衷。两人都是右翼民粹主义者，其统治方式罕有同情或宽容。他们成功动员本国白人及印度人成为自己的投票群体，挑起分裂及社会对立。
Modi has belonged, since he was 8 years old, to a Hindu nationalist organization known as the RSS, an ex-member of which, Nathuram Godse, assassinated Gandhi on Jan. 30, 1948. Indeed, parliamentarians from Modi's ruling Bharatiya Janata Party have heaped praise on Gandhi's killer in recent years.	莫迪自八岁起就参与印度国民志愿服务团RSS。该团体前成员纳图拉姆·古德斯于1948年1月30日暗杀甘地。实际上，莫迪执政的巴拉迪亚·贾纳塔党议员近年来对暗杀甘地之人赞誉有加。
The Modi government's un-Gandhian approach has manifested itself on many fronts. It has stripped the Muslim-majority province of Jammu and Kashmir of its autonomy and statehood and put it into lockdown. It has proven unwelcoming to the mostly Muslim Rohingya refugees who have fled from extreme persecution in Myanmar.	莫迪政府的非甘地策略已在多方面显露无遗。政府剥夺了穆斯林大省克什米尔的自治权及国家地位，并对其进行封锁。事实证明，大多逃离缅甸迫害的穆斯林罗兴亚难民，对此并不欢迎。
And Modi's government has created an uproar by instituting a national registry of citizens and setting up detention camps in the border state of Assam to ostensibly catch noncitizens from neighboring Muslim-majority Bangladesh, a step that may end up disenfranchising and imprisoning almost 2 million people.	莫迪政府还推出全国公民登记册，在边境阿萨姆建立拘留营，表面上是从邻国孟加拉的穆斯林地区逮捕非公民。这一决策可能导致近两百万人失去公民权及入狱，故而引发轩然大波。
Trump is singing from a similar songbook. His administration's Muslim-majority travel ban echoes the Islamophobia that often informs Modi's policymaking. Its callousness toward refugees mirrors the Indian government's disdain for the Rohingya population's suffering, and its detention camps parallel the ones the Modi regime is setting up. Trump's stirring of racial animosity is analogous to troublesome rhetoric from a number of Modi's cabinet members.	特朗普之举如出一辙。其政府实施的穆斯林旅行禁令与恐伊症相呼应，而莫迪政策也常以恐伊为导向。该政策对难民的冷酷无情，正如印度政府蔑视罗兴亚人遭遇，而拘留营的设置，也与莫迪政权类似。特朗普煽动种族仇恨，也接近莫迪内阁成员一些令人反感的言论。
There was a teachable moment for the two leaders at their recent joint rally. House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer at the event quoted Gandhi's definition of democracy as "something that gives the weak the same chance as the strong."	这两位领导人最近的联合集会中，有一个时刻颇有教育意义。众议院多数党领袖斯特尼·霍耶在会上引用了甘地对民主的定义：“给弱者和强者同等机会。”
Trump and Modi would do very well to keep Gandhi's advice in mind, 150 years after his birth.	在甘地出生150年之后，特朗普和莫迪必将牢记甘地的建议。
Trump nominates Peter Gaynor to be FEMA chief: White House	白宫消息：特朗普提名彼得·盖诺为下一任FEMA局长
Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Acting Administrator Peter Gaynor smiles as he testifies before a Senate Appropriations Homeland Security Subcommittee hearing on FEMA's FY2020 budget request on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., April 3, 2019.	美国联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）代理主管彼得·盖诺（Peter Gaynor）于2019年4月3日在美国华盛顿国会山参议院国土安全拨款小组委员会关于FEMA2020税年预算请求的听证会上作证时，面带笑容。
U.S. President Donald Trump nominated Peter Gaynor on Thursday to head the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), the White House said in a statement.	美国总统唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump）于星期四提名彼得·盖诺为FEMA局长，白宫在一讲话中表示。
Gaynor, FEMA's deputy administrator, had been acting chief of the agency, which oversees the government response to disasters like hurricanes and wildfires.	FEMA主管政府部门如何应对紧急事件如飓风和野火。盖诺现为FEMA副主管，也曾代理该部门局长一职。
The agency has been without a Senate-confirmed administrator since March, when Brock Long left the post. Long resigned after the Department of Homeland Security, under which FEMA falls, concluded Long had inappropriately used government vehicles to commute between Washington and his home in North Carolina.	3月布罗克·朗（Brock Long）离任后，参议院一直未确认该部门的主管人选。FEMA隶属的国土安全部（Department of Homeland Security）认定布罗克滥用公车往返于华盛顿和其位于北卡罗来纳州的住所，其因此辞职。
A different nominee for the job, Jeffrey Byard, was withdrawn from consideration earlier this month, after a background check uncovered allegations that he had been involved in a barroom brawl.	该职位的另一候选人杰弗里·拜厄德（Jeffrey Byard）因背景调查中有参与酒吧斗殴的指控记录而在本月早些时候被取消提名资格。
Gaynor's nomination to the post was expected. He will require a majority of the Senate to approve the nomination to take the job.	盖诺被提名已在意料之中。他需要参议院多数人对此提名的同意，才可任职。
Before becoming FEMA's deputy administrator in 2018, Gaynor worked in emergency management in Rhode Island and was a Marine, the White House said.	2018年担任FEMA副主管前，盖诺曾就职于罗德岛紧急事务管理部门，也是一位海军陆战队队员，白宫表示。
Man set alight on doorstep 'in targeted attack'	“针对性袭击”中男子在门阶前被点燃
A man has been set alight on his doorstep in what police believe is a targeted attack.	一名男性在自家门阶前被点燃，警方认为这是一起有针对性的袭击。
The 48-year-old was soaked in flammable liquid, believed to be petrol, before bursting into flames outside his home in Skelmersdale, West Lancashire.	这名48岁的男子被浸泡在疑似汽油的易燃液体中，随即在西兰开夏郡斯凯默斯戴尔自家房屋门口燃烧起来。
He is in hospital in a critical but stable condition after suffering serious burns.	严重烧伤后，他目前住院治疗，情况危急但已稳定。
Police have launched an attempted murder inquiry after they were called to the man's house at about 1am on Thursday.	警方于周四凌晨一点接到报警，来到该男子家，并以谋杀未遂案展开调查。
Detective Chief Inspector Pauline Stables, leading the investigation, said: "This is a horrific incident which has left a man in a very poorly condition in hospital.	负责此次调查的侦探总督察Pauline Stables说：“这起事件太可怕了，导致了一名男子现在躺在医院，情况很糟。”

Vulnerable Dems air impeachment concerns to Pelosi	弱势民主党人就弹劾问题向佩洛西表达看法
During the meeting, several members made clear their stance that Democrats should keep the inquiry focused on the Ukraine matter -- allegations that Trump asked the Ukrainian President to initiate an investigation into a potential 2020 political rival -- and not the other instances of potential wrongdoing detailed in the report from special counsel Robert Mueller.	会议期间，几位成员明确表示了他们的立场，即民主党人应继续将调查重点放在乌克兰“电话门”事件上，指控特朗普要求乌克兰总统调查2020大选潜在政治对手，而非放在特别顾问罗伯特·穆勒（Robert Mueller）在报告中详细列举的其他可能的不当行为上。
Democrats are largely in agreement about the strategy, with Pelosi saying during her press conference on Thursday morning that the whistleblower complaint is "the focus of the moment."	民主党人很大程度上同意这一策略，佩洛西（Pelosi）在周四上午的新闻发布会上说，举报信是“当下的重点”。
By keeping the impeachment inquiry focused, leaders hope to keep the caucus unified -- with an eye to the moderate members who only recently joined calls for proceedings. The Ukraine matter is also relatively clear-cut and easy to explain to the public, lawmakers say. They also argue the probe, spearheaded by the intelligence committee, will be able to move faster -- possibly in the next month or two -- with a narrower scope.	考虑到最近才加入的温和派，领导人们希望通过保持弹劾调查重点不变来保证核心小组的统一一致。议员们说，乌克兰“电话门”事件相对明确，较容易向公众解释。他们还提出理由说，情报委员会带头调查，缩小范围，速度会更快——可能在未来一两个月内。
Rep. Angie Craig, a vulnerable freshman Democrat from Minnesota, who said earlier this week that she supported the impeachment inquiry said after the meeting that Pelosi and Democratic leaders mostly listened to the views raised by the lawmakers.	来自明尼苏达州的弱势新民主党众议员安吉·克雷格（Angie Craig）在本周早些时候表示支持弹劾调查，她在会议结束后说佩洛西和民主党领导人很大程度上听取了议员们的意见。
"I'm in a district where I've been reluctant to move forward only from the perspective where I want to be disciplined, I want to look at due process and want to make sure we get all of our facts -- and this process will allow us to do that," Craig said, adding she backed a narrow probe led by the House Intelligence Committee.	“由于我所在的选区，我不愿意仅仅从想当然的角度出发，我想仔细研究正当法律程序，确保我们了解所有事实——而这一程序可以使我们做到这点。”克雷格说道，并补充说，她支持由众议院情报委员会带头进行缩小范围的调查。
Rep. Matt Cartwright, a Democrat from Pennsylvania, told CNN that he wouldn't -- at this point -- vote for articles of impeachment.	来自宾夕法尼亚州的民主党众议员马特·卡特赖特（Matt Cartwright）告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNN），此时此刻他不会赞成弹劾条款。

Democrats will hear from constituents about their moves toward impeachment soon, with members scheduled to return to their districts for a two-week recess at the start of October. It will be the first time a swath of members from more conservative districts will receive clear, in-person feedback -- or, in some cases, blowback -- from the people they represent since they joined calls for impeachment proceedings in the wake of the Ukraine allegations earlier this week.	议员们计划在十月回到各自的选区休息两周，因此很快民主党人就将从选民那里得知他们对弹劾的看法。这对于来自保守地区的一大批议员来说，将是他们自本周早些时候加入乌克兰“电话门”指控弹劾程序后，首次从他们所代表的选民那里获得亲身明确的反馈——也有可能是批评。
But Rep. Dan Kildee, a Michigan Democrat, said the timing of the recess has its upsides.	然而，密歇根州民主党众议员丹·基尔迪（Dan Kildee）说，这样的休息时间安排也是有好处的。
"I really can't think of a better thing to do than to sort of check in with the boss before we move forward," he told reporters. "It's actually good timing that we get a chance to go home, catch our breath, get the perspective of people back home, explain what we're doing, and then come back and move forward accordingly."	“能与衣食父母交流是最好的事了，”他告诉记者，“这其实是个非常好的时机，我们能回家，休息片刻，了解家乡人们的想法，向大家解释我们正在做什么，再回来，根据我们两周的收获，继续往前走。“
Once lawmakers return, though, movement is likely to be quick.	一旦议员从家乡返回后，进程则可能会加快。

More than half the members of the US House of Representatives have said they support an impeachment inquiry, according to a CNN count. Other details about what efforts were taken to move the records are not immediately known, beyond the allegations contained in the whistleblower complaint about that call.	除了检举人对这次通话的指控外，其他为了转移记录所做工作的细节，还无法立刻明确。
The whistleblower complaint, which was declassified by the Trump administration and released to the public on Thursday by the House Intelligence Committee, alleges that White House officials said they were "directed" by White House attorneys to remove the transcript of the call from the computer system where they are normally kept.	这份被特朗普政府解密，并在周四由美国众议院情报委员会公之于众的检举人指控书表示，白宫官员称，他们在白宫律师的“指示”下，将这份通话记录从平时保存的电脑系统中删除了。
The whistleblower alleged that the transcript was kept on a different system normally used for classified information. The whistleblower also said that, according to White House officials, it was "not the first time" a presidential transcript was placed into this system in order to protect politically sensitive information and not national security-sensitive information. The complaint alleged that the White House tried to "restrict access" to records of the call.	检举人称，记录被保存在另一个通常用于加密信息的系统中。检举人还说，白宫官员表示，为了保护政治敏感信息和非国家安全相关的信息，这“不是第一次”将总统的记录放在这个系统中。指控书称，白宫试图“限制访问”这份通话记录。
"In the days following the phone call, I learned from multiple U.S. officials that senior White House officials had intervened to "lock down" all records of the phone call, especially the official word-for-word transcript of the call that was produced - as customary - by the White House Situation Room," the whistleblower stated.	“在通话后的几天里，我从多名美国官员处得知，白宫高层官员已经介入，将这次通话的所有记录全部‘封锁’，特别是白宫战情室（按照惯例）制作的，对这次通话逐字逐句的官方记录。”检举人表示。

According to Wang's mother and lawyer, he died on Monday. The police officer on the phone did not offer any explanation of the cause of death.	据王美余母亲及律师所言，王美余死于周一。他的妻子曹曙霞接到警方电话，得知丈夫死于衡阳市军用医院。衡阳市正是王美余羁押处。
According to Minsheng Guancha, a Chinese human rights group, Cao was later able to see Wang's body and saw he was bleeding from his eyes, mouth, ears and nose and there were bruises on his face.	据中国人权组织民生观察报道，曹曙霞后来见到丈夫尸身七孔流血，面部有瘀伤。
"The Chinese government must investigate allegations of torture and the death in detention of human rights activist Wang Meiyu and hold the perpetrators of torture and extrajudicial killing criminally accountable," the Chinese Human Rights Defenders (CHRD) said in a statement.	中国人权捍卫者（CHRD）表示：“中国政府必须调查关于维权人士王美余在拘留期间受刑致死的指控，对使用酷刑及法外处决的肇事者追究刑事责任。”
According to Radio Free Asia, Cao said police pressured her to accept their statement that Wang's death had been an accident but she refused. "Giving compensation without an investigation or criminal accountability for the perpetrator is not true redress nor will it effectively prevent torture," said Frances Eve, deputy director of research at CHRD.	中国人权捍卫者副主任法兰茜表示：“给予赔偿金，而不进行调查或追究肇事者刑事责任，就不是真正的赔偿，也不利于有效阴止用刑。“
"Especially when a family has effectively been held hostage and thus likely coerced into giving up claims for investigation for the compensation."	“尤其是家属实际上已被挟持为人质时，他们可能因受到胁迫而接受赔偿，放弃追查。”
Wang's death follows after those of other activists including grassroots lawyer Ji Sizun, who died in police custody in July, Uighur scholar Muhammad Salih Hajim who died last year. Nobel laureate winner Liu Xiaobo who was denied cancer treatment died in 2017 while serving an 11-year-prison sentence and activist Cao Shunli died in 2014, detained after attempting to attend a UN session on human rights in China.	王美余之死，步其他数位维权人士之后尘，其中包括7月在警方拘留下死亡的草根律师纪斯尊，以及去年死亡的维吾尔学者穆罕默德·萨利赫·阿吉。诺贝尔奖获得者刘晓波在11年有期徒刑服刑期间，要求接受癌症治疗被拒，死于2017年。活动家曹顺利试图参联合国人权会议，在中国被羁押，死于2014年。
Since Monday, Wang's family has been placed under house arrest, according to CHRD. He has two young children. Others connected to his case have also come under pressure. Wang, who began his work as an activist when his home was forcibly demolished, has been detained and claimed to have suffered torture before.	王美余是在其住房遭到强拆之后开始他的活动家生涯，他过去也曾被拘留，并称遭受酷刑。
In 2018 after he held up the placard calling for Xi's resignation, he wrote online of how police stormed into his home, ordering him to write a confession letter and a statement promising he would stop.	2018年他举牌要求习近平下台之后，他在网上记录了警方如何涌入他家，命他写下悔过书和保证书，保证永不再犯。
"These idiots. They can't understand that even after these years of persecution, including being deprived of water for three days or suffering two hours of electrical needles that caused me to vomit blood, I won't surrender."	“这些脑残。他们也不想想，这些年他们怎样折磨我，甚至三天三夜滴水都未沾，再用电针折磨我两个来小时，害得我口吐鲜血。我不会屈服。”

Owners can face heavy on-the-spot fines if they fail to provide basics like shelter, food and water. People who confine dogs for 24 hours must also allow them to move freely for the next two hours or face prosecution.	主人如果不能为宠物狗提供基本所需，如住所、食物、饮水，将面临当场的巨额罚金。宠物狗被关24小时后，主人须让其自由活动两小时，不然将面临指控。

Nestle tightens controls on coffee beans after weedkiller scare	除草剂恐慌后，雀巢加强咖啡豆品控
The world's largest coffee company said in a statement Friday that it had found glyphosate residues close to the maximum allowed in some deliveries of green coffee beans.	这家全球最大的咖啡公司在周五的一份声明中说，部分交付的生咖啡豆中发现草甘膦的残留量已接近监管限制。
Glyphosate is the key ingredient in Monsanto's weedkiller, Roundup. In the United States, juries have awarded huge monetary damages to people who say their cancer was caused by exposure to glyphosate. Bayer, which owns Monsanto, says the herbicide is safe when used properly, as does the US Environmental Protection Agency.	草甘膦是孟山都（Monsanto）除草剂农达（Roundup）的关键成分。在美国，由于接触草甘膦导致的癌症，陪审团均已裁定大额金钱赔偿。孟山都的母公司拜耳公司表示，该除草剂在正确使用的情况下是安全的。此说法同样得到美国国家环境保护局的确认。
Neumann Kaffee Gruppe (NKG), one of the world's largest traders, said glyphosate was one of a number of substances it monitored on the coffee it buys. Nestle buys some of its coffee beans from NKG. It was too early to say what consequences Nestle's tighter controls would have on NKG, a spokesperson said.	世界最大贸易商之一的诺伊曼咖啡集团（Neumann Kaffee Gruppe）表示，草甘膦是他们采购咖啡时监测的众多物质之一。部分雀巢咖啡豆购买自诺依曼集团。一位发言人说，现在判断雀巢加强品控对诺依曼有何影响还为时尚早。
Nestle's (NSRGF) decision to increase the frequency of checks was unlikely to disrupt global coffee supply chains, a spokesperson said. "This is not a new process, we are just reinforcing controls," the spokesperson told CNN Business. Tests were done before the coffee was shipped from the countries of origin.	雀巢一位发言人表示，雀巢决定增加检查频率不太可能影响全球咖啡供应链。这位发言人告诉CNN商业（CNN Business），“这不是一道新程序，我们只是加强了控制。”咖啡从原产国运出之前就已经过各种测验。
Nestle would start with suppliers in Indonesia and Brazil, since these countries are among the world's biggest coffee producers.	雀巢这一决定会从印尼和巴西的供货商开始执行，因为这些国家是全球最大的咖啡生产国之一。
"Our agronomists will continue to work with coffee farmers to help them improve their weed management practices, including the appropriate use of herbicides and adoption of other weeding methods," the Swiss company said.	这家瑞士公司表示：“我们的农业学专家会继续与咖啡农合作，帮助他们改进杂草管理手段，包括如何合理使用除草剂和试用其他除草方法。“
Brands such as Nescafe and Nespresso make up a sizable chunk of Nestle's powdered and liquid beverages business, which generated sales of 21.6 billion Swiss francs ($21.7 billion) in 2018. Nestle last year agreed a deal to sell Starbucks' packaged coffees and teas around the world.	包括雀巢速溶（Nescafe）和雀巢胶囊（Nespresso）在内的雀巢子品牌在雀巢的粉状和液态饮料业务中占比巨大，2018年销售额达216亿瑞士法郎（217亿美元）。雀巢去年达成一项交易，将在全球范围内出售星巴克袋装咖啡和袋泡茶。
Does glyphosate cause cancer?	草甘膦是否致癌？
Glyphosate is used on more than 100 food crops, according to the EPA. Scientists at an environmental advocacy group with links to the organic food industry say several popular breakfast cereals contain doses of the chemical that are higher than they consider safe for children.	根据美国环保局，草甘膦被用于至少100多粮食作物上。一家与有机食品产业相关的环保倡导组织的科学家说，几款流行的早餐谷物中所含的化学物质超出对儿童的安全剂量。
Still, the EPA says glyphosate is not a carcinogen and that it poses no public health risks. Ecological risks include damage to pollinators and the problem of weed resistance, the EPA said in a statement in April.	同时，环保局表示草甘膦不是致癌物，不会威胁公众健康。环境保护局在四月的一份声明中说，草甘膦的生态风险包括危害传粉昆虫以及杂草耐药性问题。
But that has not stopped thousands of people from filing lawsuits against Monsanto alleging that exposure to Roundup caused them or their loved ones to develop cancer.	但这并没有阻止成千上万的人对孟山都提起诉讼，指控接触农达产品导致他们自己或亲人患上癌症。
Earlier this year, a jury ordered Bayer to pay a California couple $2 billion in damages after they claimed that Roundup, used on their property for more than three decades, had given them both Non-Hodgkin lymphoma within four years of one other. Bayer is contesting the verdict.	今年早些时候，陪审团裁定拜耳向加州一对夫妇支付20亿美元的赔偿，这对夫妻声称他们在花园中使用农达超过30年，这让两人在四年内相继患上非霍奇金淋巴瘤。拜耳就此裁定提出异议。
A 2015 study by the World Health Organization's International Agency for Research on Cancer found that glyphosate was "probably carcinogenic to humans," based on "limited" evidence of cancer in humans and "sufficient" evidence of cancer in experimental animals. However, a joint panel of the WHO and the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization later concluded that glyphosate is unlikely to pose a carcinogenic risk to humans from exposure through diet.	世卫组织国际癌症研究机构2015年的一项研究发现，草甘膦“可能对人类致癌”，研究依据“有限的”人类癌症证据和“充足的”实验动物癌症证据。然而，世卫组织和联合国粮农组织的一次联合小组讨论却得出结论，草甘膦不太可能通过日常饮食对人类产生致癌风险。

A Utah man was convicted Thursday of killing six members of his extended family in Texas and faces the possibility of a death sentence.	一犹他州男子于星期四被指控杀害其小姨住在得克萨斯州的一家六口，并可能面临死刑。

Police have said that Haskell traveled from California to the Houston suburb of Spring and ambushed his ex-wife's sister, her husband and their five children in their home.	警方称，哈斯克尔从加利福尼亚前往休斯敦斯普林郊区，袭杀小姨及其丈夫，以及在家的五个孩子。
The Stays and four of their children were fatally shot in the back of their heads, and a fifth child, who was 15 at the time, survived. That teen, Cassidy, was grazed in the head by a bullet and played dead.	斯德夫妇及其四个孩子后脑中枪死亡，另一15岁的孩子则幸免于难。这个名叫卡西迪的少女脑部被子弹擦伤，倒下装死才逃过一劫。
Prosecutors are seeking the death penalty in the capital murder case, but jurors will decide whether Haskell should receive a death sentence or life in prison.	控方要求本蓄意谋杀案以死刑判处，但陪审团将决定哈斯克尔被判死刑还是终身监禁。
At trial, the defense argued that Haskell was insane and heard voices that led him to kill the six people, NBC affiliate KPRC of Houston reported. After the verdict was read Thursday, he hung his head.	审判时，辩方认为哈斯克尔心智失常，并产生幻听才致使六人被杀，NBC子公司KPRC休斯敦报道。星期四，判决书宣读完后，被告感到无地自容。
"I think he took it as best as you could expect," said Doug Durham, one of Haskell's defense attorneys, according to the station. "He was aware that this was a strong possibility."	“我看得出他很清楚状况，”道格·德拉姆（Doug Durham）说道，其是哈斯克尔的辩方律师，据KPRC报道。“他清楚自己完全可能被判死刑。”
The sentencing phase begins Monday. Haskell defense attorney Neil Davis III said his team will work "to save his life. That's our job," according to KPRC.	判决期开始于星期一。哈斯克尔的辩方律师尼尔·戴维斯（Neil Davis III ）表示，“辩方会尽力保住被告的性命。这是我们的本职，”据KPRC报道。

Haskell was disguised as a FedEx delivery driver when he went to the Stay home, apparently looking for his ex-wife, who is Katie Stay's sister.	哈斯克尔伪装成联邦快递公司的送货员工，前往斯德住所，明显是为寻找其前妻（凯蒂·斯德的姐姐）。
He forced his way inside and tied up Cassidy, officials said. When the rest of her family returned minutes later, Haskell tied them up and demanded to know the whereabouts of his ex-wife. They said they didn't know, and they were each shot in the back of the head.	他强行闯入并将卡西迪绑住，官方称。不久，当卡西迪全家返回家中时，哈斯克尔将其全部绑住，并质问其前妻的去向。受害者表示不知情后，后脑均中枪。
Cassidy, who was wounded, played dead until Haskell left, and was able to identify him to police. She told officials he was planning to drive to her grandparents' home and kill them. But police tracked down Haskell, and he was arrested after a 20-minute police chase and a three-hour standoff.	卡西迪受伤后便倒地装死，直到哈斯克尔离开。她因此成为警方查出凶犯的关键所在。她告诉警方，凶手计划驱车前往她祖父母家并意图行凶杀人。但警方已获取到哈斯克尔的行踪，经历20分钟的追捕和3小时的对峙后，最终将其擒获。
US deaths could result in Scottish ban on vaping and e-cigarette ads	美国死亡事件可能导致苏格兰禁止电子烟广告
A BAN on advertising for e-cigarettes and vaping products, is being considered by ministers.	各部长正在考虑禁止对电子烟和电子烟产品的广告宣传。
The First Minister has confirmed that a consultation on the move would take place in "the coming months."	首席大臣已经确认，将在“接下来的几个月里”就此举进行协商。
Nicola Sturgeon says that if evidence supports further moves over the sale of such products her Government would "not hesitate" to act.	尼古拉·斯特尔根说，如果有证据支持应对此类产品的销售采取进一步行动，政府会“毫不犹豫”地这么做。
It comes as it emerged a vaping-related illness had claimed two more lives, bringing the total number of fatalities to 11.	起因是一种与电子烟相关的疾病导致两人死亡，使死亡总人数达到11人。
Vaping - which involves inhaling a mix typically made of nicotine, water, solvents and flavours - is seen as an alternative to smoking which can help you quit, but its safety is still not entirely known.	电子烟——即吸入通常由尼古丁、水、有机溶剂和香料组成的混合物——被视为吸烟的替代品，它能帮助你戒烟，但其安全性尚未完全明确。
But in the US, more than 500 people are known to have fallen ill with a mysterious lung disease after smoking e-cigarettes. Officials said hundreds of additional cases had been reported in the past week alone.	但在美国，已知有超过500人在吸食电子烟后患上了一种神秘的肺部疾病。官员称，仅过去一周就报告了数百起新增病例。
The first deaths in Florida and Georgia were announced on Tuesday and Wednesday. Currently 38 states have recorded cases of the illness, with lives lost in eight states.	弗罗里达州和乔治亚州在周二和周三分别宣布了首例死亡病例。目前，有38州有记录在案的病例，有8州出现病人死亡。
While most patients have reported a history of using products containing THC, the psychoactive compound in cannabis, the patient who died in Georgia on Wednesday reported only "heavy nicotine vaping."	虽然大多数患者都报告说曾使用含THC（一种作用于神经的大麻复合物）的产品，但周三死于乔治亚州的患者却报告说只有“重度吸食尼古丁电子烟”。
The Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has more than 100 officials investigating the cause of the mystery illness, and has warned citizens against smoking e-cigarette products until more is known, particularly if modified or bought "off the street."	美国疾病控制与预防中心(CDC)有100多名官员正在调查这种神秘疾病的原因，并警告市民，在情况更加明了之前，不要吸食电子烟产品，尤其是经过改装或者在“街头”买来的电子烟。
The First Minister has confirmed the Scottish Government was monitorigin developments in the US and elsewhere "closely," following the loss of life that has been attributed to vaping.	首席大臣证实，在发生电子烟导致的死亡后，苏格兰政府正在“密切”关注美国和其他地区的事态发展。
She pointed out that to date they have not seen any cases of deaths attributed to vaping being reported in Europe.	她指出，到目前为止，欧洲还没有报告任何与电子烟有关的死亡病例。
"Our approach has been a precautionary one, which is why in Scotland we have already taken the strictest regulatory approach in Europe to vapour products," she said.	她说，“我们的做法是防患于未然，这就是为什么在苏格兰，我们对电子烟产品采取了欧洲最严格的监管方式。”
"The European tobacco products directive restricts the advertising of e-cigarettes and ensures that e-liquids cannot contain ingredients that are known to be harmful.	“欧洲烟草产品规定限制了电子烟的广告宣传，并确保电子烟烟油不能包含已知的有害成分。
"The directive also limits the concentration of nicotine in e-liquids.	“该规定还限制了烟油中的尼古丁含量。
"In Scotland, we have also introduced a retail register and a mandatory age verification scheme and we have funded trading standards departments in all council areas to ensure that retailers comply with the regulations.	“在苏格兰，我们还推出了零售商注册和强制年龄验证方案，并且资助了所有议会地区的贸易标准部门，确保零售商遵守这些规定。
"In the coming months, we will consult on introducing a complete ban on the advertising and promotion of vapour products."	“在接下来的几个月里，我们将就全面禁止电子烟产品的宣传和推广进行协商。”
She added: "It is important to stress, and for all of us to remember, that those devices are relatively new and, therefore, their impact continues to be studied. We do not yet fully understand what that impact is, which is why the approach that we have taken has been very cautious.	她补充说：“我们必须强调，并且都应该记住的一点是，这些设备相对较新，因此，其影响还在研究中。我们还不完全了解这种影响是什么，所以我们采取的方法一直非常谨慎。
"That is perhaps a reason why e-cigarette use remains relatively low in Scotland.	“这也可能是为什么电子烟在苏格兰的使用量一直相对较低的原因之一。
"We remain committed to following the best evidence to take any steps necessary to ensure that people are protected from potential harm.	“我们一直致力于遵循最佳的证据，采取一切必须的措施，以确保人们免受可能的伤害。”
"While we already have among the strictest regimes on those products, if the evidence shows that further action is needed... we will not hesitate to take it."	“尽管我们已经是对此类产品最为严格的国家之一，如果证据显示需要进一步的行动……我们会毫不犹豫地这么做。”
Cambodian court charges exiled politicians with rebellion	柬埔寨法庭指控流亡政客叛乱
A Cambodian court has charged seven top opposition politicians with plotting armed rebellion for planning to return from self-imposed exile to seek a change in government through mass peaceful protests.	柬埔寨一家法庭对七名反对派首要政客提出诉讼，指控他们密谋武装判乱，计划在流亡后回国，通过大规模和平抗议来改换政府。
The Phnom Penh Municipal Court also warned that anyone who supported the plans of the Cambodia National Rescue Party to oust the government would also be risking a long prison term.	金边市法院还发出警告，任何支持柬埔寨救国党计划，企图取代政府的人，都将面临长期监禁的风险。
The returning party chiefs could be sent to prison for 15 to 30 years if found guilty, and their supporters could be sentenced to five to 10 years. Even attending a rally or expressing support online could be considered plotting to topple the government, Justice Ministry spokesman Chin Malin was quoted as saying.	归国政党首领若判有罪，则入狱15到30年。他们的支持者可能判5-10年。据称，司法部发言人秦马林表示，即便只是参加集会或在网上表示支持也可视为企图推翻政府。
The court's charges on Thursday are the latest salvo in a political battle that has heated up since opposition leader Sam Rainsy announced plans to return from more than three years of exile on Nov. 9 to seek a "restoration of democracy."	反对党领袖桑良西宣布他在三年多流亡生活之后，将于11月9日返国，以“恢复民主”。政治战争自此愈演愈烈，此次法庭在周四提出的指控是最新发起的一次攻击。
Nov. 9 is Cambodia's independence day, celebrating when it obtained its freedom from France in 1953.	11月9日是柬埔寨独立日，庆祝1953年摆脱法国统治。
"My calls to the people and the armed forces of #Cambodia to rise up against the regime will continue until the regime has restored to the opposition its right to participate in the country's political life including genuine elections," Sam Rainsy said on Twitter earlier this week.	几天前，桑良西在推特上表示：“我将继续呼吁人民和#柬埔寨武装力量崛起反抗当今政权，直至该政权恢复反对党参与国家政治，包括真实选举的权力。”
His opposition party was dissolved by the courts ahead of last year's general election, ensuring that an increasingly authoritarian Prime Minister Hun Sen continued his four decades in power.	他带领的反对派在去年大选之前被法庭解散，以确保权力日盛的首相洪森能继续其四十年执政生涯。
The party had been expected to mount a strong challenge in the July 2018 election, and its dissolution was widely seen as being politically motivated, with Hun Sen's ruling Cambodian People's Party fearful that it could lose power in the polls.	救国党本应在2018年7月选举中成为强劲对手，其解散被普遍认为是出于政治动机，因为洪森带领的人民党害怕在投票中失去政权。
Hun Sen's government seems unnerved by the planned return of opposition politicians, though the effort appears to be a quixotic one, with Sam Rainsy calling on Cambodian workers in Thailand to accompany him home in massive numbers.	胡森政府似乎因反对派的归国计划感到慌张，而桑良西呼吁泰国的大批柬埔寨工人陪同他归国，使其努力显得不切实际。
Officials have vowed to arrest Sam Rainsy on his arrival, but there is speculation that Cambodia may simply bar him from entry, which could even keep him from boarding a plane to the country if airlines are officially informed of such a ban. Neighboring countries are also unlikely to allow him to enter from their territory.	政府官员已经起誓，桑良西一旦归国，便立即逮捕。不过，柬埔寨也有可能直接禁止他入境。如果对航空公司正式下达禁令，则桑良西根本无法登机。邻国也不太可能允许他入境。
However, the government has stepped up arrests of his supporters and there are reports of recent physical attacks on opposition organizers.	然而，政府已经加大力度，逮捕桑良西的支持者，并有报道称最近有反对派组织者遭到人身攻击。
Sam Rainsy went into exile in late 2015 to avoid a two-year prison sentence on charges of criminal defamation. Other legal cases have since been lodged against him by the government.	桑兰西2015年末开始流亡生涯，以避免因诽谤罪入狱两年。此后政府也对他提出其他法律诉讼。
Other top party members fled into exile during a late 2017 crackdown on all opposition to Hun Sen, which included the arrest of the party's co-founder, Kem Sokha. He was charged with treason, based on his links to a U.S. pro-democracy organization, and is under strict house arrest.	2017年末，有一场针对一切反对洪森人士的镇压行动，致使其他一些反对派首要领导人开始流亡。期间，建党人之一根索卡被捕。他因与美国亲民主组织的关联，被控叛国并软禁。
This year's Turner Prize-shortlisted pieces will be on display in Margate from tomorrow, with Brexit on the agenda.	今年的特纳奖入围作品明日起在马盖特展出，脱欧提上日程
Colombian artist Oscar Murillo's work "surge (social cataracts) " depicts people staring out to the North Sea, but with their view of the water and the European continent on the other side of it obscured by a dark canvas, with only a sliver of what lies beyond revealed through a slash in the canvas.	哥伦比亚艺术家奥斯卡·马里洛的作品“浪涌（社会白内障）”描绘了人们凝视北海的画面，但视线里的海水和另一面的欧洲大陆被黑色的画布遮住了，只通过画布上的缝隙将远处的景象露出来。
The work is one of four shortlisted entries to the prestigious and often contentious annual art prize, founded in 1984 and given to an artist residing in Britain or British-born but living elsewhere.	该奖项设立于1984年，是四个常常具有争议性的著名年度艺术奖之一，为居住在英国或者在英国出生、却在其他地方生活的艺术家而设立。
Curator Fiona Parry explains that Murillo's work focuses on the current political and socio-economic situation in the UK. The group of papier-mâché figures represent a globalised workforce, while the black cloth represents the "darkness of the contemporary moment in the UK and globally."	策划人菲欧娜·帕里解释说，马里洛的作品关注的是英国当前的政治和社会经济形势。这组纸雕人物代表着全球化的劳动力，而黑布则代表着“当代英国和全球的黑暗时刻”。
She added: "I think it's a broader idea of blocking the view, the outward-looking view, to anywhere really. And that gesture of blocking the light. But I guess there is still this sort of glimmer of hope, there is a slash in the canvas, and you can just see the sea on the horizon."	她补充说：“我觉得，这是表现格挡视线的一种更广阔的想法，看向任何地方的、向外看的视线。以及格挡光线的态势。但我猜想还有一线希望，画布上有一道缝隙，你可以看到地平线上的大海。”
Helen Cammock's video piece A Long Note, meanwhile, examines the overlooked role of women in the civil rights movement in Derry/Londonderry, Northern Ireland that began in 1968. The work also connects to broader global class, race and gender struggles during the late 1960s.	与此同时，海伦·凯默克的视频作品“漫长笔记”则探讨了女性在开始于1968年北爱尔兰德里/伦敦德里的人权运动中被忽视的作用。该作品还将20世纪60年代后期更广泛的全球阶级、种族和性别斗争联系在了一起。
All works will be exhibited at Margate's Turner Contemporary gallery, from 28 September to 12 January 2020, and the winner of the Turner Prize 2019 will be announced at a ceremony on 3 December.	所有作品将于9月28日至2020年1月12日在马盖特的特纳当代画廊展出，2019年的特纳奖得主将于12月3日在颁奖典礼上公布。
Named after 19th-century landscape painter JMW Turner, the award made stars of Grayson Perry, Damien Hirst and 12 Years a Slave director Steve McQueen.	该奖项以19世纪的风景画家JMW特纳的名字而命名，格雷森·佩里、达米恩·赫斯特和“为奴十二载”的导演史蒂夫·麦奎恩便因该奖项出名。

Pit bull dies of snake bites while protecting Florida boys	比特犬保护佛罗里达州男孩时被蛇咬死
A man in Florida says his family's 8-month-old pit bull Zeus died of snake bites as it was trying to protect his sons.	佛罗里达州一名男子说，家里一只8个月大的比特犬“宙斯”在试图保护他的儿子们时，被蛇咬伤而死。
Gary Richardson told WOFL-TV the boys were outside the family's home in Sumter County, Florida, on Monday, cleaning Zeus' water dish when the venomous coral snake slithered toward them. Richardson says the children didn't see the snake but the dog did and attacked it.	加里·理查德森告诉WOFL-TV，周一，在这家人位于佛罗里达州萨姆特郡的房子外，男孩们正在清理“宙斯”的水盆，此时一条珊瑚色的毒蛇向他们爬过来。理查德森说，孩子们并没有看到蛇，但狗看到并攻击了它。
Richardson says the snake bit Zeus four times. The dog was rushed to a veterinarian but he died a day after the attack.	理查德森说那条蛇咬了“宙斯”四次。他们立刻将狗送到兽医处，但它在遭到攻击一天后就去世了。
Germany reports landmark case of West Nile virus	德国报告西尼罗病毒标志性病例
Authorities are reporting the first known human case of West Nile virus transmitted by mosquitoes in Germany, a development apparently hastened by climate change.	当局报道，由蚊虫传播的西尼罗病毒在德国出现首例已知人类病例，气候变化显然加速了这一发展。
The national disease control and tropical medicine centers said Friday the person developed encephalitis but recovered after hospital treatment.	国家疾病控制和热带医学中心在周五表示，此人患上了脑炎，但在医院经治疗后痊愈。
The virus originated in Africa but has been spread northward by migratory birds and mosquitoes. There have been several outbreaks in southern and central Europe in recent years. It is found in much of the U.S.	这种病毒起源于非洲，但通过候鸟和蚊子向北传播，近几年已在欧洲南部和中部数次爆发。美国大部分地区也有发现。
Jonas Schmidt-Chanasit of Germany's Bernhard Nocht Institute tropical medicine center said that "the unusually warm summers of the last two years, triggered by climate change, apparently have contributed to WNV establishing itself north of the Alps."	德国伯纳德·诺赫研究所热带医学中心的乔纳斯·施密特-夏纳斯特表示，“气候变化引起了过去两年异常温暖的夏天，这显然导致了西尼罗病毒在阿尔卑斯以北地区的传播。”
The virus causes dangerous meningitis or encephalitis in less than 1% of those infected.	在少于1%的感染者中，这种病毒会引起危险的脑膜炎或者脑炎。
Men undergoing surgery for prostate cancer fare as well without radiotherapy	男性前列腺癌手术无放射治疗效果良好
Men undergoing surgery for prostate cancer fare just as well without radiotherapy, a major study has found.	一项重大研究发现，接受前列腺癌手术的男性即使不进行放射治疗，效果同样良好。
The findings, from the the largest ever trial examining those having surgery for the disease, could spare thousands from gruelling treatment which can have distressing side-effects.	研究结论来自至今为止针对接受手术患者进行的规模最大的一次试验，可使数千人免受痛苦的治疗及其副作用之苦。
The Royal Marsden study involved 1,400 men being treated for prostate cancer.	皇家马斯登癌症中心这项研究有1400名正在接受前列腺癌治疗的男性患者参与。
Half were given immediate radiotherapy, which until now has been standard treatment to prevent the return of disease. The rest were monitored and only given radiotherapy if there were signs that disease had returned.	一半患者根据现在预防疾病复发的标准治疗方案，立即给予放射治疗；另一半患者仅予以监测，仅在有迹象表明疾病复发时才予以放射治疗。
Scientists found that five years later, there was almost no difference in disease recurrence between the two groups, with those who did not have treatment faring slightly better.	科学家发现，五年后两组患者的疾病复发率几乎没有差异，未接受放射治疗组情况稍好。
Progression free survival was 85 per cent in the radiotherapy group and 88 per cent in the standard care group.	放疗组的疾病无恶化存活期为85%，标准治疗组为88%。
There was a difference of around 1 per cent between the groups, after data was adjusted to take account of other factors.	考虑其他因素对数据进行调整之后，组间差异约为1%。
The study, funded by Cancer Research UK, found those who had radiotherapy were twice as likely to suffer a worsening of urinary incontinence, one of the main side effects of prostate cancer treatment.	这项由英国癌症研究基金会资助的研究发现，接受放疗的患者尿失禁情况恶化的可能性是不接受放疗患者的2倍，而尿失禁是前列腺癌治疗的主要副作用之一。
One year after surgery 5.3 per cent of patients receiving radiotherapy suffered a deterioration, compared to 2.7 per cent who had standard care.	术后一年，接受放疗的患者中有5.3%情况恶化，而接受常规护理的患者中仅有2.7%情况恶化。

The tweet in question was sent earlier this month and the day it was sent, Dunlap hosted his show as usual. But the next day, he announced a leave of absence, CBS affiliate WWL-TV reports.	这条可疑的推特发送自本月早些时候，发送当天邓拉普和往常一样主持了节目。然而第二天，他宣布了请假，CBS旗下WWL-TV报道称。
In a statement, Dunlap said 14 people had access WWL's Twitter account. He claimed he was not one of the people with access to the account.	邓拉普在一次声明中说，有14个人拥有WWL推特帐号的访问权限。他声称自己并没有该帐号的访问权限。
However, he decided to take a polygraph test to dispel any speculation that he was the one who sent the tweet to himself, his lawyer Megan Kiefer, said. West Bengal Government Plans To Set Up Museum At Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's House	西孟加拉邦政府计划于伊斯瓦·昌德拉·维迪亚萨加故居设立博物馆
Kolkata:	加尔各答：
West Bengal government has plans to set up a museum at the north Kolkata house of 19th century social reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar where he had spent the last few years of his life, state minister Partha Chatterjee said.	西孟加拉邦政府已计划于19世纪社会改革家伊斯瓦·昌德拉·维迪亚萨加（Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar）位于北加尔各答的故居设立博物馆，其于此地度过了生命的最后几年，教育部长帕特·查特吉（Partha Chatterjee）表示。
The museum will come up at Vidyasagar's residence at Badur Bagan area where pictures and models, chronicling his life from his birth place at Birsinghapur village in Paschim Medinipur district to the house in north Kolkata, will be put on display, he said on Thursday.	博物馆将设于巴杜尔巴甘地区的维迪亚萨加故居内，馆内将展示各类图片和模型，讲述其从出生地西梅迪尼浦尔的比兴哈普尔（Birsinghapur）村庄到定居北加尔各答的一生，部长于星期四表示。
Mr Chatterjee, who is the education minister, said this at a function after inaugurating "Vidyasagar Academy" at the Badur Bagan residence on the 200th birth anniversary celebrations of the educational and social reformer.	教育部长查特吉表示，本馆将于“维迪亚萨加学院”正式成立后，在纪念这位社会和教育改革家200年诞辰之际，于巴杜尔巴甘故居向公众开放。
The minister also released two books, "Amader Vidyasagar" and "Chotoder Vidyasagar" at the programme.	教育部也为该项目出版了两部书籍——《Amader Vidyasagar》和《Chotoder Vidyasagar》。
Some items used by Vidyasagar, gathering dust in the storeroom of the house, will be brought out for public viewing at the museum.	某些尘封已久的维迪亚萨加使用过的物品，将从其故居储藏室移至馆内供公众参观。
This will help the present generation to know about the man, who had waged a war against women oppression and propagated widow remarriage, he said.	这将有助于当代人了解这位曾经为女性受压迫而奋起反抗并宣传支持丧偶女性再婚的伟人，部长表示。
The School Education and Higher Education department will organise seminars highlighting Vidaysagar's life and work in schools and colleges during a year-long programme, Mr Chatterjee said.	学校教育与高等教育部（The School Education and Higher Education）将于一年的项目期内举办多个研讨会，突出维迪亚萨加在学校和大学的生活工作经历，查特吉表示。
Listing other activities to be taken up by the academy, Mr Chatterjee said that a collection of hitherto unknown writings by Vidyasagar will be published.	学院也将组织其他活动，查特吉表示，还将出版维迪亚萨加迄今为止不为世人所知的文学作品集。
Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had recently announced that Vidyasagar's birthplace at Birsinghapur village will be developed as an educational tourist hub.	首席部长玛玛塔·班纳吉（Mamata Banerjee）最近宣布，维迪亚萨加出生地比兴哈普尔村庄将会开发为教育旅游中心。
On Thursday, a bronze statue of Vidyasagar was installed at Vidyasagar College.	星期四，维迪亚萨加铜像于维迪亚萨加大学（Vidyasagar College）落成。
"Those who are against the social reforms of Vidyasagar had vandalised his bust at the institution associated with his name," the minister said.	“维迪亚萨加社会改革的反对者蓄意破坏了在以这位伟人命名的大学内的其半身雕像，”首席部长说道。
A bust of the social reformer was vandalised during a road show of BJP chief Amit Shah in the city in May.	五月，印度人民党（BJP）主席阿米特·沙阿（Amit Shah）在当地举行路演期间，这位社会改革家的半身雕像遭到蓄意破坏。
